label: region
definition: A sequence_feature with an extent greater than zero. A nucleotide region is composed of bases and a polypeptide region is composed of amino acids.

label: sequence_secondary_structure
definition: A folded sequence.

label: G_quartet
definition: G-quartets are unusual nucleic acid structures consisting of a planar arrangement where each guanine is hydrogen bonded by hoogsteen pairing to another guanine in the quartet.

label: interior_coding_exon
definition: A coding exon that is not the most 3-prime or the most 5-prime in a given transcript.

label: satellite_DNA
definition: The many tandem repeats (identical or related) of a short basic repeating unit; many have a base composition or other property different from the genome average that allows them to be separated from the bulk (main band) genomic DNA.

label: PCR_product
definition: A region amplified by a PCR reaction.

label: read_pair
definition: One of a pair of sequencing reads in which the two members of the pair are related by originating at either end of a clone insert.

label: protein_coding
definition: A gene which, when transcribed, can be translated into a protein.

label: non_protein_coding
definition: A gene which can be transcribed, but will not be translated into a protein.

label: scRNA_primary_transcript
definition: The primary transcript of any one of several small cytoplasmic RNA molecules present in the cytoplasm and sometimes nucleus of a Eukaryote.

label: scRNA
definition: A small non coding RNA sequence, present in the cytoplasm.

label: INR_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters required for the correct positioning of the polymerase for the start of transcription. Overlaps the TSS. The mammalian consensus sequence is YYAN(T|A)YY; the Drosophila consensus sequence is TCA(G|T)t(T|C). In each the A is at position +1 with respect to the TSS. Functionally similar to the TATA box element.

label: DPE_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters; Positioned from +28 to +32 with respect to the TSS (+1). Experimental results suggest that the DPE acts in conjunction with the INR_motif to provide a binding site for TFIID in the absence of a TATA box to mediate transcription of TATA-less promoters. Consensus sequence (A|G)G(A|T)(C|T)(G|A|C).

label: BREu_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, located immediately upstream of some TATA box elements at -37 to -32 with respect to the TSS (+1). Consensus sequence is (G|C)(G|C)(G|A)CGCC. Binds TFIIB.

label: PSE_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of the promoters of snRNA genes transcribed by RNA polymerase II or by RNA polymerase III. Located between -45 and -60 relative to the TSS. The human PSE_motif consensus sequence is TCACCNTNA(C|G)TNAAAAG(T|G). The basal transcription factor, snRNA-activating protein complex (SNAPc), binds the PSE_motif and is required for the transcription of both RNA polymerase II and III transcribed small-nuclear RNA genes.

label: linkage_group
definition: A group of loci that can be grouped in a linear order representing the different degrees of linkage among the genes concerned.

label: RNA_internal_loop
definition: A region of double stranded RNA where the bases do not conform to WC base pairing. The loop is closed on both sides by canonical base pairing. If the interruption to base pairing occurs on one strand only, it is known as a bulge.

label: asymmetric_RNA_internal_loop
definition: An internal RNA loop where one of the strands includes more bases than the corresponding region on the other strand.

label: A_minor_RNA_motif
definition: A region forming a motif, composed of adenines, where the minor groove edges are inserted into the minor groove of another helix.

label: K_turn_RNA_motif
definition: The kink turn (K-turn) is an RNA structural motif that creates a sharp (~120 degree) bend between two continuous helices.

label: sarcin_like_RNA_motif
definition: A loop in ribosomal RNA containing the sites of attack for ricin and sarcin.

label: symmetric_RNA_internal_loop
definition: An internal RNA loop where the extent of the loop on both stands is the same size.

label: base_pair
definition: Two bases paired opposite each other by hydrogen bonds creating a secondary structure.

label: WC_base_pair
definition: The canonical base pair, where two bases interact via WC edges, with glycosidic bonds oriented cis relative to the axis of orientation.

label: sugar_edge_base_pair
definition: A type of non-canonical base-pairing.

label: aptamer
definition: DNA or RNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

label: DNA_aptamer
definition: DNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

label: RNA_aptamer
definition: RNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

label: morpholino_oligo
definition: Morpholino oligos are synthesized from four different Morpholino subunits, each of which contains one of the four genetic bases (A, C, G, T) linked to a 6-membered morpholine ring. Eighteen to 25 subunits of these four subunit types are joined in a specific order by non-ionic phosphorodiamidate intersubunit linkages to give a Morpholino.

label: riboswitch
definition: A riboswitch is a part of an mRNA that can act as a direct sensor of small molecules to control their own expression. A riboswitch is a cis element in the 5' end of an mRNA, that acts as a direct sensor of metabolites.

label: matrix_attachment_site
definition: A DNA region that is required for the binding of chromatin to the nuclear matrix.

label: locus_control_region
definition: A DNA region that includes DNAse hypersensitive sites located near a gene that confers the high-level, position-independent, and copy number-dependent expression to that gene.

label: match_set
definition: A collection of match parts.

label: match_part
definition: A part of a match, for example an hsp from blast is a match_part.

label: genomic_clone
definition: A clone of a DNA region of a genome.

label: sequence_operation
definition: An operation that can be applied to a sequence, that results in a change.

label: pseudogene_attribute
definition: An attribute of a pseudogene (SO:0000336).

label: processed_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene created via retrotranposition of the mRNA of a functional protein-coding parent gene followed by accumulation of deleterious mutations lacking introns and promoters, often including a polyA tail.

label: pseudogene_by_unequal_crossing_over
definition: A pseudogene caused by unequal crossing over at recombination.

label: delete
definition: To remove a subsection of sequence.

label: insert
definition: To insert a subsection of sequence.

label: invert
definition: To invert a subsection of sequence.

label: substitute
definition: To substitute a subsection of sequence for another.

label: translocate
definition: To translocate a subsection of sequence.

label: gene_part
definition: A part of a gene, that has no other route in the ontology back to region. This concept is necessary for logical inference as these parts must have the properties of region. It also allows us to associate all the parts of genes with a gene.

label: probe
definition: A DNA sequence used experimentally to detect the presence or absence of a complementary nucleic acid.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_regulatory_region
definition: A sequence_variant_effect which changes the regulatory region of a gene.

label: aneuploid
definition: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number.

label: hyperploid
definition: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number as extra chromosomes are present.

label: hypoploid
definition: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number as some chromosomes are missing.

label: operator
definition: A regulatory element of an operon to which activators or repressors bind thereby effecting translation of genes in that operon.

label: nuclease_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, of a nucleotide molecule, that interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues of a nuclease.

label: compound_chromosome_arm
definition: One arm of a compound chromosome.

label: restriction_enzyme_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in the nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues of a restriction enzyme.

label: deficient_intrachromosomal_transposition
definition: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby a translocation in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

label: deficient_interchromosomal_transposition
definition: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a translocation in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

label: free_chromosome_arm
definition: A chromosome structure variation whereby an arm exists as an individual chromosome element.

label: overlapping
definition: An attribute describing a gene that has a sequence that overlaps the sequence of another gene.

label: inside_intron
definition: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene.

label: inside_intron_antiparallel
definition: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene and on the opposite strand.

label: inside_intron_parallel
definition: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene and on the same strand.

label: five_prime_three_prime_overlap
definition: An attribute to describe a gene when the five prime region overlaps with another gene's 3' region.

label: five_prime_five_prime_overlap
definition: An attribute to describe a gene when the five prime region overlaps with another gene's five prime region.

label: three_prime_three_prime_overlap
definition: An attribute to describe a gene when the 3' region overlaps with another gene's 3' region.

label: three_prime_five_prime_overlap
definition: An attribute to describe a gene when the 3' region overlaps with another gene's 5' region.

label: antisense
definition: A region sequence that is complementary to a sequence of messenger RNA.

label: polycistronic_transcript
definition: A transcript that is polycistronic.

label: dicistronic_transcript
definition: A transcript that is dicistronic.

label: operon_member
definition: A gene that is a member of an operon, which is a set of genes transcribed together as a unit.

label: macronuclear_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the macronuclei of ciliates.

label: micronuclear_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the micronuclei of a cell.

label: nuclear_gene
definition: A gene from nuclear sequence.

label: mt_gene
definition: A gene located in mitochondrial sequence.

label: kinetoplast_gene
definition: A gene located in kinetoplast sequence.

label: plastid_gene
definition: A gene from plastid sequence.

label: apicoplast_gene
definition: A gene from apicoplast sequence.

label: ct_gene
definition: A gene from chloroplast sequence.

label: chromoplast_gene
definition: A gene from chromoplast_sequence.

label: cyanelle_gene
definition: A gene from cyanelle sequence.

label: leucoplast_gene
definition: A plastid gene from leucoplast sequence.

label: proplastid_gene
definition: A gene from proplastid sequence.

label: nucleomorph_gene
definition: A gene from nucleomorph sequence.

label: plasmid_gene
definition: A gene from plasmid sequence.

label: proviral_gene
definition: A gene from proviral sequence.

label: endogenous_retroviral_gene
definition: A proviral gene with origin endogenous retrovirus.

label: transposable_element
definition: A transposon or insertion sequence. An element that can insert in a variety of DNA sequences.

label: expressed_sequence_match
definition: A match to an EST or cDNA sequence.

label: clone_insert_end
definition: The end of the clone insert.

label: polypeptide
definition: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.

label: chromosome_arm
definition: A region of the chromosome between the centromere and the telomere. Human chromosomes have two arms, the p arm (short) and the q arm (long) which are separated from each other by the centromere.

label: sequencing_primer
definition: A single stranded oligo used for polymerase chain reaction.

label: mRNA_with_frameshift
definition: An mRNA with a frameshift.

label: sequence_variant_obs
definition: A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration.

label: sequence_feature
definition: Any extent of continuous biological sequence.

label: transposable_element_gene
definition: A gene encoded within a transposable element. For example gag, int, env and pol are the transposable element genes of the TY element in yeast.

label: primer
definition: An oligo to which new deoxyribonucleotides can be added by DNA polymerase.

label: proviral_region
definition: A viral sequence which has integrated into a host genome.

label: methylated_cytosine
definition: A methylated deoxy-cytosine.

label: edited
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that is modified by editing.

label: transcript_with_translational_frameshift
definition: A transcript with a translational frameshift.

label: regulated
definition: An attribute to describe a sequence that is regulated.

label: protein_coding_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript that, at least in part, encodes one or more proteins.

label: forward_primer
definition: A single stranded oligo used for polymerase chain reaction.

label: RNA_sequence_secondary_structure
definition: A folded RNA sequence.

label: transcriptionally_regulated
definition: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated at transcription.

label: transcriptionally_constitutive
definition: Expressed in relatively constant amounts without regard to cellular environmental conditions such as the concentration of a particular substrate.

label: transcriptionally_induced
definition: An inducer molecule is required for transcription to occur.

label: transcriptionally_repressed
definition: A repressor molecule is required for transcription to stop.

label: silenced_gene
definition: A gene that is silenced.

label: gene_silenced_by_DNA_modification
definition: A gene that is silenced by DNA modification.

label: gene_silenced_by_DNA_methylation
definition: A gene that is silenced by DNA methylation.

label: post_translationally_regulated
definition: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated after it has been translated.

label: translationally_regulated
definition: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated as it is translated.

label: reverse_primer
definition: A single stranded oligo used for polymerase chain reaction.

label: epigenetically_modified
definition: This attribute describes a gene where heritable changes other than those in the DNA sequence occur. These changes include: modification to the DNA (such as DNA methylation, the covalent modification of cytosine), and post-translational modification of histones.

label: genomically_imprinted
definition: Imprinted genes are epigenetically modified genes that are expressed monoallelically according to their parent of origin.

label: maternally_imprinted
definition: The maternal copy of the gene is modified, rendering it transcriptionally silent.

label: paternally_imprinted
definition: The paternal copy of the gene is modified, rendering it transcriptionally silent.

label: allelically_excluded
definition: Allelic exclusion is a process occurring in diploid organisms, where a gene is inactivated and not expressed in that cell.

label: gene_rearranged_at_DNA_level
definition: An epigenetically modified gene, rearranged at the DNA level.

label: ribosome_entry_site
definition: Region in mRNA where ribosome assembles.

label: attenuator
definition: A sequence segment located within the five prime end of an mRNA that causes premature termination of translation.

label: terminator
definition: The sequence of DNA located either at the end of the transcript that causes RNA polymerase to terminate transcription.

label: DNA_sequence_secondary_structure
definition: A folded DNA sequence.

label: assembly_component
definition: A region of known length which may be used to manufacture a longer region.

label: recoded_codon
definition: A codon that has been redefined at translation. The redefinition may be as a result of translational bypass, translational frameshifting or stop codon readthrough.

label: capped
definition: An attribute describing when a sequence, usually an mRNA is capped by the addition of a modified guanine nucleotide at the 5' end.

label: exon
definition: A region of the transcript sequence within a gene which is not removed from the primary RNA transcript by RNA splicing.

label: supercontig
definition: One or more contigs that have been ordered and oriented using end-read information. Contains gaps that are filled with N's.

label: contig
definition: A contiguous sequence derived from sequence assembly. Has no gaps, but may contain N's from unavailable bases.

label: read
definition: A sequence obtained from a single sequencing experiment. Typically a read is produced when a base calling program interprets information from a chromatogram trace file produced from a sequencing machine.

label: clone
definition: A piece of DNA that has been inserted in a vector so that it can be propagated in a host bacterium or some other organism.

label: YAC
definition: Yeast Artificial Chromosome, a vector constructed from the telomeric, centromeric, and replication origin sequences needed for replication in yeast cells.

label: BAC
definition: Bacterial Artificial Chromosome, a cloning vector that can be propagated as mini-chromosomes in a bacterial host.

label: PAC
definition: The P1-derived artificial chromosome are DNA constructs that are derived from the DNA of P1 bacteriophage. They can carry large amounts (about 100-300 kilobases) of other sequences for a variety of bioengineering purposes. It is one type of vector used to clone DNA fragments (100- to 300-kb insert size; average, 150 kb) in Escherichia coli cells.

label: plasmid
definition: A self replicating, using the hosts cellular machinery, often circular nucleic acid molecule that is distinct from a chromosome in the organism.

label: cosmid
definition: A cloning vector that is a hybrid of lambda phages and a plasmid that can be propagated as a plasmid or packaged as a phage,since they retain the lambda cos sites.

label: phagemid
definition: A plasmid which carries within its sequence a bacteriophage replication origin. When the host bacterium is infected with "helper" phage, a phagemid is replicated along with the phage DNA and packaged into phage capsids.

label: fosmid
definition: A cloning vector that utilizes the E. coli F factor.

label: deletion
definition: The point at which one or more contiguous nucleotides were excised.

label: lambda_clone
definition: A linear clone derived from lambda bacteriophage. The genes involved in the lysogenic pathway are removed from the from the viral DNA. Up to 25 kb of foreign DNA can then be inserted into the lambda genome.

label: methylated_adenine
definition: A modified base in which adenine has been methylated.

label: splice_site
definition: Consensus region of primary transcript bordering junction of splicing. A region that overlaps exactly 2 base and adjacent_to splice_junction.

label: five_prime_cis_splice_site
definition: Intronic 2 bp region bordering the exon, at the 5' edge of the intron. A splice_site that is downstream_adjacent_to exon and starts intron.

label: three_prime_cis_splice_site
definition: Intronic 2 bp region bordering the exon, at the 3' edge of the intron. A splice_site that is upstream_adjacent_to exon and finishes intron.

label: enhancer
definition: A cis-acting sequence that increases the utilization of (some) eukaryotic promoters, and can function in either orientation and in any location (upstream or downstream) relative to the promoter.

label: enhancer_bound_by_factor
definition: An enhancer bound by a factor.

label: promoter
definition: A regulatory_region composed of the TSS(s) and binding sites for TF_complexes of the core transcription machinery. A region (DNA) to which RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

label: restriction_enzyme_cut_site
definition: A specific nucleotide sequence of DNA at or near which a particular restriction enzyme cuts the DNA.

label: RNApol_I_promoter
definition: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase I binds, to begin transcription.

label: RNApol_II_promoter
definition: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase II binds, to begin transcription.

label: RNApol_III_promoter
definition: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase III binds, to begin transcription.

label: CAAT_signal
definition: Part of a conserved sequence located about 75-bp upstream of the start point of eukaryotic transcription units which may be involved in RNA polymerase binding; consensus=GG(C|T)CAATCT.

label: GC_rich_promoter_region
definition: A conserved GC-rich region located upstream of the start point of eukaryotic transcription units which may occur in multiple copies or in either orientation; consensus=GGGCGG.

label: TATA_box
definition: A conserved AT-rich septamer found about 25-bp before the start point of many eukaryotic RNA polymerase II transcript units; may be involved in positioning the enzyme for correct initiation; consensus=TATA(A|T)A(A|T).

label: minus_10_signal
definition: A conserved region about 10-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units which may be involved in binding RNA polymerase; consensus=TAtAaT. This region is associated with sigma factor 70.

label: minus_35_signal
definition: A conserved hexamer about 35-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units; consensus=TTGACa or TGTTGACA. This region is associated with sigma factor 70.

label: cross_genome_match
definition: A nucleotide match against a sequence from another organism.

label: operon
definition: The DNA region of a group of adjacent genes whose transcription is coordinated on one or several mutually overlapping transcription units transcribed in the same direction and sharing at least one gene.

label: clone_insert_start
definition: The start of the clone insert.

label: retrotransposon
definition: A transposable element that is incorporated into a chromosome by a mechanism that requires reverse transcriptase.

label: translated_nucleotide_match
definition: A match against a translated sequence.

label: DNA_transposon
definition: A transposon where the mechanism of transposition is via a DNA intermediate.

label: non_transcribed_region
definition: A region of the gene which is not transcribed.

label: U2_intron
definition: A major type of spliceosomal intron spliced by the U2 spliceosome, that includes U1, U2, U4/U6 and U5 snRNAs.

label: primary_transcript
definition: A transcript that in its initial state requires modification to be functional.

label: LTR_retrotransposon
definition: A retrotransposon flanked by long terminal repeat sequences.

label: repeat_family
definition: A group of characterized repeat sequences.

label: intron
definition: A region of a primary transcript that is transcribed, but removed from within the transcript by splicing together the sequences (exons) on either side of it.

label: non_LTR_retrotransposon
definition: A retrotransposon without long terminal repeat sequences.

label: five_prime_intron
definition: An intron that is the most 5-prime in a given transcript.

label: interior_intron
definition: An intron that is not the most 3-prime or the most 5-prime in a given transcript.

label: three_prime_intron
definition: An intron that is the most 3-prime in a given transcript.

label: RFLP_fragment
definition: A DNA fragment used as a reagent to detect the polymorphic genomic loci by hybridizing against the genomic DNA digested with a given restriction enzyme.

label: LINE_element
definition: A dispersed repeat family with many copies, each from 1 to 6 kb long. New elements are generated by retroposition of a transcribed copy. Typically the LINE contains 2 ORF's one of which is reverse transcriptase, and 3'and 5' direct repeats.

label: coding_exon
definition: An exon whereby at least one base is part of a codon (here, 'codon' is inclusive of the stop_codon).

label: five_prime_coding_exon_coding_region
definition: The sequence of the five_prime_coding_exon that codes for protein.

label: three_prime_coding_exon_coding_region
definition: The sequence of the three_prime_coding_exon that codes for protein.

label: noncoding_exon
definition: An exon that does not contain any codons.

label: translocation
definition: A region of nucleotide sequence that has translocated to a new position. The observed adjacency of two previously separated regions.

label: five_prime_coding_exon
definition: The 5' most coding exon.

label: interior_exon
definition: An exon that is bounded by 5' and 3' splice sites.

label: three_prime_coding_exon
definition: The coding exon that is most 3-prime on a given transcript.

label: UTR
definition: Messenger RNA sequences that are untranslated and lie five prime or three prime to sequences which are translated.

label: five_prime_UTR
definition: A region at the 5' end of a mature transcript (preceding the initiation codon) that is not translated into a protein.

label: three_prime_UTR
definition: A region at the 3' end of a mature transcript (following the stop codon) that is not translated into a protein.

label: SINE_element
definition: A repetitive element, a few hundred base pairs long, that is dispersed throughout the genome. A common human SINE is the Alu element.

label: simple_sequence_length_variation
definition: SSLP are a kind of sequence alteration where the number of repeated sequences in intergenic regions may differ.

label: terminal_inverted_repeat_element
definition: A DNA transposable element defined as having termini with perfect, or nearly perfect short inverted repeats, generally 10 - 40 nucleotides long.

label: rRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a ribosomal RNA.

label: tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a transfer RNA (SO:0000253).

label: alanine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding alanyl tRNA.

label: arginine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding arginyl tRNA (SO:0000255).

label: asparagine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding asparaginyl tRNA (SO:0000256).

label: aspartic_acid_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding aspartyl tRNA (SO:0000257).

label: cysteine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding cysteinyl tRNA (SO:0000258).

label: glutamic_acid_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding glutaminyl tRNA (SO:0000260).

label: glutamine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding glutamyl tRNA (SO:0000260).

label: glycine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding glycyl tRNA (SO:0000263).

label: histidine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding histidyl tRNA (SO:0000262).

label: isoleucine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding isoleucyl tRNA (SO:0000263).

label: leucine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding leucyl tRNA (SO:0000264).

label: lysine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding lysyl tRNA (SO:0000265).

label: methionine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding methionyl tRNA (SO:0000266).

label: phenylalanine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding phenylalanyl tRNA (SO:0000267).

label: proline_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding prolyl tRNA (SO:0000268).

label: serine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding seryl tRNA (SO:000269).

label: threonine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding threonyl tRNA (SO:000270).

label: tryptophan_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding tryptophanyl tRNA (SO:000271).

label: tyrosine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding tyrosyl tRNA (SO:000272).

label: valine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding valyl tRNA (SO:000273).

label: snRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a small nuclear RNA (SO:0000274).

label: snoRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding one or more small nucleolar RNAs (SO:0000275).

label: mature_transcript
definition: A transcript which has undergone the necessary modifications, if any, for its function. In eukaryotes this includes, for example, processing of introns, cleavage, base modification, and modifications to the 5' and/or the 3' ends, other than addition of bases. In bacteria functional mRNAs are usually not modified.

label: mRNA
definition: Messenger RNA is the intermediate molecule between DNA and protein. It includes UTR and coding sequences. It does not contain introns.

label: TF_binding_site
definition: A DNA site where a transcription factor binds.

label: ORF
definition: The in-frame interval between the stop codons of a reading frame which when read as sequential triplets, has the potential of encoding a sequential string of amino acids. TER(NNN)nTER.

label: transcript_attribute
definition: An attribute describing a transcript.

label: foldback_element
definition: A transposable element with extensive secondary structure, characterized by large modular imperfect long inverted repeats.

label: flanking_region
definition: The sequences extending on either side of a specific region.

label: chromosome_variation
definition: A deviation in chromosome structure or number.

label: internal_UTR
definition: A UTR bordered by the terminal and initial codons of two CDSs in a polycistronic transcript. Every UTR is either 5', 3' or internal.

label: untranslated_region_polycistronic_mRNA
definition: The untranslated sequence separating the 'cistrons' of multicistronic mRNA.

label: internal_ribosome_entry_site
definition: Sequence element that recruits a ribosomal subunit to internal mRNA for translation initiation.

label: polyadenylated
definition: A attribute describing the addition of a poly A tail to the 3' end of a mRNA molecule.

label: sequence_length_alteration
definition: A kind of kind of sequence alteration where the copies of a region present varies across a population.

label: modified_RNA_base_feature
definition: A post_transcriptionally modified base.

label: rRNA
definition: rRNA is an RNA component of a ribosome that can provide both structural scaffolding and catalytic activity.

label: tRNA
definition: Transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules are approximately 80 nucleotides in length. Their secondary structure includes four short double-helical elements and three loops (D, anti-codon, and T loops). Further hydrogen bonds mediate the characteristic L-shaped molecular structure. Transfer RNAs have two regions of fundamental functional importance: the anti-codon, which is responsible for specific mRNA codon recognition, and the 3' end, to which the tRNA's corresponding amino acid is attached (by aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases). Transfer RNAs cope with the degeneracy of the genetic code in two manners: having more than one tRNA (with a specific anti-codon) for a particular amino acid; and 'wobble' base-pairing, i.e. permitting non-standard base-pairing at the 3rd anti-codon position.

label: alanyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has an alanine anticodon, and a 3' alanine binding region.

label: rRNA_small_subunit_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a small ribosomal subunit RNA.

label: asparaginyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has an asparagine anticodon, and a 3' asparagine binding region.

label: aspartyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has an aspartic acid anticodon, and a 3' aspartic acid binding region.

label: cysteinyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a cysteine anticodon, and a 3' cysteine binding region.

label: glutaminyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a glutamine anticodon, and a 3' glutamine binding region.

label: glutamyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a glutamic acid anticodon, and a 3' glutamic acid binding region.

label: glycyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a glycine anticodon, and a 3' glycine binding region.

label: histidyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a histidine anticodon, and a 3' histidine binding region.

label: isoleucyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has an isoleucine anticodon, and a 3' isoleucine binding region.

label: leucyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a leucine anticodon, and a 3' leucine binding region.

label: lysyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a lysine anticodon, and a 3' lysine binding region.

label: methionyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a methionine anticodon, and a 3' methionine binding region.

label: phenylalanyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a phenylalanine anticodon, and a 3' phenylalanine binding region.

label: prolyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a proline anticodon, and a 3' proline binding region.

label: seryl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a serine anticodon, and a 3' serine binding region.

label: threonyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a threonine anticodon, and a 3' threonine binding region.

label: tryptophanyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a tryptophan anticodon, and a 3' tryptophan binding region.

label: tyrosyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a tyrosine anticodon, and a 3' tyrosine binding region.

label: valyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a valine anticodon, and a 3' valine binding region.

label: snRNA
definition: A small nuclear RNA molecule involved in pre-mRNA splicing and processing.

label: snoRNA
definition: A snoRNA (small nucleolar RNA) is any one of a class of small RNAs that are associated with the eukaryotic nucleus as components of small nucleolar ribonucleoproteins. They participate in the processing or modifications of many RNAs, mostly ribosomal RNAs (rRNAs) though snoRNAs are also known to target other classes of RNA, including spliceosomal RNAs, tRNAs, and mRNAs via a stretch of sequence that is complementary to a sequence in the targeted RNA.

label: miRNA
definition: Small, ~22-nt, RNA molecule that is the endogenous transcript of a miRNA gene (or the product of other non coding RNA genes. Micro RNAs are produced from precursor molecules (SO:0000647) that can form local hairpin structures, which ordinarily are processed (usually via the Dicer pathway) such that a single miRNA molecule accumulates from one arm of a hairpin precursor molecule. Micro RNAs may trigger the cleavage of their target molecules or act as translational repressors.

label: bound_by_factor
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that is bound by another molecule.

label: transcript_bound_by_nucleic_acid
definition: A transcript that is bound by a nucleic acid.

label: transcript_bound_by_protein
definition: A transcript that is bound by a protein.

label: engineered_gene
definition: A gene that is engineered.

label: engineered_foreign_gene
definition: A gene that is engineered and foreign.

label: mRNA_with_minus_1_frameshift
definition: An mRNA with a minus 1 frameshift.

label: engineered_foreign_transposable_element_gene
definition: A transposable_element that is engineered and foreign.

label: type_I_enzyme_restriction_site
definition: The recognition site is bipartite and interrupted.

label: foreign_gene
definition: A gene that is foreign.

label: long_terminal_repeat
definition: A sequence directly repeated at both ends of a defined sequence, of the sort typically found in retroviruses.

label: fusion_gene
definition: A gene that is a fusion.

label: engineered_fusion_gene
definition: A fusion gene that is engineered.

label: microsatellite
definition: A repeat_region containing repeat_units of 2 to 10 bp repeated in tandem.

label: dinucleotide_repeat_microsatellite_feature
definition: A region of a repeating dinucleotide sequence (two bases).

label: trinucleotide_repeat_microsatellite_feature
definition: A region of a repeating trinucleotide sequence (three bases).

label: engineered_foreign_repetitive_element
definition: A repetitive element that is engineered and foreign.

label: inverted_repeat
definition: The sequence is complementarily repeated on the opposite strand. It is a palindrome, and it may, or may not be hyphenated. Examples: GCTGATCAGC, or GCTGA-----TCAGC.

label: U12_intron
definition: A type of spliceosomal intron spliced by the U12 spliceosome, that includes U11, U12, U4atac/U6atac and U5 snRNAs.

label: origin_of_replication
definition: A region of nucleic acid from which replication initiates; includes sequences that are recognized by replication proteins, the site from which the first separation of complementary strands occurs, and specific replication start sites.

label: D_loop
definition: Displacement loop; a region within mitochondrial DNA in which a short stretch of RNA is paired with one strand of DNA, displacing the original partner DNA strand in this region; also used to describe the displacement of a region of one strand of duplex DNA by a single stranded invader in the reaction catalyzed by RecA protein.

label: recombination_feature
definition: A feature where there has been exchange of genetic material in the event of mitosis or meiosis

label: specific_recombination_site
definition: A location where recombination or occurs during mitosis or meiosis.

label: recombination_feature_of_rearranged_gene
definition: A location where a gene is rearranged due to recombination during mitosis or meiosis.

label: vertebrate_immune_system_gene_recombination_feature
definition: A feature where recombination has occurred for the purpose of generating a diversity in the immune system.

label: J_gene_recombination_feature
definition: Recombination signal including J-heptamer, J-spacer and J-nonamer in 5' of J-region of a J-gene or J-sequence.

label: clip
definition: Part of the primary transcript that is clipped off during processing.

label: type_II_enzyme_restriction_site
definition: The recognition site is either palindromic, partially palindromic or an interrupted palindrome. Cleavage occurs within the recognition site.

label: modified_DNA_base
definition: A modified nucleotide, i.e. a nucleotide other than A, T, C. G.

label: methylated_DNA_base_feature
definition: A nucleotide modified by methylation.

label: CpG_island
definition: Regions of a few hundred to a few thousand bases in vertebrate genomes that are relatively GC and CpG rich; they are typically unmethylated and often found near the 5' ends of genes.

label: experimentally_determined
definition: Attribute to describe a feature that has been experimentally verified.

label: stem_loop
definition: A double-helical region of nucleic acid formed by base-pairing between adjacent (inverted) complementary sequences.

label: direct_repeat
definition: A repeat where the same sequence is repeated in the same direction. Example: GCTGA-followed by-GCTGA.

label: TSS
definition: The first base where RNA polymerase begins to synthesize the RNA transcript.

label: CDS
definition: A contiguous sequence which begins with, and includes, a start codon and ends with, and includes, a stop codon.

label: cDNA_clone
definition: Complementary DNA; A piece of DNA copied from an mRNA and spliced into a vector for propagation in a suitable host.

label: start_codon
definition: First codon to be translated by a ribosome.

label: stop_codon
definition: In mRNA, a set of three nucleotides that indicates the end of information for protein synthesis.

label: intronic_splice_enhancer
definition: Sequences within the intron that modulate splice site selection for some introns.

label: mRNA_with_plus_1_frameshift
definition: An mRNA with a plus 1 frameshift.

label: nuclease_hypersensitive_site
definition: A region of nucleotide sequence targeted by a nuclease enzyme that is found cleaved more than would be expected by chance.

label: coding_start
definition: The first base to be translated into protein.

label: tag
definition: A nucleotide sequence that may be used to identify a larger sequence.

label: rRNA_large_subunit_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a large ribosomal subunit RNA.

label: SAGE_tag
definition: A short diagnostic sequence tag, serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE), that allows the quantitative and simultaneous analysis of a large number of transcripts.

label: coding_end
definition: The last base to be translated into protein. It does not include the stop codon.

label: microarray_oligo
definition: A DNA sequence used experimentally to detect the presence or absence of a complementary nucleic acid.

label: mRNA_with_plus_2_frameshift
definition: An mRNA with a plus 2 frameshift.

label: conserved_region
definition: Region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

label: STS
definition: Short (typically a few hundred base pairs) DNA sequence that has a single occurrence in a genome and whose location and base sequence are known.

label: coding_conserved_region
definition: Coding region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

label: exon_junction
definition: The boundary between two exons in a processed transcript.

label: nc_conserved_region
definition: Non-coding region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

label: mRNA_with_minus_2_frameshift
definition: A mRNA with a minus 2 frameshift.

label: pseudogene
definition: A sequence that closely resembles a known functional gene, at another locus within a genome, that is non-functional as a consequence of (usually several) mutations that prevent either its transcription or translation (or both). In general, pseudogenes result from either reverse transcription of a transcript of their "normal" paralog (SO:0000043) (in which case the pseudogene typically lacks introns and includes a poly(A) tail) or from recombination (SO:0000044) (in which case the pseudogene is typically a tandem duplication of its "normal" paralog).

label: RNAi_reagent
definition: A double stranded RNA duplex, at least 20bp long, used experimentally to inhibit gene function by RNA interference.

label: MITE
definition: A highly repetitive and short (100-500 base pair) transposable element with terminal inverted repeats (TIR) and target site duplication (TSD). MITEs do not encode proteins.

label: recombination_hotspot
definition: A region in a genome which promotes recombination.

label: chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a nucleic acid molecule which controls its own replication through the interaction of specific proteins at one or more origins of replication.

label: chromosome_band
definition: A cytologically distinguishable feature of a chromosome, often made visible by staining, and usually alternating light and dark.

label: site_specific_recombination_target_region
definition: A region specifically recognised by a recombinase where recombination can occur during mitosis or meiosis.

label: match
definition: A region of sequence, aligned to another sequence with some statistical significance, using an algorithm such as BLAST or SIM4.

label: splice_enhancer
definition: Region of a transcript that regulates splicing.

label: EST
definition: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a cDNA clone or PCR product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

label: loxP_site
definition: Cre-Recombination target sequence.

label: nucleotide_match
definition: A match against a nucleotide sequence.

label: nucleic_acid
definition: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to repeating units. The forms found in nature are deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), where the repeating units are 2-deoxy-D-ribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone, and ribonucleic acid (RNA), where the repeating units are D-ribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone.

label: protein_match
definition: A match against a protein sequence.

label: FRT_site
definition: An inversion site found on the Saccharomyces cerevisiae 2 micron plasmid.

label: synthetic_sequence
definition: An attribute to decide a sequence of nucleotides, nucleotide analogs, or amino acids that has been designed by an experimenter and which may, or may not, correspond with any natural sequence.

label: DNA
definition: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to a repeating unit made of a 2-deoxy-D-ribose ring connected to a phosphate backbone.

label: sequence_assembly
definition: A sequence of nucleotides that has been algorithmically derived from an alignment of two or more different sequences.

label: group_1_intron_homing_endonuclease_target_region
definition: A region of intronic nucleotide sequence targeted by a nuclease enzyme.

label: haplotype_block
definition: A region of the genome which is co-inherited as the result of the lack of historic recombination within it.

label: RNA
definition: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to a repeating unit made of a D-ribose ring connected to a phosphate backbone.

label: flanked
definition: An attribute describing a region that is bounded either side by a particular kind of region.

label: floxed
definition: An attribute describing sequence that is flanked by Lox-P sites.

label: codon
definition: A set of (usually) three nucleotide bases in a DNA or RNA sequence, which together code for a unique amino acid or the termination of translation and are contained within the CDS.

label: FRT_flanked
definition: An attribute to describe sequence that is flanked by the FLP recombinase recognition site, FRT.

label: invalidated_by_chimeric_cDNA
definition: A cDNA clone constructed from more than one mRNA. Usually an experimental artifact.

label: floxed_gene
definition: A transgene that is floxed.

label: transposable_element_flanking_region
definition: The region of sequence surrounding a transposable element.

label: integron
definition: A region encoding an integrase which acts at a site adjacent to it (attI_site) to insert DNA which must include but is not limited to an attC_site.

label: insertion_site
definition: The junction where an insertion occurred.

label: attI_site
definition: A region within an integron, adjacent to an integrase, at which site specific recombination involving an attC_site takes place.

label: transposable_element_insertion_site
definition: The junction in a genome where a transposable_element has inserted.

label: small_regulatory_ncRNA
definition: A non-coding RNA less than 200 nucleotides long, usually with a specific secondary structure, that acts to regulate gene expression. These include short ncRNAs such as piRNA, miRNA and siRNAs (among others).

label: conjugative_transposon
definition: A transposon that encodes function required for conjugation.

label: enzymatic_RNA
definition: An RNA sequence that has catalytic activity with or without an associated ribonucleoprotein.

label: recombinationally_inverted_gene
definition: A recombinationally rearranged gene by inversion.

label: ribozyme
definition: An RNA with catalytic activity.

label: cytosolic_5_8S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 5.8S rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of cytosolic ribosomes in eukaryotes.

label: RNA_6S
definition: A small (184-nt in E. coli) RNA that forms a hairpin type structure. 6S RNA associates with RNA polymerase in a highly specific manner. 6S RNA represses expression from a sigma70-dependent promoter during stationary phase.

label: CsrB_RsmB_RNA
definition: An enterobacterial RNA that binds the CsrA protein. The CsrB RNAs contain a conserved motif CAGGXXG that is found in up to 18 copies and has been suggested to bind CsrA. The Csr regulatory system has a strong negative regulatory effect on glycogen biosynthesis, glyconeogenesis and glycogen catabolism and a positive regulatory effect on glycolysis. In other bacteria such as Erwinia caratovara the RsmA protein has been shown to regulate the production of virulence determinants, such extracellular enzymes. RsmA binds to RsmB regulatory RNA which is also a member of this family.

label: DsrA_RNA
definition: DsrA RNA regulates both transcription, by overcoming transcriptional silencing by the nucleoid-associated H-NS protein, and translation, by promoting efficient translation of the stress sigma factor, RpoS. These two activities of DsrA can be separated by mutation: the first of three stem-loops of the 85 nucleotide RNA is necessary for RpoS translation but not for anti-H-NS action, while the second stem-loop is essential for antisilencing and less critical for RpoS translation. The third stem-loop, which behaves as a transcription terminator, can be substituted by the trp transcription terminator without loss of either DsrA function. The sequence of the first stem-loop of DsrA is complementary with the upstream leader portion of RpoS messenger RNA, suggesting that pairing of DsrA with the RpoS message might be important for translational regulation.

label: GcvB_RNA
definition: A small untranslated RNA involved in expression of the dipeptide and oligopeptide transport systems in Escherichia coli.

label: hammerhead_ribozyme
definition: A small catalytic RNA motif that catalyzes self-cleavage reaction. Its name comes from its secondary structure which resembles a carpenter's hammer. The hammerhead ribozyme is involved in the replication of some viroid and some satellite RNAs.

label: group_IIA_intron
definition: A group II intron that recognizes IBS1/EBS1 and IBS2/EBS2 for the 5-prime exon and gamma/gamma-prime for the 3-prime exon.

label: group_IIB_intron
definition: A group II intron that recognizes IBS1/EBS1 and IBS2/EBS2 for the 5-prime exon and IBS3/EBS3 for the 3-prime exon.

label: MicF_RNA
definition: A non-translated 93 nt antisense RNA that binds its target ompF mRNA and regulates ompF expression by inhibiting translation and inducing degradation of the message.

label: OxyS_RNA
definition: A small untranslated RNA which is induced in response to oxidative stress in Escherichia coli. Acts as a global regulator to activate or repress the expression of as many as 40 genes, including the fhlA-encoded transcriptional activator and the rpoS-encoded sigma(s) subunit of RNA polymerase. OxyS is bound by the Hfq protein, that increases the OxyS RNA interaction with its target messages.

label: RNase_MRP_RNA
definition: The RNA molecule essential for the catalytic activity of RNase MRP, an enzymatically active ribonucleoprotein with two distinct roles in eukaryotes. In mitochondria it plays a direct role in the initiation of mitochondrial DNA replication. In the nucleus it is involved in precursor rRNA processing, where it cleaves the internal transcribed spacer 1 between 18S and 5.8S rRNAs.

label: RNase_P_RNA
definition: The RNA component of Ribonuclease P (RNase P), a ubiquitous endoribonuclease, found in archaea, bacteria and eukarya as well as chloroplasts and mitochondria. Its best characterized activity is the generation of mature 5 prime ends of tRNAs by cleaving the 5 prime leader elements of precursor-tRNAs. Cellular RNase Ps are ribonucleoproteins. RNA from bacterial RNase Ps retains its catalytic activity in the absence of the protein subunit, i.e. it is a ribozyme. Isolated eukaryotic and archaeal RNase P RNA has not been shown to retain its catalytic function, but is still essential for the catalytic activity of the holoenzyme. Although the archaeal and eukaryotic holoenzymes have a much greater protein content than the bacterial ones, the RNA cores from all the three lineages are homologous. Helices corresponding to P1, P2, P3, P4, and P10/11 are common to all cellular RNase P RNAs. Yet, there is considerable sequence variation, particularly among the eukaryotic RNAs.

label: RprA_RNA
definition: Translational regulation of the stationary phase sigma factor RpoS is mediated by the formation of a double-stranded RNA stem-loop structure in the upstream region of the rpoS messenger RNA, occluding the translation initiation site. Clones carrying rprA (RpoS regulator RNA) increased the translation of RpoS. The rprA gene encodes a 106 nucleotide regulatory RNA. As with DsrA Rfam:RF00014, RprA is predicted to form three stem-loops. Thus, at least two small RNAs, DsrA and RprA, participate in the positive regulation of RpoS translation. Unlike DsrA, RprA does not have an extensive region of complementarity to the RpoS leader, leaving its mechanism of action unclear. RprA is non-essential.

label: RRE_RNA
definition: The Rev response element (RRE) is encoded within the HIV-env gene. Rev is an essential regulatory protein of HIV that binds an internal loop of the RRE leading, encouraging further Rev-RRE binding. This RNP complex is critical for mRNA export and hence for expression of the HIV structural proteins.

label: spot_42_RNA
definition: A 109-nucleotide RNA of E. coli that seems to have a regulatory role on the galactose operon. Changes in Spot 42 levels are implicated in affecting DNA polymerase I levels.

label: telomerase_RNA
definition: The RNA component of telomerase, a reverse transcriptase that synthesizes telomeric DNA.

label: U1_snRNA
definition: U1 is a small nuclear RNA (snRNA) component of the spliceosome (involved in pre-mRNA splicing). Its 5' end forms complementary base pairs with the 5' splice junction, thus defining the 5' donor site of an intron. There are significant differences in sequence and secondary structure between metazoan and yeast U1 snRNAs, the latter being much longer (568 nucleotides as compared to 164 nucleotides in human). Nevertheless, secondary structure predictions suggest that all U1 snRNAs share a 'common core' consisting of helices I, II, the proximal region of III, and IV.

label: U2_snRNA
definition: U2 is a small nuclear RNA (snRNA) component of the spliceosome (involved in pre-mRNA splicing). Complementary binding between U2 snRNA (in an area lying towards the 5' end but 3' to hairpin I) and the branchpoint sequence (BPS) of the intron results in the bulging out of an unpaired adenine, on the BPS, which initiates a nucleophilic attack at the intronic 5' splice site, thus starting the first of two transesterification reactions that mediate splicing.

label: U4_snRNA
definition: U4 small nuclear RNA (U4 snRNA) is a component of the major U2-dependent spliceosome. It forms a duplex with U6, and with each splicing round, it is displaced from U6 (and the spliceosome) in an ATP-dependent manner, allowing U6 to refold and create the active site for splicing catalysis. A recycling process involving protein Prp24 re-anneals U4 and U6.

label: U4atac_snRNA
definition: An snRNA required for the splicing of the minor U12-dependent class of eukaryotic nuclear introns. It forms a base paired complex with U6atac_snRNA (SO:0000397).

label: U5_snRNA
definition: U5 RNA is a component of both types of known spliceosome. The precise function of this molecule is unknown, though it is known that the 5' loop is required for splice site selection and p220 binding, and that both the 3' stem-loop and the Sm site are important for Sm protein binding and cap methylation.

label: U6_snRNA
definition: U6 snRNA is a component of the spliceosome which is involved in splicing pre-mRNA. The putative secondary structure consensus base pairing is confined to a short 5' stem loop, but U6 snRNA is thought to form extensive base-pair interactions with U4 snRNA.

label: U6atac_snRNA
definition: U6atac_snRNA is an snRNA required for the splicing of the minor U12-dependent class of eukaryotic nuclear introns. It forms a base paired complex with U4atac_snRNA (SO:0000394).

label: U11_snRNA
definition: U11 snRNA plays a role in splicing of the minor U12-dependent class of eukaryotic nuclear introns, similar to U1 snRNA in the major class spliceosome it base pairs to the conserved 5' splice site sequence.

label: U12_snRNA
definition: The U12 small nuclear (snRNA), together with U4atac/U6atac, U5, and U11 snRNAs and associated proteins, forms a spliceosome that cleaves a divergent class of low-abundance pre-mRNA introns.

label: sequence_attribute
definition: An attribute describes a quality of sequence.

label: gene_attribute
definition: An attribute describing a gene.

label: U14_snoRNA
definition: U14 small nucleolar RNA (U14 snoRNA) is required for early cleavages of eukaryotic precursor rRNAs. In yeasts, this molecule possess a stem-loop region (known as the Y-domain) which is essential for function. A similar structure, but with a different consensus sequence, is found in plants, but is absent in vertebrates.

label: vault_RNA
definition: A family of RNAs are found as part of the enigmatic vault ribonucleoprotein complex. The complex consists of a major vault protein (MVP), two minor vault proteins (VPARP and TEP1), and several small untranslated RNA molecules. It has been suggested that the vault complex is involved in drug resistance.

label: Y_RNA
definition: Y RNAs are components of the Ro ribonucleoprotein particle (Ro RNP), in association with Ro60 and La proteins. The Y RNAs and Ro60 and La proteins are well conserved, but the function of the Ro RNP is not known. In humans the RNA component can be one of four small RNAs: hY1, hY3, hY4 and hY5. These small RNAs are predicted to fold into a conserved secondary structure containing three stem structures. The largest of the four, hY1, contains an additional hairpin.

label: twintron
definition: An intron within an intron. Twintrons are group II or III introns, into which another group II or III intron has been transposed.

label: cytosolic_18S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 18S rRNA is an RNA component of the small subunit of cytosolic ribosomes in eukaryotes.

label: site
definition: The interbase position where something (eg an aberration) occurred.

label: binding_site
definition: A biological_region of sequence that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with other molecules. A region on the surface of a molecule that may interact with another molecule. When applied to polypeptides: Amino acids involved in binding or interactions. It can also apply to an amino acid bond which is represented by the positions of the two flanking amino acids.

label: protein_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide molecules.

label: rescue_region
definition: A region that rescues.

label: restriction_fragment
definition: A region of polynucleotide sequence produced by digestion with a restriction endonuclease.

label: sequence_difference
definition: A region where the sequence differs from that of a specified sequence.

label: invalidated_by_genomic_contamination
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that is invalidated due to genomic contamination.

label: invalidated_by_genomic_polyA_primed_cDNA
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that is invalidated due to polyA priming.

label: invalidated_by_partial_processing
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that is invalidated due to partial processing.

label: polypeptide_domain
definition: A structurally or functionally defined protein region. In proteins with multiple domains, the combination of the domains determines the function of the protein. A region which has been shown to recur throughout evolution.

label: signal_peptide
definition: The signal_peptide is a short region of the peptide located at the N-terminus that directs the protein to be secreted or part of membrane components.

label: mature_protein_region
definition: The polypeptide sequence that remains when the cleaved peptide regions have been cleaved from the immature peptide.

label: five_prime_terminal_inverted_repeat
definition: An inverted repeat (SO:0000294) occurring at the 5-prime termini of a DNA transposon.

label: three_prime_terminal_inverted_repeat
definition: An inverted repeat (SO:0000294) occurring at the 3-prime termini of a DNA transposon.

label: U5_LTR_region
definition: The U5 segment of the long terminal repeats.

label: R_LTR_region
definition: The R segment of the long terminal repeats.

label: U3_LTR_region
definition: The U3 segment of the long terminal repeats.

label: five_prime_LTR
definition: The long terminal repeat found at the five-prime end of the sequence to be inserted into the host genome.

label: three_prime_LTR
definition: The long terminal repeat found at the three-prime end of the sequence to be inserted into the host genome.

label: R_five_prime_LTR_region
definition: The R segment of the three-prime long terminal repeat.

label: U5_five_prime_LTR_region
definition: The U5 segment of the three-prime long terminal repeat.

label: U3_five_prime_LTR_region
definition: The U3 segment of the three-prime long terminal repeat.

label: R_three_prime_LTR_region
definition: The R segment of the three-prime long terminal repeat.

label: U3_three_prime_LTR_region
definition: The U3 segment of the three-prime long terminal repeat.

label: U5_three_prime_LTR_region
definition: The U5 segment of the three-prime long terminal repeat.

label: non_LTR_retrotransposon_polymeric_tract
definition: A polymeric tract, such as poly(dA), within a non_LTR_retrotransposon.

label: target_site_duplication
definition: A sequence of the target DNA that is duplicated when a transposable element or phage inserts; usually found at each end the insertion.

label: RR_tract
definition: A polypurine tract within an LTR_retrotransposon.

label: ARS
definition: A sequence that can autonomously replicate, as a plasmid, when transformed into a bacterial host.

label: inverted_ring_chromosome
definition: A ring chromosome is a chromosome whose arms have fused together to form a ring in an inverted fashion, often with the loss of the ends of the chromosome.

label: vector_replicon
definition: A replicon that has been modified to act as a vector for foreign sequence.

label: ss_oligo
definition: A single stranded oligonucleotide.

label: ds_oligo
definition: A double stranded oligonucleotide.

label: polymer_attribute
definition: An attribute to describe the kind of biological sequence.

label: three_prime_noncoding_exon
definition: Non-coding exon in the 3' UTR.

label: five_prime_noncoding_exon
definition: Non-coding exon in the 5' UTR.

label: UTR_intron
definition: Intron located in the untranslated region.

label: five_prime_UTR_intron
definition: An intron located in the 5' UTR.

label: three_prime_UTR_intron
definition: An intron located in the 3' UTR.

label: random_sequence
definition: A sequence of nucleotides or amino acids which, by design, has a "random" order of components, given a predetermined input frequency of these components.

label: interband
definition: A light region between two darkly staining bands in a polytene chromosome.

label: gene_with_polyadenylated_mRNA
definition: A gene that encodes a polyadenylated mRNA.

label: chromosomal_transposition
definition: A chromosome structure variant whereby a region of a chromosome has been transferred to another position. Among interchromosomal rearrangements, the term transposition is reserved for that class in which the telomeres of the chromosomes involved are coupled (that is to say, form the two ends of a single DNA molecule) as in wild-type.

label: rasiRNA
definition: A 17-28-nt, small interfering RNA derived from transcripts of repetitive elements.

label: gene_with_mRNA_with_frameshift
definition: A gene that encodes an mRNA with a frameshift.

label: recombinationally_rearranged_gene
definition: A gene that is recombinationally rearranged.

label: interchromosomal_duplication
definition: A chromosome duplication involving an insertion from another chromosome.

label: D_gene_segment
definition: Germline genomic DNA including D-region with 5' UTR and 3' UTR, also designated as D-segment.

label: gene_with_trans_spliced_transcript
definition: A gene with a transcript that is trans-spliced.

label: vertebrate_immunoglobulin_T_cell_receptor_segment
definition: Germline genomic DNA with the sequence for a V, D, C, or J portion of an immunoglobulin/T-cell receptor.

label: inversion_derived_bipartite_deficiency
definition: A chromosomal deletion whereby a chromosome generated by recombination between two inversions; has a deficiency at each end of the inversion.

label: pseudogenic_region
definition: A non-functional descendant of a functional entity.

label: encodes_alternately_spliced_transcripts
definition: A gene that encodes more than one transcript.

label: decayed_exon
definition: A non-functional descendant of an exon.

label: inversion_derived_deficiency_plus_duplication

definition: A tmRNA liberates a mRNA from a stalled ribosome. To accomplish this part of the tmRNA is used as a reading frame that ends in a translation stop signal. The broken mRNA is replaced in the ribosome by the tmRNA and translation of the tmRNA leads to addition of a proteolysis tag to the incomplete protein enabling recognition by a protease. Recently a number of permuted tmRNAs genes have been found encoded in two parts. TmRNAs have been identified in eubacteria and some chloroplasts but are absent from archeal and Eukaryote nuclear genomes.

label: group_I_intron
definition: Group I catalytic introns are large self-splicing ribozymes. They catalyze their own excision from mRNA, tRNA and rRNA precursors in a wide range of organisms. The core secondary structure consists of 9 paired regions (P1-P9). These fold to essentially two domains, the P4-P6 domain (formed from the stacking of P5, P4, P6 and P6a helices) and the P3-P9 domain (formed from the P8, P3, P7 and P9 helices). Group I catalytic introns often have long ORFs inserted in loop regions.

label: autocatalytically_spliced_intron

label: SRP_RNA
definition: The signal recognition particle (SRP) is a universally conserved ribonucleoprotein. It is involved in the co-translational targeting of proteins to membranes. The eukaryotic SRP consists of a 300-nucleotide 7S RNA and six proteins: SRPs 72, 68, 54, 19, 14, and 9. Archaeal SRP consists of a 7S RNA and homologues of the eukaryotic SRP19 and SRP54 proteins. In most eubacteria, the SRP consists of a 4.5S RNA and the Ffh protein (a homologue of the eukaryotic SRP54 protein). Eukaryotic and archaeal 7S RNAs have very similar secondary structures, with eight helical elements. These fold into the Alu and S domains, separated by a long linker region. Eubacterial SRP is generally a simpler structure, with the M domain of Ffh bound to a region of the 4.5S RNA that corresponds to helix 8 of the eukaryotic and archaeal SRP S domain. Some Gram-positive bacteria (e.g. Bacillus subtilis), however, have a larger SRP RNA that also has an Alu domain. The Alu domain is thought to mediate the peptide chain elongation retardation function of the SRP. The universally conserved helix which interacts with the SRP54/Ffh M domain mediates signal sequence recognition. In eukaryotes and archaea, the SRP19-helix 6 complex is thought to be involved in SRP assembly and stabilizes helix 8 for SRP54 binding.

label: pseudoknot

label: H_pseudoknot

label: C_D_box_snoRNA
definition: Most box C/D snoRNAs also contain long (>10 nt) sequences complementary to rRNA. Boxes C and D, as well as boxes C' and D', are usually located in close proximity, and form a structure known as the box C/D motif. This motif is important for snoRNA stability, processing, nucleolar targeting and function. A small number of box C/D snoRNAs are involved in rRNA processing; most, however, are known or predicted to serve as guide RNAs in ribose methylation of rRNA. Targeting involves direct base pairing of the snoRNA at the rRNA site to be modified and selection of a rRNA nucleotide a fixed distance from box D or D'.

label: H_ACA_box_snoRNA
definition: Members of the box H/ACA family contain an ACA triplet, exactly 3 nt upstream from the 3' end and an H-box in a hinge region that links two structurally similar functional domains of the molecule. Both boxes are important for snoRNA biosynthesis and function. A few box H/ACA snoRNAs are involved in rRNA processing; most others are known or predicted to participate in selection of uridine nucleosides in rRNA to be converted to pseudouridines. Site selection is mediated by direct base pairing of the snoRNA with rRNA through one or both targeting domains.

label: C_D_box_snoRNA_primary_transcript

label: H_ACA_box_snoRNA_primary_transcript

label: transcript_edited_by_U_insertion/deletion

label: guide_RNA

label: group_II_intron
definition: Group II introns are found in rRNA, tRNA and mRNA of organelles in fungi, plants and protists, and also in mRNA in bacteria. They are large self-splicing ribozymes and have 6 structural domains (usually designated dI to dVI). A subset of group II introns also encode essential splicing proteins in intronic ORFs. The length of these introns can therefore be up to 3kb. Splicing occurs in almost identical fashion to nuclear pre-mRNA splicing with two transesterification steps. The 2' hydroxyl of a bulged adenosine in domain VI attacks the 5' splice site, followed by nucleophilic attack on the 3' splice site by the 3' OH of the upstream exon. Protein machinery is required for splicing in vivo, and long range intron to intron and intron-exon interactions are important for splice site positioning. Group II introns are further sub-classified into groups IIA and IIB which differ in splice site consensus, distance of bulged A from 3' splice site, some tertiary interactions, and intronic ORF phylogeny.

label: editing_block
definition: Edited mRNA sequence mediated by a single guide RNA (SO:0000602).

label: intergenic_region
definition: A region containing or overlapping no genes that is bounded on either side by a gene, or bounded by a gene and the end of the chromosome.

label: editing_domain
definition: Edited mRNA sequence mediated by two or more overlapping guide RNAs (SO:0000602).

label: unedited_region
definition: The region of an edited transcript that will not be edited.

label: H_ACA_box_snoRNA_encoding
definition: snoRNA that is associated with guiding polyuridylation. It contains two short conserved sequence motifs: H box (ANANNA) and ACA (ACA).

label: oligo_U_tail
definition: The string of non-encoded U's at the 3' end of a guide RNA (SO:0000602).

label: polyA_sequence
definition: Sequence of about 100 nucleotides of A added to the 3' end of most eukaryotic mRNAs.

label: branch_site
definition: A pyrimidine rich sequence near the 3' end of an intron to which the 5'end becomes covalently bound during nuclear splicing. The resulting structure resembles a lariat.

label: polypyrimidine_tract
definition: The polypyrimidine tract is one of the cis-acting sequence elements directing intron removal in pre-mRNA splicing.

label: bacterial_RNApol_promoter
definition: A DNA sequence to which bacterial RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

label: bacterial_terminator
definition: A terminator signal for bacterial transcription.

label: terminator_of_type_2_RNApol_III_promoter
definition: A terminator signal for RNA polymerase III transcription.

label: transcription_end_site
definition: The base where transcription ends.

label: RNApol_III_promoter_type_1
definition: This type of promoter recruits RNA pol III. This promoter is intragenic and includes an A box, an intermediate element, and a C box. This is well conserved in the 5s rRNA promoters across species.

label: RNApol_III_promoter_type_2
definition: This type of promoter recruits RNA pol III to transcribe genes mainly for t-RNA. This promoter is intragenic and includes an A box and a B box.

label: A_box
definition: A variably distant linear promoter region recognized by TFIIIC, with consensus sequence TGGCnnAGTGG.

label: B_box
definition: A variably distant linear promoter region recognized by TFIIIC, with consensus sequence AGGTTCCAnnCC.

label: RNApol_III_promoter_type_3
definition: This type of promoter recruits RNA pol III to transcribe predominantly noncoding RNAs. This promoter contains a proximal sequence element (PSE) and a TATA box upstream of the gene that it regulates. Transcription can also be activated by a distal sequence element (DSE), which is located further upstream.

label: C_box
definition: An RNA polymerase III type 1 promoter with consensus sequence CAnnCCn.

label: snRNA_encoding
definition: A region that can be transcribed into a small nuclear RNA (snRNA).

label: telomere
definition: A specific structure at the end of a linear chromosome, required for the integrity and maintenance of the end.

label: silencer
definition: A regulatory region which upon binding of transcription factors, suppress the transcription of the gene or genes they control.

label: chromosomal_regulatory_element
definition: Regions of the chromosome that are important for regulating binding of chromosomes to the nuclear matrix.

label: insulator
definition: A regulatory region that 1) when located between a CRM and a gene's promoter prevents the CRM from modulating that genes expression and 2) acts as a chromatin boundary element or barrier that can block the encroachment of condensed chromatin from an adjacent region.

label: chromosomal_structural_element
definition: Regions of the chromosome that are important for structural elements.

label: five_prime_open_reading_frame
definition: An open reading frame found within the 5' UTR that can be translated and stall the translation of the downstream open reading frame.

label: upstream_AUG_codon
definition: A start codon upstream of the ORF.

label: polycistronic_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding for more than one gene product.

label: monocistronic_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding for one gene product.

label: monocistronic_mRNA
definition: An mRNA with either a single protein product, or for which the regions encoding all its protein products overlap.

label: polycistronic_mRNA
definition: An mRNA that encodes multiple proteins from at least two non-overlapping regions.

label: mini_exon_donor_RNA
definition: A primary transcript that donates the spliced leader to other mRNA.

label: spliced_leader_RNA
definition: Snall nuclear RNAs that are incorporated into the pre-mRNAs to replace the 5' end in some eukaryotes.

label: engineered_plasmid
definition: A plasmid that is engineered.

label: transcribed_spacer_region
definition: Part of an rRNA transcription unit that is transcribed but discarded during maturation, not giving rise to any part of rRNA.

label: internal_transcribed_spacer_region
definition: Non-coding regions of DNA sequence that separate genes coding for the 28S, 5.8S, and 18S ribosomal RNAs.

label: external_transcribed_spacer_region
definition: Non-coding regions of DNA that precede the sequence that codes for the ribosomal RNA.

label: tetranucleotide_repeat_microsatellite_feature
definition: A region of a repeating tetranucleotide sequence (four bases).

label: SRP_RNA_encoding
definition: A region that can be transcribed into a signal recognition particle RNA (SRP RNA).

label: minisatellite
definition: A repeat region containing tandemly repeated sequences having a unit length of 10 to 40 bp.

label: antisense_RNA
definition: Antisense RNA is RNA that is transcribed from the coding, rather than the template, strand of DNA. It is therefore complementary to mRNA.

label: antisense_primary_transcript
definition: The reverse complement of the primary transcript.

label: siRNA
definition: A small RNA molecule that is the product of a longer exogenous or endogenous dsRNA, which is either a bimolecular duplex or very long hairpin, processed (via the Dicer pathway) such that numerous siRNAs accumulate from both strands of the dsRNA. siRNAs trigger the cleavage of their target molecules.

label: miRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a micro RNA.

label: cytosolic_SSU_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic SSU rRNA is an RNA component of the small subunit of cytosolic ribosomes.

label: cytosolic_LSU_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic LSU rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of cytosolic ribosomes.

label: cytosolic_5S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 5S rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of cytosolic ribosomes in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes.

label: cytosolic_28S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 28S rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of cytosolic ribosomes in metazoan eukaryotes.

label: maxicircle_gene
definition: A mitochondrial gene located in a maxicircle.

label: ncRNA
definition: An RNA transcript that does not encode for a protein rather the RNA molecule is the gene product.

label: stRNA_encoding
definition: A region that can be transcribed into a small temporal RNA (stRNA). Found in roundworm development.

label: repeat_region
definition: A region of sequence containing one or more repeat units.

label: dispersed_repeat
definition: A repeat that is located at dispersed sites in the genome.

label: tmRNA_encoding
definition: A region that can be transcribed into a transfer-messenger RNA (tmRNA).

label: spliceosomal_intron
definition: An intron which is spliced by the spliceosome.

label: tRNA_encoding
definition: A region that can be transcribed into a transfer RNA (tRNA).

label: introgressed_chromosome_region
definition: A region of a chromosome that has been introduced by backcrossing with a separate species.

label: monocistronic_transcript
definition: A transcript that is monocistronic.

label: mobile_intron
definition: An intron (mitochondrial, chloroplast, nuclear or prokaryotic) that encodes a double strand sequence specific endonuclease allowing for mobility.

label: insertion
definition: The sequence of one or more nucleotides added between two adjacent nucleotides in the sequence.

label: EST_match
definition: A match against an EST sequence.

label: sequence_rearrangement_feature
definition: A feature where a segment of DNA has been rearranged from what it was in the parent cell.

label: chromosome_breakage_sequence
definition: A sequence within the micronuclear DNA of ciliates at which chromosome breakage and telomere addition occurs during nuclear differentiation.

label: internal_eliminated_sequence
definition: A sequence eliminated from the genome of ciliates during nuclear differentiation.

label: macronucleus_destined_segment
definition: A sequence that is conserved, although rearranged relative to the micronucleus, in the macronucleus of a ciliate genome.

label: transcript
definition: An RNA synthesized on a DNA or RNA template by an RNA polymerase.

label: non_canonical_splice_site
definition: A splice site where the donor and acceptor sites differ from the canonical form.
