label: canonical_splice_site
definition: The major class of splice site with dinucleotides GT and AG for donor and acceptor sites, respectively.

label: canonical_three_prime_splice_site
definition: The canonical 3' splice site has the sequence "AG".

label: canonical_five_prime_splice_site
definition: The canonical 5' splice site has the sequence "GT".

label: non_canonical_three_prime_splice_site
definition: A 3' splice site that does not have the sequence "AG".

label: non_canonical_five_prime_splice_site
definition: A 5' splice site which does not have the sequence "GT".

label: non_canonical_start_codon
definition: A start codon that is not the usual AUG sequence.

label: aberrant_processed_transcript
definition: A transcript that has been processed "incorrectly", for example by the failure of splicing of one or more exons.

label: exonic_splice_enhancer
definition: Exonic splicing enhancers (ESEs) facilitate exon definition by assisting in the recruitment of splicing factors to the adjacent intron.

label: nuclease_sensitive_site
definition: A region of nucleotide sequence targeted by a nuclease enzyme.

label: DNaseI_hypersensitive_site
definition: DNA region representing open chromatin structure that is hypersensitive to digestion by DNase I.

label: translocation_element
definition: A chromosomal translocation whereby the chromosomes carrying non-homologous centromeres may be recovered independently. These chromosomes are described as translocation elements. This occurs for some translocations, particularly but not exclusively, reciprocal translocations.

label: deletion_junction
definition: The space between two bases in a sequence which marks the position where a deletion has occurred.

label: golden_path
definition: A set of subregions selected from sequence contigs which when concatenated form a nonredundant linear sequence.

label: cDNA_match
definition: A match against cDNA sequence.

label: gene_with_polycistronic_transcript
definition: A gene that encodes a polycistronic transcript.

label: cleaved_initiator_methionine
definition: The initiator methionine that has been cleaved from a mature polypeptide sequence.

label: gene_with_dicistronic_transcript
definition: A gene that encodes a dicistronic transcript.

label: gene_with_recoded_mRNA
definition: A gene that encodes an mRNA that is recoded.

label: SNP
definition: SNPs are single base pair positions in genomic DNA at which different sequence alternatives exist in normal individuals in some population(s), wherein the least frequent variant has an abundance of 1% or greater.

label: reagent
definition: A sequence used in experiment.

label: oligo
definition: A short oligonucleotide sequence, of length on the order of 10's of bases; either single or double stranded.

label: gene_with_stop_codon_read_through
definition: A gene that encodes a transcript with stop codon readthrough.

label: gene_with_stop_codon_redefined_as_pyrrolysine
definition: A gene encoding an mRNA that has the stop codon redefined as pyrrolysine.

label: junction
definition: A sequence_feature with an extent of zero.

label: remark
definition: A comment about the sequence.

label: possible_base_call_error
definition: A region of sequence where the validity of the base calling is questionable.

label: possible_assembly_error
definition: A region of sequence where there may have been an error in the assembly.

label: experimental_result_region
definition: A region of sequence implicated in an experimental result.

label: gene
definition: A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions.

label: tandem_repeat
definition: Two or more adjacent copies of a region (of length greater than 1).

label: trans_splice_acceptor_site
definition: The 3' splice site of the acceptor primary transcript.

label: trans_splice_donor_site
definition: The 5' five prime splice site region of the donor RNA.

label: SL1_acceptor_site
definition: A trans_splicing_acceptor_site which appends the 22nt SL1 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of most mRNAs.

label: SL2_acceptor_site
definition: A trans_splicing_acceptor_site which appends the 22nt SL2 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of mRNAs. SL2 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: gene_with_stop_codon_redefined_as_selenocysteine
definition: A gene encoding an mRNA that has the stop codon redefined as selenocysteine.

label: gene_with_mRNA_recoded_by_translational_bypass
definition: A gene with mRNA recoded by translational bypass.

label: gene_with_transcript_with_translational_frameshift
definition: A gene encoding a transcript that has a translational frameshift.

label: DNA_motif
definition: A motif that is active in the DNA form of the sequence.

label: nucleotide_motif
definition: A region of nucleotide sequence corresponding to a known motif.

label: RNA_motif
definition: A motif that is active in RNA sequence.

label: dicistronic_mRNA
definition: An mRNA that has the quality dicistronic.

label: reading_frame
definition: A nucleic acid sequence that when read as sequential triplets, has the potential of encoding a sequential string of amino acids. It need not contain the start or stop codon.

label: blocked_reading_frame
definition: A reading_frame that is interrupted by one or more stop codons; usually identified through inter-genomic sequence comparisons.

label: ultracontig
definition: An ordered and oriented set of scaffolds based on somewhat weaker sets of inferential evidence such as one set of mate pair reads together with supporting evidence from ESTs or location of markers from SNP or microsatellite maps, or cytogenetic localization of contained markers.

label: foreign_transposable_element
definition: A transposable element that is foreign.

label: gene_with_dicistronic_primary_transcript
definition: A gene that encodes a dicistronic primary transcript.

label: gene_with_dicistronic_mRNA
definition: A gene that encodes a polycistronic mRNA.

label: iDNA
definition: Genomic sequence removed from the genome, as a normal event, by a process of recombination.

label: oriT
definition: A region of a DNA molecule where transfer is initiated during the process of conjugation or mobilization.

label: transit_peptide
definition: The transit_peptide is a short region at the N-terminus of the peptide that directs the protein to an organelle (chloroplast, mitochondrion, microbody or cyanelle).

label: repeat_unit
definition: The simplest repeated component of a repeat region. A single repeat.

label: cis_regulatory_module
definition: A regulatory region where transcription factor binding sites are clustered to regulate various aspects of transcription activities. (CRMs can be located a few kb to hundreds of kb upstream of the core promoter, in the coding sequence, within introns, or in the untranslated regions (UTR) sequences, and even on a different chromosome). A single gene can be regulated by multiple CRMs to give precise control of its spatial and temporal expression. CRMs function as nodes in large, intertwined regulatory network. CRM DNA accessibility is subject to regulation by dbTFs and transcription co-TFs.

label: intein
definition: A region of a peptide that is able to excise itself and rejoin the remaining portions with a peptide bond.

label: intein_containing
definition: An attribute of protein-coding genes where the initial protein product contains an intein.

label: gap
definition: A gap in the sequence of known length. The unknown bases are filled in with N's.

label: fragmentary
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that is incomplete.

label: predicted
definition: An attribute describing an unverified region.

label: feature_attribute
definition: An attribute describing a located_sequence_feature.

label: exemplar_mRNA
definition: An exemplar is a representative cDNA sequence for each gene. The exemplar approach is a method that usually involves some initial clustering into gene groups and the subsequent selection of a representative from each gene group.

label: sequence_location
definition: The location of a sequence.

label: organelle_sequence
definition: A sequence of DNA that originates from a an organelle.

label: mitochondrial_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a mitochondria.

label: nuclear_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the nuclear genome of cell.

label: nucleomorphic_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a plastid such as a chloroplast. The nucleomorph is the nuclei of the plastic.

label: plastid_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a plastid such as a chloroplast.

label: kinetoplast
definition: A kinetoplast is an interlocked network of thousands of minicircles and tens of maxicircles, located near the base of the flagellum of some protozoan species.

label: maxicircle
definition: A maxicircle is a replicon, part of a kinetoplast, that contains open reading frames and replicates via a rolling circle method.

label: apicoplast_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of an apicoplast, a non-photosynthetic plastid.

label: chromoplast_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a chromoplast, a colored plastid for synthesis and storage of pigments.

label: chloroplast_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a chloroplast, a green plastid for photosynthesis.

label: cyanelle_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a cyanelle, a photosynthetic plastid found in algae.

label: leucoplast_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a leucoplast, a colorless plastid generally containing starch or oil.

label: proplastid_sequence
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a proplastid such as an immature chloroplast.

label: plasmid_location
definition: The location of DNA that has come from a plasmid sequence.

label: amplification_origin
definition: An origin_of_replication that is used for the amplification of a chromosomal nucleic acid sequence.

label: proviral_location
definition: The location of DNA that has come from a viral origin.

label: gene_group_regulatory_region
definition: A region that is involved in the regulation of transcription of a group of regulated genes.

label: clone_insert
definition: The region of sequence that has been inserted and is being propagated by the clone.

label: lambda_vector
definition: The lambda bacteriophage is the vector for the linear lambda clone. The genes involved in the lysogenic pathway are removed from the from the viral DNA. Up to 25 kb of foreign DNA can then be inserted into the lambda genome.

label: plasmid_vector
definition: A plasmid that has been generated to act as a vector for foreign sequence.

label: cDNA
definition: DNA synthesized by reverse transcriptase using RNA as a template.

label: single_stranded_cDNA
definition: DNA synthesized from RNA by reverse transcriptase, single stranded.

label: double_stranded_cDNA
definition: DNA synthesized from RNA by reverse transcriptase that has been copied by PCR to make it double stranded.

label: pyrrolysyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a pyrrolysine anticodon, and a 3' pyrrolysine binding region.

label: episome
definition: A plasmid that may integrate with a chromosome.

label: tmRNA_coding_piece
definition: The region of a two-piece tmRNA that bears the reading frame encoding the proteolysis tag. The tmRNA gene undergoes circular permutation in some groups of bacteria. Processing of the transcripts from such a gene leaves the mature tmRNA in two pieces, base-paired together.

label: tmRNA_acceptor_piece
definition: The acceptor region of a two-piece tmRNA that when mature is charged at its 3' end with alanine. The tmRNA gene undergoes circular permutation in some groups of bacteria; processing of the transcripts from such a gene leaves the mature tmRNA in two pieces, base-paired together.

label: QTL
definition: A quantitative trait locus (QTL) is a polymorphic locus which contains alleles that differentially affect the expression of a continuously distributed phenotypic trait. Usually it is a marker described by statistical association to quantitative variation in the particular phenotypic trait that is thought to be controlled by the cumulative action of alleles at multiple loci.

label: genomic_island
definition: A genomic island is an integrated mobile genetic element, characterized by size (over 10 Kb). It that has features that suggest a foreign origin. These can include nucleotide distribution (oligonucleotides signature, CG content etc.) that differs from the bulk of the chromosome and/or genes suggesting DNA mobility.

label: pathogenic_island
definition: Mobile genetic elements that contribute to rapid changes in virulence potential. They are present on the genomes of pathogenic strains but absent from the genomes of non pathogenic members of the same or related species.

label: metabolic_island
definition: A transmissible element containing genes involved in metabolism, analogous to the pathogenicity islands of gram negative bacteria.

label: adaptive_island
definition: An adaptive island is a genomic island that provides an adaptive advantage to the host.

label: symbiosis_island
definition: A transmissible element containing genes involved in symbiosis, analogous to the pathogenicity islands of gram negative bacteria.

label: pseudogenic_rRNA
definition: A non functional descendant of an rRNA.

label: pseudogenic_tRNA
definition: A non functional descendent of a tRNA.

label: engineered_episome
definition: An episome that is engineered.

label: transgenic
definition: Attribute describing sequence that has been integrated with foreign sequence.

label: natural
definition: An attribute describing a feature that occurs in nature.

label: engineered
definition: An attribute to describe a region that was modified in vitro.

label: foreign
definition: An attribute to describe a region from another species.

label: cloned_region
definition: The region of sequence that has been inserted and is being propagated by the clone.

label: validated
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that has been proven.

label: invalidated
definition: An attribute describing a feature that is invalidated.

label: engineered_rescue_region
definition: A rescue region that is engineered.

label: rescue_mini_gene
definition: A mini_gene that rescues.

label: transgenic_transposable_element
definition: TE that has been modified in vitro, including insertion of DNA derived from a source other than the originating TE.

label: natural_transposable_element
definition: TE that exists (or existed) in nature.

label: engineered_transposable_element
definition: TE that has been modified by manipulations in vitro.

label: engineered_foreign_transposable_element
definition: A transposable_element that is engineered and foreign.

label: assortment_derived_duplication
definition: A multi-chromosome duplication aberration generated by reassortment of other aberration components.

label: assortment_derived_deficiency_plus_duplication
definition: A multi-chromosome aberration generated by reassortment of other aberration components; presumed to have a deficiency and a duplication.

label: assortment_derived_deficiency
definition: A multi-chromosome deficiency aberration generated by reassortment of other aberration components.

label: assortment_derived_aneuploid
definition: A multi-chromosome aberration generated by reassortment of other aberration components; presumed to have a deficiency or a duplication.

label: engineered_region
definition: A region that is engineered.

label: engineered_foreign_region
definition: A region that is engineered and foreign.

label: fusion
definition: When two regions of DNA are joined together that are not normally together.

label: engineered_tag
definition: A tag that is engineered.

label: validated_cDNA_clone
definition: A cDNA clone that has been validated.

label: invalidated_cDNA_clone
definition: A cDNA clone that is invalid.

label: chimeric_cDNA_clone
definition: A cDNA clone invalidated because it is chimeric.

label: genomically_contaminated_cDNA_clone
definition: A cDNA clone invalidated by genomic contamination.

label: polyA_primed_cDNA_clone
definition: A cDNA clone invalidated by polyA priming.

label: partially_processed_cDNA_clone
definition: A cDNA invalidated clone by partial processing.

label: rescue
definition: An attribute describing a region's ability, when introduced to a mutant organism, to re-establish (rescue) a phenotype.

label: mini_gene
definition: By definition, minigenes are short open-reading frames (ORF), usually encoding approximately 9 to 20 amino acids, which are expressed in vivo (as distinct from being synthesized as peptide or protein ex vivo and subsequently injected). The in vivo synthesis confers a distinct advantage: the expressed sequences can enter both antigen presentation pathways, MHC I (inducing CD8+ T- cells, which are usually cytotoxic T-lymphocytes (CTL)) and MHC II (inducing CD4+ T-cells, usually 'T-helpers' (Th)); and can encounter B-cells, inducing antibody responses. Three main vector approaches have been used to deliver minigenes: viral vectors, bacterial vectors and plasmid DNA.

label: rescue_gene
definition: A gene that rescues.

label: wild_type
definition: An attribute describing sequence with the genotype found in nature and/or standard laboratory stock.

label: wild_type_rescue_gene
definition: A gene that rescues.

label: mitochondrial_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a mitochondria.

label: chloroplast_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a chloroplast.

label: chromoplast_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a chromoplast.

label: cyanelle_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a cyanelle.

label: leucoplast_chromosome
definition: A chromosome with origin in a leucoplast.

label: macronuclear_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a macronucleus.

label: micronuclear_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a micronucleus.

label: nuclear_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a nucleus.

label: nucleomorphic_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in a nucleomorph.

label: chromosome_part
definition: A region of a chromosome.

label: gene_member_region
definition: A region of a gene.

label: promoter_region
definition: A region of sequence which is part of a promoter.

label: transcript_region
definition: A region of a transcript.

label: mature_transcript_region
definition: A region of a mature transcript.

label: primary_transcript_region
definition: A part of a primary transcript.

label: mRNA_region
definition: A region of an mRNA.

label: UTR_region
definition: A region of UTR.

label: rRNA_primary_transcript_region
definition: A region of an rRNA primary transcript.

label: polypeptide_region
definition: Biological sequence region that can be assigned to a specific subsequence of a polypeptide.

label: repeat_component
definition: A region of a repeated sequence.

label: spliceosomal_intron_region
definition: A region within an intron.

label: gene_component_region
definition: A region of a gene that has a specific function.

label: bacterial_RNApol_promoter_region
definition: A region which is part of a bacterial RNA polymerase promoter.

label: RNApol_II_promoter_region
definition: A region of sequence which is a promoter for RNA polymerase II.

label: RNApol_III_promoter_type_1_region
definition: A region of sequence which is a promoter for RNA polymerase III type 1.

label: RNApol_III_promoter_type_2_region
definition: A region of sequence which is a promoter for RNA polymerase III type 2.

label: tmRNA_region
definition: A region of a tmRNA.

label: LTR_component
definition: The long terminal repeat found at the ends of the sequence to be inserted into the host genome.

label: three_prime_LTR_component
definition: A component of the three-prime long terminal repeat.

label: five_prime_LTR_component
definition: A component of the five-prime long terminal repeat.

label: CDS_region
definition: A region of a CDS.

label: exon_region
definition: A region of an exon.

label: homologous_region
definition: A region that is homologous to another region.

label: paralogous_region
definition: A homologous_region that is paralogous to another region.

label: orthologous_region
definition: A homologous_region that is orthologous to another region.

label: conserved
definition: A region that is similar or identical across more than one species.

label: homologous
definition: Similarity due to common ancestry.

label: orthologous
definition: An attribute describing a kind of homology where divergence occurred after a speciation event.

label: paralogous
definition: An attribute describing a kind of homology where divergence occurred after a duplication event.

label: syntenic
definition: Attribute describing sequence regions occurring in same order on chromosome of different species.

label: capped_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript that is capped.

label: capped_mRNA
definition: An mRNA that is capped.

label: mRNA_attribute
definition: An attribute describing an mRNA feature.

label: exemplar
definition: An attribute describing a sequence is representative of a class of similar sequences.

label: frameshift
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that contains a mutation involving the deletion or insertion of one or more bases, where this number is not divisible by 3.

label: minus_1_frameshift
definition: A frameshift caused by deleting one base.

label: minus_2_frameshift
definition: A frameshift caused by deleting two bases.

label: plus_1_frameshift
definition: A frameshift caused by inserting one base.

label: plus_2_framshift
definition: A frameshift caused by inserting two bases.

label: trans_spliced
definition: An attribute describing transcript sequence that is created by splicing exons from diferent genes.

label: polyadenylated_mRNA
definition: An mRNA that is polyadenylated.

label: trans_spliced_mRNA
definition: An mRNA that is trans-spliced.

label: edited_transcript
sub_class_of: guided_by some guide_RNA|has_part some anchor_binding_site|has_quality some edited|transcript
definition: A transcript that is edited.

label: edited_transcript_by_A_to_I_substitution
definition: A transcript that has been edited by A to I substitution.

label: bound_by_protein
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that is bound by a protein.

label: bound_by_nucleic_acid
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that is bound by a nucleic acid.

label: alternatively_spliced
definition: An attribute describing a situation where a gene may encode for more than 1 transcript.

label: monocistronic
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that contains the code for one gene product.

label: dicistronic
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that contains the code for two gene products.

label: polycistronic
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that contains the code for more than one gene product.

label: recoded
definition: An attribute describing an mRNA sequence that has been reprogrammed at translation, causing localized alterations.

label: codon_redefined
definition: An attribute describing the alteration of codon meaning.

label: stop_codon_read_through
definition: A stop codon redefined to be a new amino acid.

label: stop_codon_redefined_as_pyrrolysine
definition: A stop codon redefined to be the new amino acid, pyrrolysine.

label: stop_codon_redefined_as_selenocysteine
definition: A stop codon redefined to be the new amino acid, selenocysteine.

label: recoded_by_translational_bypass
definition: Recoded mRNA where a block of nucleotides is not translated.

label: translationally_frameshifted
definition: Recoding by frameshifting a particular site.

label: maternally_imprinted_gene
definition: A gene that is maternally_imprinted.

label: paternally_imprinted_gene
definition: A gene that is paternally imprinted.

label: post_translationally_regulated_gene
definition: A gene that is post translationally regulated.

label: negatively_autoregulated_gene
definition: A gene that is negatively autoreguated.

label: positively_autoregulated_gene
definition: A gene that is positively autoregulated.

label: silenced
definition: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated at transcriptional or translational level.

label: silenced_by_DNA_modification
definition: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by DNA modifications, resulting in repression of transcription.

label: silenced_by_DNA_methylation
definition: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by DNA methylation, resulting in repression of transcription.

label: translationally_regulated_gene
definition: A gene that is translationally regulated.

label: allelically_excluded_gene
definition: A gene that is allelically_excluded.

label: epigenetically_modified_gene
definition: A gene that is epigenetically modified.

label: nuclear_mitochondrial
definition: An attribute describing a nuclear pseudogene of a mitochndrial gene.

label: processed
definition: An attribute describing a pseudogene where by an mRNA was retrotransposed. The mRNA sequence is transcribed back into the genome, lacking introns and promotors, but often including a polyA tail.

label: unequally_crossed_over
definition: An attribute describing a pseudogene that was created by tandem duplication and unequal crossing over during recombination.

label: transgene
definition: A transgene is a gene that has been transferred naturally or by any of a number of genetic engineering techniques from one organism to another.

label: endogenous_retroviral_sequence
definition: Endogenous DNA sequence that are likely to have arisen from retroviruses.

label: rearranged_at_DNA_level
definition: An attribute to describe the sequence of a feature, where the DNA is rearranged.

label: status
definition: An attribute describing the status of a feature, based on the available evidence.

label: independently_known
definition: Attribute to describe a feature that is independently known - not predicted.

label: supported_by_sequence_similarity
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that has been predicted using sequence similarity techniques.

label: supported_by_domain_match
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that has been predicted using sequence similarity of a known domain.

label: supported_by_EST_or_cDNA
definition: An attribute to describe a feature that has been predicted using sequence similarity to EST or cDNA data.

label: orphan
definition: A gene whose predicted amino acid sequence is unsupported by any experimental evidence or by any match with any other known sequence.

label: predicted_by_ab_initio_computation
definition: An attribute describing a feature that is predicted by a computer program that did not rely on sequence similarity.

label: asx_turn
definition: A motif of three consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Aspartate or Asparagine (Asx), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2).

label: cloned_cDNA_insert
definition: A clone insert made from cDNA.

label: cloned_genomic_insert
definition: A clone insert made from genomic DNA.

label: engineered_insert
definition: A clone insert that is engineered.

label: insert_U
definition: An edit to insert a U.

label: delete_U
definition: An edit to delete a uridine.

label: substitute_A_to_I
definition: An edit to substitute an I for an A.

label: insert_C
definition: An edit to insert a cytidine.

label: insert_dinucleotide
definition: An edit to insert a dinucleotide.

label: substitute_C_to_U
definition: An edit to substitute an U for a C.

label: insert_G
definition: An edit to insert a G.

label: insert_GC
definition: An edit to insert a GC dinucleotide.

label: insert_GU
definition: An edit to insert a GU dinucleotide.

label: insert_CU
definition: An edit to insert a CU dinucleotide.

label: insert_AU
definition: An edit to insert a AU dinucleotide.

label: insert_AA
definition: An edit to insert a AA dinucleotide.

label: edited_mRNA
definition: An mRNA that is edited.

label: guide_RNA_region
definition: A region of guide RNA.

label: anchor_region
definition: A region of a guide_RNA that base-pairs to a target mRNA.

label: pre_edited_mRNA
definition: A primary transcript that, at least in part, encodes one or more proteins that has not been edited.

label: intermediate
definition: An attribute to describe a feature between stages of processing.

label: miRNA_target_site
definition: A miRNA target site is a binding site where the molecule is a micro RNA.

label: edited_CDS
definition: A CDS that is edited.

label: vertebrate_immunoglobulin_T_cell_receptor_rearranged_segment
definition: Genomic DNA of immunoglobulin/T-cell receptor gene in partially rearranged genomic DNA.

label: vertebrate_immunoglobulin_T_cell_receptor_rearranged_gene_cluster
definition: Genomic DNA of immunoglobulin/T-cell receptor gene in rearranged configuration.

label: vertebrate_immune_system_gene_recombination_signal_feature
definition: Feature used for the recombination of genomic material for the purpose of generating diversity of the immune system.

label: recombinationally_rearranged
definition: A gene that is recombinationally rearranged.

label: recombinationally_rearranged_vertebrate_immune_system_gene
definition: A recombinationally rearranged gene of the vertebrate immune system.

label: attP_site
definition: An integration/excision site of a phage chromosome at which a recombinase acts to insert the phage DNA at a cognate integration/excision site on a bacterial chromosome.

label: attB_site
definition: An integration/excision site of a bacterial chromosome at which a recombinase acts to insert foreign DNA containing a cognate integration/excision site.

label: attL_site
definition: A region that results from recombination between attP_site and attB_site, composed of the 5' portion of attB_site and the 3' portion of attP_site.

label: attR_site
definition: A region that results from recombination between attP_site and attB_site, composed of the 5' portion of attP_site and the 3' portion of attB_site.

label: integration_excision_site
definition: A region specifically recognised by a recombinase, which inserts or removes another region marked by a distinct cognate integration/excision site.

label: resolution_site
definition: A region specifically recognized by a recombinase, which separates a physically contiguous circle of DNA into two physically separate circles.

label: inversion_site
definition: A region specifically recognised by a recombinase, which inverts the region flanked by a pair of sites.

label: dif_site
definition: A site at which replicated bacterial circular chromosomes are decatenated by site specific resolvase.

label: attC_site
definition: An attC site is a sequence required for the integration of a DNA of an integron.

label: eukaryotic_terminator
definition: A signal for RNA polymerase to terminate transcription.

label: oriV
definition: An origin of vegetative replication in plasmids and phages.

label: oriC
definition: An origin of bacterial chromosome replication.

label: DNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, DNA molecule.

label: double_stranded_DNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, double-stranded DNA molecule.

label: single_stranded_DNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, single-stranded DNA molecule.

label: linear_double_stranded_DNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, double-stranded, linear DNA molecule.

label: circular_double_stranded_DNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, double-stranded, circular DNA molecule.

label: linear_single_stranded_DNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, single-stranded, linear DNA molecule.

label: circular_single_stranded_DNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, single-stranded, circular DNA molecule.

label: RNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, RNA molecule.

label: single_stranded_RNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, single-stranded RNA molecule.

label: linear_single_stranded_RNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, single-stranded, linear RNA molecule.

label: linear_double_stranded_RNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, double-stranded, linear RNA molecule.

label: double_stranded_RNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, double-stranded RNA molecule.

label: circular_single_stranded_RNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, single-stranded, circular DNA molecule.

label: circular_double_stranded_RNA_chromosome
definition: Structural unit composed of a self-replicating, double-stranded, circular RNA molecule.

label: insertion_sequence
definition: A terminal_inverted_repeat_element that is bacterial and only encodes the functions required for its transposition between these inverted repeats.

label: minicircle_gene
definition: A gene found within a minicircle.

label: cryptic
definition: A feature_attribute describing a feature that is not manifest under normal conditions.

label: template_region
definition: A region of a guide_RNA that specifies the insertions and deletions of bases in the editing of a target mRNA.

label: gRNA_encoding
definition: A non-protein_coding gene that encodes a guide_RNA.

label: minicircle
definition: A minicircle is a replicon, part of a kinetoplast, that encodes for guide RNAs.

label: rho_dependent_bacterial_terminator
definition: A transcription terminator that is dependent upon Rho.

label: rho_independent_bacterial_terminator
definition: A transcription terminator that is not dependent upon Rho. Rather, the mRNA contains a sequence that allows it to base-pair with itself and make a stem-loop structure.

label: strand_attribute
definition: The attribute of how many strands are present in a nucleotide polymer.

label: single
definition: When a nucleotide polymer has only one strand.

label: double
definition: When a nucleotide polymer has two strands that are reverse-complement to one another and pair together.

label: topology_attribute
definition: The attribute of whether a nucleotide polymer is linear or circular.

label: linear
definition: A quality of a nucleotide polymer that has a 3'-terminal residue and a 5'-terminal residue.

label: circular
definition: A quality of a nucleotide polymer that has no terminal nucleotide residues.

label: class_II_RNA
definition: Small non-coding RNA (59-60 nt long) containing 5' and 3' ends that are predicted to come together to form a stem structure. Identified in the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and localized in the cytoplasm.

label: class_I_RNA
definition: Small non-coding RNA (55-65 nt long) containing highly conserved 5' and 3' ends (16 and 8 nt, respectively) that are predicted to come together to form a stem structure. Identified in the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and localized in the cytoplasm.

label: genomic_DNA
definition: DNA located in the genome and able to be transmitted to the offspring.

label: BAC_cloned_genomic_insert
definition: A region of DNA that has been inserted into the bacterial genome using a bacterial artificial chromosome.

label: consensus
definition: A sequence produced from an aligment algorithm that uses multiple sequences as input.

label: consensus_region
definition: A region that has a known consensus sequence.

label: consensus_mRNA
definition: An mRNA sequence produced from an aligment algorithm that uses multiple sequences as input.

label: predicted_gene
definition: A region of the genome that has been predicted to be a gene but has not been confirmed by laboratory experiments.

label: gene_fragment
definition: A portion of a gene that is not the complete gene.

label: recursive_splice_site
definition: A recursive splice site is a splice site which subdivides a large intron. Recursive splicing is a mechanism that splices large introns by sub dividing the intron at non exonic elements and alternate exons.

label: BAC_end
definition: A region of sequence from the end of a BAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

label: cytosolic_16S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 16S rRNA is an RNA component of the small subunit of cytosolic ribosomes in prokaryotes.

label: cytosolic_23S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 23S rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of cytosolic ribosomes in prokaryotes.

label: cytosolic_25S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 25S rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of cytosolic ribosomes most eukaryotes.

label: solo_LTR
definition: A recombination product between the 2 LTR of the same element.

label: low_complexity
definition: When a sequence does not contain an equal distribution of all four possible nucleotide bases or does not contain all nucleotide bases.

label: low_complexity_region
definition: A region where the DNA does not contain an equal distrubution of all four possible nucleotides or does not contain all four nucleotides.

label: prophage
definition: A phage genome after it has established in the host genome in a latent/immune state either as a plasmid or as an integrated "island".

label: cryptic_prophage
definition: A remnant of an integrated prophage in the host genome or an "island" in the host genome that includes phage like-genes.

label: tetraloop
definition: A base-paired stem with loop of 4 non-hydrogen bonded nucleotides.

label: DNA_constraint_sequence
definition: A double-stranded DNA used to control macromolecular structure and function.

label: i_motif
definition: A cytosine rich domain whereby strands associate both inter- and intramolecularly at moderately acidic pH.

label: PNA_oligo
definition: Peptide nucleic acid, is a chemical not known to occur naturally but is artificially synthesized and used in some biological research and medical treatments. The PNA backbone is composed of repeating N-(2-aminoethyl)-glycine units linked by peptide bonds. The purine and pyrimidine bases are linked to the backbone by methylene carbonyl bonds.

label: DNAzyme
definition: A DNA sequence with catalytic activity.

label: MNP
definition: A multiple nucleotide polymorphism with alleles of common length > 1, for example AAA/TTT.

label: intron_domain
definition: An intronic region that has an attribute.

label: wobble_base_pair
definition: A type of non-canonical base pairing, most commonly between G and U, which is important for the secondary structure of RNAs. It has similar thermodynamic stability to the Watson-Crick pairing. Wobble base pairs only have two hydrogen bonds. Other wobble base pair possibilities are I-A, I-U and I-C.

label: internal_guide_sequence
definition: A purine-rich sequence in the group I introns which determines the locations of the splice sites in group I intron splicing and has catalytic activity.

label: silent_mutation
definition: A sequence variant that does not affect protein function. Silent mutations may occur in genic ( CDS, UTR, intron etc) and intergenic regions. Silent mutations may have affects on processes such as splicing and regulation.

label: epitope
definition: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with antibodies, B cells or T cells.

label: copy_number_variation
definition: A variation that increases or decreases the copy number of a given region.

label: chromosome_breakpoint
definition: A chromosomal region that may sustain a double-strand break, resulting in a recombination event.

label: inversion_breakpoint
definition: The point within a chromosome where an inversion begins or ends.

label: allele
definition: An allele is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a gene.

label: haplotype
definition: A haplotype is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a haplotype block.

label: polymorphic_sequence_variant
definition: A sequence variant that is segregating in one or more natural populations of a species.

label: genome
definition: A genome is the sum of genetic material within a cell or virion.

label: genotype
definition: A genotype is a variant genome, complete or incomplete.

label: diplotype
definition: A diplotype is a pair of haplotypes from a given individual. It is a genotype where the phase is known.

label: direction_attribute
definition: The attribute of whether the sequence is the same direction as a feature (forward) or the opposite direction as a feature (reverse).

label: forward
definition: Forward is an attribute of the feature, where the feature is in the 5' to 3' direction.

label: reverse
definition: Reverse is an attribute of the feature, where the feature is in the 3' to 5' direction. Again could be applied to primer.

label: mitochondrial_DNA
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a mitochondria.

label: chloroplast_DNA
definition: DNA belonging to the genome of a chloroplast, a photosynthetic plastid.

label: miRtron
definition: A de-branched intron which mimics the structure of pre-miRNA and enters the miRNA processing pathway without Drosha mediated cleavage.

label: piRNA
definition: A small non coding RNA, part of a silencing system that prevents the spreading of selfish genetic elements.

label: arginyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has an arginine anticodon, and a 3' arginine binding region.

label: mobile_genetic_element
definition: A nucleotide region with either intra-genome or intracellular mobility, of varying length, which often carry the information necessary for transfer and recombination with the host genome.

label: extrachromosomal_mobile_genetic_element
definition: An MGE that is not integrated into the host chromosome.

label: integrated_mobile_genetic_element
definition: An MGE that is integrated into the host chromosome.

label: integrated_plasmid
definition: A plasmid sequence that is integrated within the host chromosome.

label: viral_sequence
definition: The region of nucleotide sequence of a virus, a submicroscopic particle that replicates by infecting a host cell.

label: phage_sequence
definition: The nucleotide sequence of a virus that infects bacteria.

label: attCtn_site
definition: An attachment site located on a conjugative transposon and used for site-specific integration of a conjugative transposon.

label: nuclear_mt_pseudogene
definition: A nuclear pseudogene of either coding or non-coding mitochondria derived sequence.

label: cointegrated_plasmid
definition: A MGE region consisting of two fused plasmids resulting from a replicative transposition event.

label: IRLinv_site
definition: Component of the inversion site located at the left of a region susceptible to site-specific inversion.

label: IRRinv_site
definition: Component of the inversion site located at the right of a region susceptible to site-specific inversion.

label: inversion_site_part
definition: A region located within an inversion site.

label: defective_conjugative_transposon
definition: An island that contains genes for integration/excision and the gene and site for the initiation of intercellular transfer by conjugation. It can be complemented for transfer by a conjugative transposon.

label: repeat_fragment
definition: A portion of a repeat, interrupted by the insertion of another element.

label: transposon_fragment
definition: A portion of a transposon, interrupted by the insertion of another element.

label: transcriptional_cis_regulatory_region
definition: A regulatory_region that modulates the transcription of a gene or genes.

label: splicing_regulatory_region
definition: A regulatory_region that modulates splicing.

label: promoter_targeting_sequence
definition: A transcriptional_cis_regulatory_region that restricts the activity of a CRM to a single promoter and which functions only when both itself and an insulator are located between the CRM and the promoter.

label: sequence_alteration
definition: A sequence_alteration is a sequence_feature whose extent is the deviation from another sequence.

label: sequence_variant
definition: A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration.

label: propeptide_cleavage_site
definition: The propeptide_cleavage_site is the arginine/lysine boundary on a propeptide where cleavage occurs.

label: propeptide
definition: Part of a peptide chain which is cleaved off during the formation of the mature protein.

label: immature_peptide_region
definition: An immature_peptide_region is the extent of the peptide after it has been translated and before any processing occurs.

label: active_peptide
definition: Active peptides are proteins which are biologically active, released from a precursor molecule.

label: compositionally_biased_region_of_peptide
definition: Polypeptide region that is rich in a particular amino acid or homopolymeric and greater than three residues in length.

label: polypeptide_motif
definition: A sequence motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) region of biological interest. Such motifs, although they are too short to constitute functional domains, share sequence similarities and are conserved in different proteins. They display a common function (protein-binding, subcellular location etc.).

label: polypeptide_repeat
definition: A polypeptide_repeat is a single copy of an internal sequence repetition.

label: polypeptide_structural_region
definition: Region of polypeptide with a given structural property.

label: membrane_structure
definition: Arrangement of the polypeptide with respect to the lipid bilayer.

label: extramembrane_polypeptide_region
definition: Polypeptide region that is localized outside of a lipid bilayer.

label: cytoplasmic_polypeptide_region
definition: Polypeptide region that is localized inside the cytoplasm.

label: non_cytoplasmic_polypeptide_region
definition: Polypeptide region that is localized outside of a lipid bilayer and outside of the cytoplasm.

label: intramembrane_polypeptide_region
definition: Polypeptide region present in the lipid bilayer.

label: membrane_peptide_loop
definition: Polypeptide region localized within the lipid bilayer where both ends traverse the same membrane.

label: transmembrane_polypeptide_region
definition: Polypeptide region traversing the lipid bilayer.

label: polypeptide_secondary_structure
definition: A region of peptide with secondary structure has hydrogen bonding along the peptide chain that causes a defined conformation of the chain.

label: polypeptide_structural_motif
definition: Motif is a three-dimensional structural element within the chain, which appears also in a variety of other molecules. Unlike a domain, a motif does not need to form a stable globular unit.

label: coiled_coil
definition: A coiled coil is a structural motif in proteins, in which alpha-helices are coiled together like the strands of a rope.

label: helix_turn_helix
definition: A motif comprising two helices separated by a turn.

label: polypeptide_sequencing_information
definition: Incompatibility in the sequence due to some experimental problem.

label: non_adjacent_residues
definition: Indicates that two consecutive residues in a fragment sequence are not consecutive in the full-length protein and that there are a number of unsequenced residues between them.

label: non_terminal_residue
definition: The residue at an extremity of the sequence is not the terminal residue.

label: sequence_conflict
definition: Different sources report differing sequences.

label: sequence_uncertainty
definition: Describes the positions in a sequence where the authors are unsure about the sequence assignment.

label: cross_link
definition: Posttranslationally formed amino acid bonds.

label: disulfide_bond
definition: The covalent bond between sulfur atoms that binds two peptide chains or different parts of one peptide chain and is a structural determinant in many protein molecules.

label: post_translationally_modified_region
definition: A region where a transformation occurs in a protein after it has been synthesized. This which may regulate, stabilize, crosslink or introduce new chemical functionalities in the protein.

label: covalent_binding_site
definition: Binding involving a covalent bond.

label: non_covalent_binding_site
definition: Binding site for any chemical group (co-enzyme, prosthetic group, etc.).

label: polypeptide_metal_contact
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with metal ions.

label: protein_protein_contact
definition: A binding site that, in the protein molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.

label: polypeptide_calcium_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with calcium ions.

label: polypeptide_cobalt_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with cobalt ions.

label: polypeptide_copper_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with copper ions.

label: polypeptide_iron_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with iron ions.

label: polypeptide_magnesium_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with magnesium ions.

label: polypeptide_manganese_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with manganese ions.

label: polypeptide_molybdenum_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with molybdenum ions.

label: polypeptide_nickel_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with nickel ions.

label: polypeptide_tungsten_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with tungsten ions.

label: polypeptide_zinc_ion_contact_site
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with zinc ions.

label: catalytic_residue
definition: Amino acid involved in the activity of an enzyme.

label: polypeptide_ligand_contact
definition: Residues which interact with a ligand.

label: asx_motif
definition: A motif of five consecutive residues and two H-bonds in which: Residue(i) is Aspartate or Asparagine (Asx), side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2) or (i+3), main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3) or (i+4).

label: beta_bulge
definition: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet in which the main chains of two consecutive residues are H-bonded to that of the third, and in which the dihedral angles are as follows: Residue(i): -140 degrees < phi(l) -20 degrees , -90 degrees < psi(l) < 40 degrees. Residue (i+1): -180 degrees < phi < -25 degrees or +120 degrees < phi < +180 degrees, +40 degrees < psi < +180 degrees or -180 degrees < psi < -120 degrees.

label: beta_bulge_loop
definition: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds. Beta bulge loops often occur at the loop ends of beta-hairpins.

label: beta_bulge_loop_five
definition: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds in which: the main-chain NH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i+4), the main-chain CO of residue i is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3), these loops have an RL nest at residues i+2 and i+3.

label: beta_bulge_loop_six
definition: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds in which: the main-chain NH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i+5), the main-chain CO of residue i is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+4), these loops have an RL nest at residues i+3 and i+4.

label: beta_strand
definition: A beta strand describes a single length of polypeptide chain that forms part of a beta sheet. A single continuous stretch of amino acids adopting an extended conformation of hydrogen bonds between the N-O and the C=O of another part of the peptide. This forms a secondary protein structure in which two or more extended polypeptide regions are hydrogen-bonded to one another in a planar array.

label: antiparallel_beta_strand
definition: A peptide region which hydrogen bonded to another region of peptide running in the oposite direction (one running N-terminal to C-terminal and one running C-terminal to N-terminal). Hydrogen bonding occurs between every other C=O from one strand to every other N-H on the adjacent strand. In this case, if two atoms C-alpha (i) and C-alpha (j) are adjacent in two hydrogen-bonded beta strands, then they form two mutual backbone hydrogen bonds to each other's flanking peptide groups; this is known as a close pair of hydrogen bonds. The peptide backbone dihedral angles (phi, psi) are about (-140 degrees, 135 degrees) in antiparallel sheets.

label: parallel_beta_strand
definition: A peptide region which hydrogen bonded to another region of peptide running in the oposite direction (both running N-terminal to C-terminal). This orientation is slightly less stable because it introduces nonplanarity in the inter-strand hydrogen bonding pattern. Hydrogen bonding occurs between every other C=O from one strand to every other N-H on the adjacent strand. In this case, if two atoms C-alpha (i)and C-alpha (j) are adjacent in two hydrogen-bonded beta strands, then they do not hydrogen bond to each other; rather, one residue forms hydrogen bonds to the residues that flank the other (but not vice versa). For example, residue i may form hydrogen bonds to residues j - 1 and j + 1; this is known as a wide pair of hydrogen bonds. By contrast, residue j may hydrogen-bond to different residues altogether, or to none at all. The dihedral angles (phi, psi) are about (-120 degrees, 115 degrees) in parallel sheets.

label: peptide_helix
definition: A helix is a secondary_structure conformation where the peptide backbone forms a coil.

label: left_handed_peptide_helix
definition: A left handed helix is a region of peptide where the coiled conformation turns in an anticlockwise, left handed screw.

label: right_handed_peptide_helix
definition: A right handed helix is a region of peptide where the coiled conformation turns in a clockwise, right handed screw.

label: alpha_helix
definition: The helix has 3.6 residues per turn which corresponds to a translation of 1.5 angstroms (= 0.15 nm) along the helical axis. Every backbone N-H group donates a hydrogen bond to the backbone C=O group of the amino acid four residues earlier.

label: pi_helix
definition: The pi helix has 4.1 residues per turn and a translation of 1.15 (=0.115 nm) along the helical axis. The N-H group of an amino acid forms a hydrogen bond with the C=O group of the amino acid five residues earlier.

label: three_ten_helix
definition: The 3-10 helix has 3 residues per turn with a translation of 2.0 angstroms (=0.2 nm) along the helical axis. The N-H group of an amino acid forms a hydrogen bond with the C=O group of the amino acid three residues earlier.

label: polypeptide_nest_motif
definition: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles. Nest should not have Proline as any residue. Nests frequently occur as parts of other motifs such as Schellman loops.

label: polypeptide_nest_left_right_motif
definition: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles: Residue(i): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees. Residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees.

label: polypeptide_nest_right_left_motif
definition: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles: Residue(i): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees. Residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees.

label: schellmann_loop
definition: A motif of six or seven consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds.

label: schellmann_loop_seven
definition: Wild type: A motif of seven consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds in which: the main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+6), the main-chain CO of residue(i+1) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+5).

label: schellmann_loop_six
definition: Common Type: A motif of six consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds in which: the main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+5) the main-chain CO of residue(i+1) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+4).

label: serine_threonine_motif
definition: A motif of five consecutive residues and two hydrogen bonds in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2) or (i+3) , the main-chain CO group of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3) or (i+4).

label: serine_threonine_staple_motif
definition: A motif of four or five consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain OH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i3) or (i4), Phi angles of residues(i1), (i2) and (i3) are negative.

label: polypeptide_turn_motif
definition: A reversal in the direction of the backbone of a protein that is stabilized by hydrogen bond between backbone NH and CO groups, involving no more than 4 amino acid residues.

label: asx_turn_left_handed_type_one
definition: Left handed type I (dihedral angles):- Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi (1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees. Residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees.

label: asx_turn_left_handed_type_two
definition: Left handed type II (dihedral angles):- Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi (1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees < psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees. Residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees.

label: asx_turn_right_handed_type_two
definition: Right handed type II (dihedral angles):- Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi (1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees < psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees. Residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees.

label: asx_turn_right_handed_type_one
definition: Right handed type I (dihedral angles):- Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi (1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees. Residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees.

label: beta_turn
definition: A motif of four consecutive residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth. It is characterized by the dihedral angles of the second and third residues, which are the basis for sub-categorization.

label: beta_turn_left_handed_type_one
definition: Left handed type I:A motif of four consecutive residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth. It is characterized by the dihedral angles:- Residue(i+1): -140 degrees > phi > -20 degrees, -90 degrees > psi > +40 degrees. Residue(i+2): -140 degrees > phi > -20 degrees, -90 degrees > psi > +40 degrees.

label: beta_turn_left_handed_type_two
definition: Left handed type II: A motif of four consecutive residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth. It is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): -140 degrees > phi > -20 degrees, +80 degrees > psi > +180 degrees. Residue(i+2): +20 degrees > phi > +140 degrees, -40 degrees > psi > +90 degrees.

label: beta_turn_right_handed_type_one
definition: Right handed type I:A motif of four consecutive residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth. It is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees. Residue(i+2): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees.

label: beta_turn_right_handed_type_two
definition: Right handed type II:A motif of four consecutive residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth. It is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, +80 degrees < psi < +180 degrees. Residue(i+2): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees.

label: gamma_turn
definition: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i,( i+1),( i+2) if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees.

label: gamma_turn_classic
definition: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i, i+1, i+2 if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees: phi(i+1)=75.0 - psi(i+1)=-64.0.

label: gamma_turn_inverse
definition: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i, i+1, i+2 if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees: phi(i+1)=-79.0 - psi(i+1)=69.0.

label: serine_threonine_turn
definition: A motif of three consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2).

label: st_turn_left_handed_type_one
definition: The peptide twists in an anticlockwise, left handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees, residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 < psi < +40 degrees.

label: st_turn_left_handed_type_two
definition: The peptide twists in an anticlockwise, left handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees, residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 < psi < +90 degrees.

label: st_turn_right_handed_type_one
definition: The peptide twists in an clockwise, right handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees, residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 < psi < +40 degrees.

label: st_turn_right_handed_type_two
definition: The peptide twists in an clockwise, right handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees, residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 < psi < +90 degrees.

label: polypeptide_variation_site
definition: A site of sequence variation (alteration). Alternative sequence due to naturally occurring events such as polymorphisms and alternative splicing or experimental methods such as site directed mutagenesis.

label: natural_variant_site
definition: Describes the natural sequence variants due to polymorphisms, disease-associated mutations, RNA editing and variations between strains, isolates or cultivars.

label: mutated_variant_site
definition: Site which has been experimentally altered.

label: alternate_sequence_site
definition: Description of sequence variants produced by alternative splicing, alternative promoter usage, alternative initiation and ribosomal frameshifting.

label: beta_turn_type_six
definition: A motif of four consecutive peptide resides of type VIa or type VIb and where the i+2 residue is cis-proline.

label: beta_turn_type_six_a
definition: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues, of which the i+2 residue is proline, and that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -90 degrees, psi ~ 0 degrees.

label: beta_turn_type_six_a_one
definition: A type VIa beta turn with the following phi and psi sngles on amino acid residues 2 and 3: phi-2 = -60 degrees, psi-2 = 120 degrees, phi-3 = -90 degrees, psi-3 = 0 degrees.

label: beta_turn_type_six_a_two
definition: A type VIa beta turn with the following phi and psi sngles on amino acid residues 2 and 3: phi-2 = -120 degrees, psi-2 = 120 degrees, phi-3 = -60 degrees, psi-3 = 0 degrees.

label: beta_turn_type_six_b
definition: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues, of which the i+2 residue is proline, and that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -120 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ 0 degrees.

label: beta_turn_type_eight
definition: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ -30 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -120 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees.

label: DRE_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -10 and -60 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is WATCGATW.

label: DMv4_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, located immediately upstream of some TATA box elements with respect to the TSS (+1). Consensus sequence is YGGTCACACTR. Marked spatial preference within core promoter; tend to occur near the TSS, although not as tightly as INR (SO:0000014).

label: E_box_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -60 and +1 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is AWCAGCTGWT. Tends to co-occur with DMv2 (SO:0001161). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015).

label: DMv5_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -50 and -10 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is KTYRGTATWTTT. Tends to co-occur with DMv4 (SO:0001157) . Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (SO:0001162).

label: DMv3_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -30 and +15 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is KNNCAKCNCTRNY. Tends to co-occur with DMv2 (SO:0001161). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (0001162).

label: DMv2_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -60 and -45 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is MKSYGGCARCGSYSS. Tends to co-occur with DMv3 (SO:0001160). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (SO:0001162).

label: MTE
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between +20 and +30 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is CSARCSSAACGS. Tends to co-occur with INR motif (SO:0000014). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or DMv5 (SO:0001159).

label: INR1_motif
definition: A promoter motif with consensus sequence TCATTCG.

label: DPE1_motif
definition: A promoter motif with consensus sequence CGGACGT.

label: DMv1_motif
definition: A promoter motif with consensus sequence CARCCCT.

label: GAGA_motif
definition: A non directional promoter motif with consensus sequence GAGAGCG.

label: NDM2_motif
definition: A non directional promoter motif with consensus CGMYGYCR.

label: NDM3_motif
definition: A non directional promoter motif with consensus sequence GAAAGCT.

label: ds_RNA_viral_sequence
definition: A ds_RNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as double stranded RNA.

label: polinton
definition: A kind of DNA transposon that populates the genomes of protists, fungi, and animals, characterized by a unique set of proteins necessary for their transposition, including a protein-primed DNA polymerase B, retroviral integrase, cysteine protease, and ATPase. Polintons are characterized by 6-bp target site duplications, terminal-inverted repeats that are several hundred nucleotides long, and 5'-AG and TC-3' termini. Polintons exist as autonomous and nonautonomous elements.

label: rRNA_21S
definition: A component of the large ribosomal subunit in mitochondrial rRNA.

label: tRNA_region
definition: A region of a tRNA.

label: anticodon_loop
definition: A sequence of seven nucleotide bases in tRNA which contains the anticodon. It has the sequence 5'-pyrimidine-purine-anticodon-modified purine-any base-3.

label: anticodon
definition: A sequence of three nucleotide bases in tRNA which recognizes a codon in mRNA.

label: CCA_tail
definition: Base sequence at the 3' end of a tRNA. The 3'-hydroxyl group on the terminal adenosine is the attachment point for the amino acid.

label: DHU_loop
definition: Non-base-paired sequence of nucleotide bases in tRNA. It contains several dihydrouracil residues.

label: T_loop
definition: Non-base-paired sequence of three nucleotide bases in tRNA. It has sequence T-Psi-C.

label: pyrrolysine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding pyrrolysyl tRNA (SO:0000766).

label: U3_snoRNA
definition: U3 snoRNA is a member of the box C/D class of small nucleolar RNAs. The U3 snoRNA secondary structure is characterised by a small 5' domain (with boxes A and A'), and a larger 3' domain (with boxes B, C, C', and D), the two domains being linked by a single-stranded hinge. Boxes B and C form the B/C motif, which appears to be exclusive to U3 snoRNAs, and boxes C' and D form the C'/D motif. The latter is functionally similar to the C/D motifs found in other snoRNAs. The 5' domain and the hinge region act as a pre-rRNA-binding domain. The 3' domain has conserved protein-binding sites. Both the box B/C and box C'/D motifs are sufficient for nuclear retention of U3 snoRNA. The box C'/D motif is also necessary for nucleolar localization, stability and hypermethylation of U3 snoRNA. Both box B/C and C'/D motifs are involved in specific protein interactions and are necessary for the rRNA processing functions of U3 snoRNA.

label: AU_rich_element
definition: A cis-acting element found in the 3' UTR of some mRNA which is rich in AUUUA pentamers. Messenger RNAs bearing multiple AU-rich elements are often unstable.

label: Bruno_response_element
definition: A cis-acting element found in the 3' UTR of some mRNA which is bound by the Drosophila Bruno protein and its homologs.

label: iron_responsive_element
definition: A regulatory sequence found in the 5' and 3' UTRs of many mRNAs which encode iron-binding proteins. It has a hairpin structure and is recognized by trans-acting proteins known as iron-regulatory proteins.

label: morpholino_backbone
definition: An attribute describing a sequence composed of nucleobases bound to a morpholino backbone. A morpholino backbone consists of morpholine (CHEBI:34856) rings connected by phosphorodiamidate linkages.

label: PNA
definition: An attribute describing a sequence composed of peptide nucleic acid (CHEBI:48021), a chemical consisting of nucleobases bound to a backbone composed of repeating N-(2-aminoethyl)-glycine units linked by peptide bonds. The purine and pyrimidine bases are linked to the backbone by methylene carbonyl bonds.

label: enzymatic
definition: An attribute describing the sequence of a transcript that has catalytic activity with or without an associated ribonucleoprotein.

label: ribozymic
definition: An attribute describing the sequence of a transcript that has catalytic activity even without an associated ribonucleoprotein.

label: pseudouridylation_guide_snoRNA
definition: A snoRNA that specifies the site of pseudouridylation in an RNA molecule by base pairing with a short sequence around the target residue.

label: LNA
definition: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of 'locked' deoxyribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone. The deoxyribose unit's conformation is 'locked' by a 2'-C,4'-C-oxymethylene link.

label: LNA_oligo
definition: An oligo composed of LNA residues.

label: TNA
definition: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of threose rings connected to a phosphate backbone.

label: TNA_oligo
definition: An oligo composed of TNA residues.

label: GNA
definition: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of an acyclic three-carbon propylene glycol connected to a phosphate backbone. It has two enantiomeric forms, (R)-GNA and (S)-GNA.

label: GNA_oligo
definition: An oligo composed of GNA residues.

label: R_GNA
definition: An attribute describing a GNA sequence in the (R)-GNA enantiomer.

label: R_GNA_oligo
definition: An oligo composed of (R)-GNA residues.

label: S_GNA
definition: An attribute describing a GNA sequence in the (S)-GNA enantiomer.

label: S_GNA_oligo
definition: An oligo composed of (S)-GNA residues.

label: ds_DNA_viral_sequence
definition: A ds_DNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as double stranded DNA.

label: ss_RNA_viral_sequence
definition: A ss_RNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as single stranded RNA.

label: negative_sense_ssRNA_viral_sequence
definition: A negative_sense_RNA_viral_sequence is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus that is complementary to mRNA and must be converted to positive sense RNA by RNA polymerase before translation.

label: positive_sense_ssRNA_viral_sequence
definition: A positive_sense_RNA_viral_sequence is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus that can be immediately translated by the host.

label: ambisense_ssRNA_viral_sequence
definition: A ambisense_RNA_virus is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus with both messenger and anti messenger polarity.

label: RNA_polymerase_promoter
definition: A region (DNA) to which RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

label: Phage_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
definition: A region (DNA) to which Bacteriophage RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

label: SP6_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
definition: A region (DNA) to which the SP6 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

label: T3_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
definition: A DNA sequence to which the T3 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

label: T7_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
definition: A region (DNA) to which the T7 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

label: five_prime_EST
definition: An EST read from the 5' end of a transcript that usually codes for a protein. These regions tend to be conserved across species and do not change much within a gene family.

label: three_prime_EST
definition: An EST read from the 3' end of a transcript. They are more likely to fall within non-coding, or untranslated regions(UTRs).

label: translational_frameshift
definition: The region of mRNA (not divisible by 3 bases) that is skipped or added during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

label: plus_1_translational_frameshift
definition: The region of mRNA 1 base long that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

label: plus_2_translational_frameshift
definition: The region of mRNA 2 bases long that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

label: group_III_intron
definition: Group III introns are introns found in the mRNA of the plastids of euglenoid protists. They are spliced by a two step transesterification with bulged adenosine as initiating nucleophile.

label: noncoding_region_of_exon
definition: The maximal intersection of exon and UTR.

label: coding_region_of_exon
definition: The region of an exon that encodes for protein sequence.

label: endonuclease_spliced_intron
definition: An intron that spliced via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation rather than transesterification.

label: protein_coding_gene
definition: A gene that codes for an RNA that can be translated into a protein.

label: transgenic_insertion
definition: An insertion that derives from another organism, via the use of recombinant DNA technology.

label: retrogene
definition: A gene that has been produced as the product of a reverse transcriptase mediated event.

label: silenced_by_RNA_interference
definition: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by RNA interference.

label: silenced_by_histone_modification
definition: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone modification.

label: silenced_by_histone_methylation
definition: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone methylation.

label: silenced_by_histone_deacetylation
definition: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone deacetylation.

label: gene_silenced_by_RNA_interference
definition: A gene that is silenced by RNA interference.

label: gene_silenced_by_histone_modification
definition: A gene that is silenced by histone modification.

label: gene_silenced_by_histone_methylation
definition: A gene that is silenced by histone methylation.

label: gene_silenced_by_histone_deacetylation
definition: A gene that is silenced by histone deacetylation.

label: dihydrouridine
definition: A modified RNA base in which the 5,6-dihydrouracil is bound to the ribose ring.

label: pseudouridine
definition: A modified RNA base in which the 5- position of the uracil is bound to the ribose ring instead of the 4- position.

label: inosine
definition: A modified RNA base in which hypoxanthine is bound to the ribose ring.

label: seven_methylguanine
definition: A modified RNA base in which guanine is methylated at the 7- position.

label: ribothymidine
definition: A modified RNA base in which thymine is bound to the ribose ring.

label: methylinosine
definition: A modified RNA base in which methylhypoxanthine is bound to the ribose ring.

label: mobile
definition: An attribute describing a feature that has either intra-genome or intracellular mobility.

label: replicon
definition: A region containing at least one unique origin of replication and a unique termination site.

label: base
