definition: A base is a sequence feature that corresponds to a single unit of a nucleotide polymer.

label: amino_acid
definition: A sequence feature that corresponds to a single amino acid residue in a polypeptide.

label: major_TSS
definition: The tanscription start site that is most frequently used for transcription of a gene.

label: minor_TSS
definition: A tanscription start site that is not the most frequently used for transcription of a gene.

label: TSS_region
definition: The region of a gene from the 5' most TSS to the 3' TSS.

label: encodes_alternate_transcription_start_sites
definition: A gene that has multiple possible transcription start sites.

label: miRNA_primary_transcript_region
definition: A part of an miRNA primary_transcript.

label: pre_miRNA
definition: The 60-70 nucleotide region remain after Drosha processing of the primary transcript, that folds back upon itself to form a hairpin structure.

label: miRNA_stem
definition: The stem of the hairpin loop formed by folding of the pre-miRNA.

label: miRNA_loop
definition: The loop of the hairpin loop formed by folding of the pre-miRNA.

label: synthetic_oligo
definition: An oligo composed of synthetic nucleotides.

label: assembly
definition: A region of the genome of known length that is composed by ordering and aligning two or more different regions.

label: fragment_assembly
definition: A fragment assembly is a genome assembly that orders overlapping fragments of the genome based on landmark sequences. The base pair distance between the landmarks is known allowing additivity of lengths.

label: fingerprint_map
definition: A fingerprint_map is a physical map composed of restriction fragments.

label: STS_map
definition: An STS map is a physical map organized by the unique STS landmarks.

label: RH_map
definition: A radiation hybrid map is a physical map.

label: sonicate_fragment
definition: A DNA fragment generated by sonication. Sonication is a technique used to sheer DNA into smaller fragments.

label: polyploid
definition: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is an exact multiple of the haploid number and is greater than the diploid number.

label: autopolyploid
definition: A polyploid where the multiple chromosome set was derived from the same organism.

label: allopolyploid
definition: A polyploid where the multiple chromosome set was derived from a different organism.

label: homing_endonuclease_binding_site
definition: The binding site (recognition site) of a homing endonuclease. The binding site is typically large.

label: octamer_motif
definition: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters with sequence ATTGCAT that binds Pou-domain transcription factors.

label: apicoplast_chromosome
definition: A chromosome originating in an apicoplast.

label: sequence_collection
definition: A collection of discontinuous sequences.

label: overlapping_feature_set
definition: A continuous region of sequence composed of the overlapping of multiple sequence_features, which ultimately provides evidence for another sequence_feature.

label: overlapping_EST_set
definition: A continous experimental result region extending the length of multiple overlapping EST's.

label: ncRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a non-coding RNA.

label: gRNA_gene
definition: A noncoding RNA that guides the insertion or deletion of uridine residues in mitochondrial mRNAs. This may also refer to synthetic RNAs used to guide DNA editing using the CRIPSR/Cas9 system.

label: miRNA_gene
definition: A small noncoding RNA of approximately 22 nucleotides in length which may be involved in regulation of gene expression.

label: scRNA_gene
definition: A small noncoding RNA that is generally found only in the cytoplasm.

label: snoRNA_gene
definition: A gene encoding a small noncoding RNA that participates in the processing or chemical modifications of many RNAs, including ribosomal RNAs and spliceosomal RNAs.

label: snRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a small nuclear RNA.

label: SRP_RNA_gene
definition: A noncoding RNA that binds to the ribosome to halt protein synthesis when the signal peptide is present.

label: tmRNA_gene
definition: A bacterial RNA with both tRNA and mRNA like properties.

label: tRNA_gene
definition: A noncoding RNA that binds to a specific amino acid to allow that amino acid to be used by the ribosome during translation of RNA.

label: modified_adenosine
definition: A modified adenine is an adenine base feature that has been altered.

label: modified_inosine
definition: A modified inosine is an inosine base feature that has been altered.

label: modified_cytidine
definition: A modified cytidine is a cytidine base feature which has been altered.

label: modified_guanosine
definition: A guanosine base that has been modified.

label: modified_uridine
definition: A uridine base that has been modified.

label: one_methylinosine
definition: 1-methylinosine is a modified inosine.

label: one_two_prime_O_dimethylinosine
definition: 1,2'-O-dimethylinosine is a modified inosine.

label: two_prime_O_methylinosine
definition: 2'-O-methylinosine is a modified inosine.

label: three_methylcytidine
definition: 3-methylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: five_methylcytidine
definition: 5-methylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: two_prime_O_methylcytidine
definition: 2'-O-methylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: two_thiocytidine
definition: 2-thiocytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: N4_acetylcytidine
definition: N4-acetylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: five_formylcytidine
definition: 5-formylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: five_two_prime_O_dimethylcytidine
definition: 5,2'-O-dimethylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: N4_acetyl_2_prime_O_methylcytidine
definition: N4-acetyl-2'-O-methylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

label: lysidine
definition: Lysidine is a modified cytidine.

label: N4_methylcytidine

label: cryptic_gene

label: three_prime_RACE_clone
definition: A three prime RACE (Rapid Amplification of cDNA Ends) clone is a cDNA clone copied from the 3' end of an mRNA (using a poly-dT primer to capture the polyA tail and a gene-specific or randomly primed 5' primer), and spliced into a vector for propagation in a suitable host.

label: cassette_pseudogene
definition: A cassette pseudogene is a kind of gene in an inactive form which may recombine at a telomeric locus to form a functional copy.

label: alanine
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codons GCN (GCT, GCC, GCA and GCG).

label: valine
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codons GTN (GTT, GTC, GTA and GTG).

label: leucine
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codons CTN (CTT, CTC, CTA and CTG), TTA and TTG.

label: isoleucine
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codons ATH (ATT, ATC and ATA).

label: proline
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codons CCN (CCT, CCC, CCA and CCG).

label: tryptophan
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codon TGG.

label: phenylalanine
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codons TTT and TTC.

label: methionine
definition: A non-polar, hydorophobic amino acid encoded by the codon ATG.

label: glycine
definition: A non-polar, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons GGN (GGT, GGC, GGA and GGG).

label: serine
definition: A polar, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons TCN (TCT, TCC, TCA, TCG), AGT and AGC.

label: threonine
definition: A polar, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons ACN (ACT, ACC, ACA and ACG).

label: tyrosine
definition: A polar, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons TAT and TAC.

label: cysteine
definition: A polar amino acid encoded by the codons TGT and TGC.

label: glutamine
definition: A polar, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons CAA and CAG.

label: asparagine
definition: A polar, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons AAT and AAC.

label: lysine
definition: A positively charged, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons AAA and AAG.

label: arginine
definition: A positively charged, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons CGN (CGT, CGC, CGA and CGG), AGA and AGG.

label: histidine
definition: A positively charged, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons CAT and CAC.

label: aspartic_acid
definition: A negatively charged, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons GAT and GAC.

label: glutamic_acid
definition: A negatively charged, hydorophilic amino acid encoded by the codons GAA and GAG.

label: selenocysteine
definition: A relatively rare amino acid encoded by the codon UGA in some contexts, whereas UGA is a termination codon in other contexts.

label: pyrrolysine
definition: A relatively rare amino acid encoded by the codon UAG in some contexts, whereas UAG is a termination codon in other contexts.

label: transcribed_cluster
definition: A region defined by a set of transcribed sequences from the same gene or expressed pseudogene.

label: unigene_cluster
definition: A kind of transcribed_cluster defined by a set of transcribed sequences from the a unique gene.

label: CRISPR
definition: Clustered Palindromic Repeats interspersed with bacteriophage derived spacer sequences.

label: insulator_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in an insulator region of a nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.

label: enhancer_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in the enhancer region of a nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.

label: contig_collection
definition: A collection of contigs.

label: lincRNA
definition: Long, intervening non-coding RNA. A transcript that does not overlap within the start or end genomic coordinates of a coding gene or pseudogene on either strand.

label: UST
definition: An EST spanning part or all of the untranslated regions of a protein-coding transcript.

label: three_prime_UST
definition: A UST located in the 3'UTR of a protein-coding transcript.

label: five_prime_UST
definition: An UST located in the 5'UTR of a protein-coding transcript.

label: RST
definition: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

label: three_prime_RST
definition: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a 3'-RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

label: five_prime_RST
definition: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a 5'-RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

label: UST_match
definition: A match against an UST sequence.

label: RST_match
definition: A match against an RST sequence.

label: primer_match
definition: A nucleotide match to a primer sequence.

label: miRNA_antiguide
definition: A region of the pri miRNA that base pairs with the guide to form the hairpin.

label: trans_splice_junction
definition: The boundary between the spliced leader and the first exon of the mRNA.

label: outron
definition: A region of a primary transcript, that is removed via trans splicing.

label: natural_plasmid
definition: A plasmid that occurs naturally.

label: gene_trap_construct
definition: A gene trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and produce a fusion transcript between exons of the gene into which it inserts and a reporter element in the construct. Gene traps contain a splice acceptor, do not contain promoter elements for the reporter, and are mutagenic. Gene traps may be bicistronic with the second cassette containing a promoter driving an a selectable marker.

label: promoter_trap_construct
definition: A promoter trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and express a reporter when inserted in close proximity to a promoter element. Promoter traps typically do not contain promoter elements and are mutagenic.

label: enhancer_trap_construct
definition: An enhancer trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and express a reporter when the expression from a basic minimal promoter is enhanced by genomic enhancer elements. Enhancer traps contain promoter elements and are not usually mutagenic.

label: PAC_end
definition: A region of sequence from the end of a PAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

label: RAPD
definition: RAPD is a 'PCR product' where a sequence variant is identified through the use of PCR with random primers.

label: shadow_enhancer
definition: An enhancer that drives the pattern of transcription and binds to the same TF as the primary enhancer, but is located in the intron of or on the far side of a neighboring gene.

label: SNV
definition: SNVs are single nucleotide positions in genomic DNA at which different sequence alternatives exist.

label: X_element_combinatorial_repeat
definition: An X element combinatorial repeat is a repeat region located between the X element and the telomere or adjacent Y' element.

label: Y_prime_element
definition: A Y' element is a repeat region (SO:0000657) located adjacent to telomeric repeats or X element combinatorial repeats, either as a single copy or tandem repeat of two to four copies.

label: standard_draft
definition: The status of a whole genome sequence, where the data is minimally filtered or un-filtered, from any number of sequencing platforms, and is assembled into contigs. Genome sequence of this quality may harbour regions of poor quality and can be relatively incomplete.

label: high_quality_draft
definition: The status of a whole genome sequence, where overall coverage represents at least 90 percent of the genome.

label: improved_high_quality_draft
definition: The status of a whole genome sequence, where additional work has been performed, using either manual or automated methods, such as gap resolution.

label: annotation_directed_improved_draft
definition: The status of a whole genome sequence,where annotation, and verification of coding regions has occurred.

label: noncontiguous_finished
definition: The status of a whole genome sequence, where the assembly is high quality, closure approaches have been successful for most gaps, misassemblies and low quality regions.

label: finished_genome
definition: The status of a whole genome sequence, with less than 1 error per 100,000 base pairs.

label: intronic_regulatory_region
definition: A regulatory region that is part of an intron.

label: centromere_DNA_Element_I
definition: A centromere DNA Element I (CDEI) is a conserved region, part of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region composed of 8-11bp which enables binding by the centromere binding factor 1(Cbf1p).

label: centromere_DNA_Element_II
definition: A centromere DNA Element II (CDEII) is part a conserved region of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region that is AT-rich and ~ 75-100 bp in length.

label: centromere_DNA_Element_III
definition: A centromere DNA Element I (CDEI) is a conserved region, part of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region that consists of a 25-bp which enables binding by the centromere DNA binding factor 3 (CBF3) complex.

label: telomeric_repeat
definition: The telomeric repeat is a repeat region, part of the chromosome, which in yeast, is a G-rich terminal sequence of the form (TG(1-3))n or more precisely ((TG)(1-6)TG(2-3))n.

label: X_element
definition: The X element is a conserved region, of the telomere, of ~475 bp that contains an ARS sequence and in most cases an Abf1p binding site.

label: YAC_end
definition: A region of sequence from the end of a YAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

label: whole_genome_sequence_status
definition: The status of whole genome sequence.

label: heritable_phenotypic_marker
definition: A biological_region characterized as a single heritable trait in a phenotype screen. The heritable phenotype may be mapped to a chromosome but generally has not been characterized to a specific gene locus.

label: peptide_collection
definition: A collection of peptide sequences.

label: high_identity_region
definition: An experimental feature with high sequence identity to another sequence.

label: processed_transcript
definition: A transcript for which no open reading frame has been identified and for which no other function has been determined.

label: assortment_derived_variation
definition: A chromosome variation derived from an event during meiosis.

label: reference_genome
definition: A collection of sequences (often chromosomes) taken as the standard for a given organism and genome assembly.

label: variant_genome
definition: A collection of sequences (often chromosomes) of an individual.

label: variant_collection
definition: A collection of one or more sequences of an individual.

label: alteration_attribute
definition: An attribute of alteration of one or more chromosomes.

label: chromosomal_variation_attribute
definition: An attribute of a change in the structure or number of a chromosomes.

label: intrachromosomal
definition: A change in chromosomes that occurs between two separate chromosomes.

label: interchromosomal
definition: A change in chromosomes that occurs between two sections of the same chromosome or between homologous chromosomes.

label: insertion_attribute
definition: A quality of a chromosomal insertion,.

label: tandem
definition: An insertion of extension of a tandem repeat.

label: direct
definition: A quality of an insertion where the insert is not in a cytologically inverted orientation.

label: inverted
definition: A quality of an insertion where the insert is in a cytologically inverted orientation.

label: free
definition: The quality of a duplication where the new region exists independently of the original.

label: inversion_attribute
definition: When a region of a chromosome is changed to the reverse order without duplication or deletion.

label: pericentric
definition: An inversion event that includes the centromere.

label: paracentric
definition: An inversion event that does not include the centromere.

label: translocaton_attribute
definition: An attribute of a translocation, which is then a region of nucleotide sequence that has translocated to a new position. The observed adjacency of two previously separated regions.

label: reciprocal
definition: When translocation occurs between nonhomologous chromosomes and involved an equal exchange of genetic materials.

label: insertional
definition: When a translocation is simply moving genetic material from one chromosome to another.

label: duplication_attribute
definition: An attribute of a duplication, which is an insertion which derives from, or is identical in sequence to, nucleotides present at a known location in the genome.

label: chromosomally_aberrant_genome
definition: When a genome contains an abnormal amount of chromosomes.

label: assembly_error_correction
definition: A region of sequence where the final nucleotide assignment differs from the original assembly due to an improvement that replaces a mistake.

label: base_call_error_correction
definition: A region of sequence where the final nucleotide assignment is different from that given by the base caller due to an improvement that replaces a mistake.

label: peptide_localization_signal
definition: A region of peptide sequence used to target the polypeptide molecule to a specific organelle.

label: nuclear_localization_signal
definition: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the nucleus.

label: endosomal_localization_signal
definition: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the endosome.

label: lysosomal_localization_signal
definition: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the lysosome.

label: nuclear_export_signal
definition: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to he cytoplasm.

label: recombination_signal_sequence
definition: A region recognized by a recombinase.

label: cryptic_splice_site
definition: A splice site that is in part of the transcript not normally spliced. They occur via mutation or transcriptional error.

label: nuclear_rim_localization_signal
definition: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the nuclear rim.

label: P_TIR_transposon
definition: A P-element is a DNA transposon responsible for hybrid dysgenesis. P elements in this terminal inverted repeat (TIR) transposon superfamily have 31 bp perfect TIR and upon insertion duplicate an 8 bp sequence. It contains transposase that may lack the DDE domain.

label: functional_effect_variant
definition: A variant whereby the effect is evaluated with respect to a reference.

label: structural_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes one or more sequence features.

label: transcript_function_variant
definition: A sequence variant which alters the functioning of a transcript with respect to a reference sequence.

label: translational_product_function_variant
definition: A sequence variant that affects the functioning of a translational product with respect to a reference sequence.

label: level_of_transcript_variant
definition: A sequence variant which alters the level of a transcript.

label: decreased_transcript_level_variant
definition: A sequence variant that decreases the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA with respect to a reference sequence.

label: increased_transcript_level_variant
definition: A sequence variant that increases the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA with respect to a reference sequence.

label: transcript_processing_variant
definition: A sequence variant that affects the post transcriptional processing of a transcript with respect to a reference sequence.

label: editing_variant
definition: A transcript processing variant whereby the process of editing is disrupted with respect to the reference.

label: polyadenylation_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes polyadenylation with respect to a reference sequence.

label: transcript_stability_variant
definition: A variant that changes the stability of a transcript with respect to a reference sequence.

label: decreased_transcript_stability_variant
definition: A sequence variant that decreases transcript stability with respect to a reference sequence.

label: increased_transcript_stability_variant
definition: A sequence variant that increases transcript stability with respect to a reference sequence.

label: transcription_variant
definition: A variant that changes alters the transcription of a transcript with respect to a reference sequence.

label: rate_of_transcription_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the rate of transcription with respect to a reference sequence.

label: increased_transcription_rate_variant
definition: A sequence variant that increases the rate of transcription with respect to a reference sequence.

label: decreased_transcription_rate_variant
definition: A sequence variant that decreases the rate of transcription with respect to a reference sequence.

label: translational_product_level_variant
definition: A functional variant that changes the translational product level with respect to a reference sequence.

label: polypeptide_function_variant
definition: A sequence variant which changes polypeptide functioning with respect to a reference sequence.

label: decreased_translational_product_level
definition: A sequence variant which decreases the translational product level with respect to a reference sequence.

label: increased_translational_product_level
definition: A sequence variant which increases the translational product level with respect to a reference sequence.

label: polypeptide_gain_of_function_variant
definition: A sequence variant which causes gain of polypeptide function with respect to a reference sequence.

label: polypeptide_localization_variant
definition: A sequence variant which changes the localization of a polypeptide with respect to a reference sequence.

label: polypeptide_loss_of_function_variant
definition: A sequence variant that causes the loss of a polypeptide function with respect to a reference sequence.

label: inactive_ligand_binding_site
definition: A sequence variant that causes the inactivation of a ligand binding site with respect to a reference sequence.

label: polypeptide_partial_loss_of_function
definition: A sequence variant that causes some but not all loss of polypeptide function with respect to a reference sequence.

label: polypeptide_post_translational_processing_variant
definition: A sequence variant that causes a change in post translational processing of the peptide with respect to a reference sequence.

label: copy_number_change
definition: A sequence variant where copies of a feature (CNV) are either increased or decreased.

label: gene_variant
definition: A sequence variant where the structure of the gene is changed.

label: gene_fusion
definition: A sequence variant whereby a two genes have become joined.

label: regulatory_region_variant
definition: A sequence variant located within a regulatory region.

label: stop_retained_variant
definition: A sequence variant where at least one base in the terminator codon is changed, but the terminator remains.

label: splicing_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the process of splicing.

label: cryptic_splice_site_variant
definition: A sequence variant causing a new (functional) splice site.

label: cryptic_splice_acceptor
definition: A sequence variant whereby a new splice site is created due to the activation of a new acceptor.

label: cryptic_splice_donor
definition: A sequence variant whereby a new splice site is created due to the activation of a new donor.

label: exon_loss_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby an exon is lost from the transcript.

label: intron_gain_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby an intron is gained by the processed transcript; usually a result of an alteration of the donor or acceptor.

label: splice_acceptor_variant
definition: A splice variant that changes the 2 base region at the 3' end of an intron.

label: splice_donor_variant
definition: A splice variant that changes the 2 base pair region at the 5' end of an intron.

label: transcript_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the structure of the transcript.

label: complex_transcript_variant
definition: A transcript variant with a complex INDEL- Insertion or deletion that spans an exon/intron border or a coding sequence/UTR border.

label: stop_lost
definition: A sequence variant where at least one base of the terminator codon (stop) is changed, resulting in an elongated transcript.

label: coding_sequence_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the coding sequence.

label: initiator_codon_variant
definition: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the first codon of a transcript.

label: missense_variant
definition: A sequence variant, that changes one or more bases, resulting in a different amino acid sequence but where the length is preserved.

label: conservative_missense_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon is changed resulting in a codon that encodes for a different but similar amino acid. These variants may or may not be deleterious.

label: non_conservative_missense_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon is changed resulting in a codon that encodes for an amino acid with different biochemical properties.

label: stop_gained
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon is changed, resulting in a premature stop codon, leading to a shortened polypeptide.

label: frameshift_variant
definition: A sequence variant which causes a disruption of the translational reading frame, because the number of nucleotides inserted or deleted is not a multiple of three.

label: terminator_codon_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one of the bases in the terminator codon is changed.

label: frame_restoring_variant
definition: A sequence variant that reverts the sequence of a previous frameshift mutation back to the initial frame.

label: minus_1_frameshift_variant
definition: A sequence variant which causes a disruption of the translational reading frame, by shifting one base ahead.

label: minus_2_frameshift_variant
definition: A sequence variant which causes a disruption of the translational reading frame, by shifting two bases forward.

label: plus_1_frameshift_variant
definition: A sequence variant which causes a disruption of the translational reading frame, by shifting one base backward.

label: plus_2_frameshift_variant
definition: A sequence variant which causes a disruption of the translational reading frame, by shifting two bases backward.

label: transcript_secondary_structure_variant
definition: A sequence variant within a transcript that changes the secondary structure of the RNA product.

label: compensatory_transcript_secondary_structure_variant
definition: A secondary structure variant that compensate for the change made by a previous variant.

label: translational_product_structure_variant
definition: A sequence variant within the transcript that changes the structure of the translational product.

label: 3D_polypeptide_structure_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the resulting polypeptide structure.

label: complex_3D_structural_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the resulting polypeptide structure.

label: conformational_change_variant
definition: A sequence variant in the CDS region that causes a conformational change in the resulting polypeptide sequence.

label: complex_change_of_translational_product_variant
definition: A variant that changes the translational product with respect to the reference.

label: polypeptide_sequence_variant
definition: A sequence variant with in the CDS that causes a change in the resulting polypeptide sequence.

label: amino_acid_deletion
definition: A sequence variant within a CDS resulting in the loss of an amino acid from the resulting polypeptide.

label: amino_acid_insertion
definition: A sequence variant within a CDS resulting in the gain of an amino acid to the resulting polypeptide.

label: amino_acid_substitution
definition: A sequence variant of a codon resulting in the substitution of one amino acid for another in the resulting polypeptide.

label: conservative_amino_acid_substitution
definition: A sequence variant of a codon causing the substitution of a similar amino acid for another in the resulting polypeptide.

label: non_conservative_amino_acid_substitution
definition: A sequence variant of a codon causing the substitution of a non conservative amino acid for another in the resulting polypeptide.

label: elongated_polypeptide
definition: An elongation of a polypeptide sequence deriving from a sequence variant extending the CDS.

label: elongated_polypeptide_C_terminal
definition: An elongation of a polypeptide sequence at the C terminus deriving from a sequence variant extending the CDS.

label: elongated_polypeptide_N_terminal
definition: An elongation of a polypeptide sequence at the N terminus deriving from a sequence variant extending the CDS.

label: elongated_in_frame_polypeptide_C_terminal
definition: A sequence variant with in the CDS that causes in frame elongation of the resulting polypeptide sequence at the C terminus.

label: elongated_out_of_frame_polypeptide_C_terminal
definition: A sequence variant with in the CDS that causes out of frame elongation of the resulting polypeptide sequence at the C terminus.

label: elongated_in_frame_polypeptide_N_terminal_elongation
definition: A sequence variant with in the CDS that causes in frame elongation of the resulting polypeptide sequence at the N terminus.

label: elongated_out_of_frame_polypeptide_N_terminal
definition: A sequence variant with in the CDS that causes out of frame elongation of the resulting polypeptide sequence at the N terminus.

label: polypeptide_fusion
definition: A sequence variant that causes a fusion of two polypeptide sequences.

label: polypeptide_truncation
definition: A sequence variant of the CD that causes a truncation of the resulting polypeptide.

label: inactive_catalytic_site
definition: A sequence variant that causes the inactivation of a catalytic site with respect to a reference sequence.

label: non_coding_transcript_variant
definition: A transcript variant of a non coding RNA gene.

label: mature_miRNA_variant
definition: A transcript variant located with the sequence of the mature miRNA.

label: NMD_transcript_variant
definition: A variant in a transcript that is the target of nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.

label: UTR_variant
definition: A transcript variant that is located within the UTR.

label: 5_prime_UTR_variant
definition: A UTR variant of the 5' UTR.

label: 3_prime_UTR_variant
definition: A UTR variant of the 3' UTR.

label: incomplete_terminal_codon_variant
definition: A sequence variant where at least one base of the final codon of an incompletely annotated transcript is changed.

label: intron_variant
definition: A transcript variant occurring within an intron.

label: intergenic_variant
definition: A sequence variant located in the intergenic region, between genes.

label: splice_site_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the first two or last two bases of an intron, or the 5th base from the start of the intron in the orientation of the transcript.

label: splice_region_variant
definition: A sequence variant in which a change has occurred within the region of the splice site, either within 1-3 bases of the exon or 3-8 bases of the intron.

label: upstream_gene_variant
definition: A sequence variant located 5' of a gene.

label: downstream_gene_variant
definition: A sequence variant located 3' of a gene.

label: 5KB_downstream_variant
definition: A sequence variant located within 5 KB of the end of a gene.

label: 500B_downstream_variant
definition: A sequence variant located within a half KB of the end of a gene.

label: 5KB_upstream_variant
definition: A sequence variant located within 5KB 5' of a gene.

label: 2KB_upstream_variant
definition: A sequence variant located within 2KB 5' of a gene.

label: rRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes for ribosomal RNA.

label: piRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes for an piwi associated RNA.

label: RNase_P_RNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes an RNase P RNA.

label: RNase_MRP_RNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a RNase_MRP_RNA.

label: lincRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a long, intervening non-coding RNA.

label: mathematically_defined_repeat
definition: A mathematically defined repeat (MDR) is a experimental feature that is determined by querying overlapping oligomers of length k against a database of shotgun sequence data and identifying regions in the query sequence that exceed a statistically determined threshold of repetitiveness.

label: telomerase_RNA_gene
definition: A telomerase RNA gene is a non coding RNA gene the RNA product of which is a component of telomerase.

label: targeting_vector
definition: An engineered vector that is able to take part in homologous recombination in a host with the intent of introducing site specific genomic modifications.

label: genetic_marker
definition: A measurable sequence feature that varies within a population.

label: DArT_marker
definition: A genetic marker, discovered using Diversity Arrays Technology (DArT) technology.

label: kozak_sequence
definition: A kind of ribosome entry site, specific to Eukaryotic organisms that overlaps part of both 5' UTR and CDS sequence.

label: nested_transposon
definition: A transposon that is disrupted by the insertion of another element.

label: nested_repeat
definition: A repeat that is disrupted by the insertion of another element.

label: inframe_variant
definition: A sequence variant which does not cause a disruption of the translational reading frame.

label: retinoic_acid_responsive_element
definition: A transcription factor binding site of variable direct repeats of the sequence PuGGTCA spaced by five nucleotides (DR5) found in the promoters of retinoic acid-responsive genes, to which retinoic acid receptors bind.

label: nucleotide_to_protein_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in the nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.

label: nucleotide_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with nucleotide residues.

label: metal_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with metal ions.

label: ligand_binding_site
definition: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with a small molecule such as a drug, or hormone.

label: nested_tandem_repeat
definition: An NTR is a nested repeat of two distinct tandem motifs interspersed with each other.

label: promoter_element
definition: An element that can exist within the promoter region of a gene.

label: core_eukaryotic_promoter_element
definition: An element that only exists within the promoter region of a eukaryotic gene.

label: RNA_polymerase_II_TATA_box
definition: A TATA box core promoter of a gene transcribed by RNA polymerase II.

label: RNA_polymerase_III_TATA_box
definition: A TATA box core promoter of a gene transcribed by RNA polymerase III.

label: BREd_motif
definition: A core RNA polymerase II promoter element with consensus (G/A)T(T/G/A)(T/A)(G/T)(T/G)(T/G).

label: DCE
definition: A discontinuous core element of RNA polymerase II transcribed genes, situated downstream of the TSS. It is composed of three sub elements: SI, SII and SIII.

label: DCE_SI
definition: A sub element of the DCE core promoter element, with consensus sequence CTTC.

label: DCE_SII
definition: A sub element of the DCE core promoter element with consensus sequence CTGT.

label: DCE_SIII
definition: A sub element of the DCE core promoter element with consensus sequence AGC.

label: proximal_promoter_element
definition: DNA segment that ranges from about -250 to -40 relative to +1 of RNA transcription start site, where sequence specific DNA-binding transcription factors binds, such as Sp1, CTF (CCAAT-binding transcription factor), and CBF (CCAAT-box binding factor).

label: RNApol_II_core_promoter
definition: The minimal portion of the promoter required to properly initiate transcription in RNA polymerase II transcribed genes.

label: distal_promoter_element
definition: A regulatory promoter element that is distal from the TSS.

label: bacterial_RNApol_promoter_sigma_70_element
definition: A DNA sequence to which bacterial RNA polymerase sigma 70 binds, to begin transcription.

label: bacterial_RNApol_promoter_sigma54_element
definition: A DNA sequence to which bacterial RNA polymerase sigma 54 binds, to begin transcription.

label: minus_12_signal
definition: A conserved region about 12-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units, involved with sigma factor 54.

label: minus_24_signal
definition: A conserved region about 24-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units, involved with sigma factor 54.

label: A_box_type_1
definition: An A box within an RNA polymerase III type 1 promoter.

label: A_box_type_2
definition: An A box within an RNA polymerase III type 2 promoter.

label: intermediate_element
definition: A core promoter region of RNA polymerase III type 1 promoters.

label: regulatory_promoter_element
definition: A promoter element that is not part of the core promoter, but provides the promoter with a specific regulatory region.

label: transcription_regulatory_region
definition: A regulatory region that is involved in the control of the process of transcription.

label: translation_regulatory_region
definition: A regulatory region that is involved in the control of the process of translation.

label: recombination_regulatory_region
definition: A regulatory region that is involved in the control of the process of recombination.

label: replication_regulatory_region
definition: A regulatory region that is involved in the control of the process of nucleotide replication.

label: sequence_motif
definition: A sequence motif is a nucleotide or amino-acid sequence pattern that may have biological significance.

label: experimental_feature_attribute
definition: An attribute of an experimentally derived feature.

label: score
definition: The score of an experimentally derived feature such as a p-value.

label: quality_value
definition: An experimental feature attribute that defines the quality of the feature in a quantitative way, such as a phred quality score.

label: restriction_enzyme_recognition_site
definition: The nucleotide region (usually a palindrome) that is recognized by a restriction enzyme. This may or may not be equal to the restriction enzyme binding site.

label: restriction_enzyme_cleavage_junction
definition: The boundary at which a restriction enzyme breaks the nucleotide sequence.

label: five_prime_restriction_enzyme_junction
definition: The restriction enzyme cleavage junction on the 5' strand of the nucleotide sequence.

label: three_prime_restriction_enzyme_junction
definition: The restriction enzyme cleavage junction on the 3' strand of the nucleotide sequence.

label: blunt_end_restriction_enzyme_cleavage_site
definition: A restriction enzyme recognition site that, when cleaved, results in no overhangs.

label: sticky_end_restriction_enzyme_cleavage_site
definition: A site where restriction enzymes can cleave that will produce an overhang or 'sticky end'.

label: blunt_end_restriction_enzyme_cleavage_junction
definition: A restriction enzyme cleavage site where both strands are cut at the same position.

label: single_strand_restriction_enzyme_cleavage_site
definition: A restriction enzyme cleavage site whereby only one strand is cut.

label: restriction_enzyme_single_strand_overhang
definition: A terminal region of DNA sequence where the end of the region is not blunt ended.

label: experimentally_defined_binding_region
definition: A region that has been implicated in binding although the exact coordinates of binding may be unknown.

label: ChIP_seq_region
definition: A region of sequence identified by CHiP seq technology to contain a protein binding site.

label: ASPE_primer
definition: "A primer containing an SNV at the 3' end for accurate genotyping.

label: dCAPS_primer
definition: A primer with one or more mismatches to the DNA template corresponding to a position within a restriction enzyme recognition site.

label: histone_modification
definition: Histone modification is a post translationally modified region whereby residues of the histone protein are modified by methylation, acetylation, phosphorylation, ubiquitination, sumoylation, citrullination, or ADP-ribosylation.

label: histone_methylation_site
definition: A histone modification site where the modification is the methylation of the residue.

label: histone_acetylation_site
definition: A histone modification where the modification is the acylation of the residue.

label: H3K9_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 9th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H3K14_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 14th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H3K4_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification, whereby the 4th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 protein is mono-methylated.

label: H3K4_trimethylation
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 4th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 protein is tri-methylated.

label: H3K9_trimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 9th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is tri-methylated.

label: H3K27_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 27th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is mono-methylated.

label: H3K27_trimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 27th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is tri-methylated.

label: H3K79_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 79th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is mono- methylated.

label: H3K79_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 79th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is di-methylated.

label: H3K79_trimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 79th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is tri-methylated.

label: H4K20_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 20th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H4histone protein is mono-methylated.

label: H2BK5_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 5th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2B protein is methylated.

label: ISRE
definition: An ISRE is a transcriptional cis regulatory region, containing the consensus region: YAGTTTC(A/T)YTTTYCC, responsible for increased transcription via interferon binding.

label: histone_ubiqitination_site
definition: A histone modification site where ubiquitin may be added.

label: H2B_ubiquitination_site
definition: A histone modification site on H2B where ubiquitin may be added.

label: H3K18_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 18th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H3K23_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification, whereby the 23rd residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: epigenetically_modified_region
definition: A biological DNA region implicated in epigenomic changes caused by mechanisms other than changes in the underlying DNA sequence. This includes, nucleosomal histone post-translational modifications, nucleosome depletion to render DNA accessible and post-replicational base modifications such as cytosine modification.

label: H3K27_acylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 27th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acylated.

label: H3K36_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 36th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is mono-methylated.

label: H3K36_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 36th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is dimethylated.

label: H3K36_trimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 36th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is tri-methylated.

label: H3K4_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 4th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is di-methylated.

label: H3K27_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 27th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is di-methylated.

label: H3K9_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 9th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is mono-methylated.

label: H3K9_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 9th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein may be dimethylated.

label: H4K16_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 16th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H4 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H4K5_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 5th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H4 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H4K8_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 8th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H4 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H3K27_methylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 27th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is methylated.

label: H3K36_methylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 36th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is methylated.

label: H3K4_methylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification, whereby the 4th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 protein is methylated.

label: H3K79_methylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 79th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is methylated.

label: H3K9_methylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 9th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is methylated.

label: histone_acylation_region
definition: A histone modification, whereby the histone protein is acylated at multiple sites in a region.

label: H4K_acylation_region
definition: A region of the H4 histone whereby multiple lysines are acylated.

label: gene_with_non_canonical_start_codon
definition: A gene with a start codon other than AUG.

label: gene_with_start_codon_CUG
definition: A gene with a translational start codon of CUG.

label: pseudogenic_gene_segment
definition: A gene segment which when incorporated by somatic recombination in the final gene transcript results in a nonfunctional product.

label: copy_number_gain
definition: A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given regions is greater than the reference sequence.

label: copy_number_loss
definition: A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given region is less than the reference sequence.

label: UPD
definition: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from one parent and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the other parent.

label: maternal_uniparental_disomy
definition: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from the mother and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the father.

label: paternal_uniparental_disomy
definition: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from the father and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the mother.

label: open_chromatin_region
definition: A DNA sequence that in the normal state of the chromosome corresponds to an unfolded, un-complexed stretch of double-stranded DNA.

label: SL3_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL3 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL3 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL4_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL4 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL4 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL5_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL5 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL5 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL6_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL6 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL6 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL7_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL7 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL7 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL8_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL8 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL8 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL9_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL9 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL9 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL10_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL10 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL10 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL11_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL11 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL11 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: SL12_acceptor_site
definition: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL12 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL12 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

label: duplicated_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene that arose via gene duplication. Generally duplicated pseudogenes have the same structure as the original gene, including intron-exon structure and some regulatory sequence.

label: unitary_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene, deactivated from original state by mutation, fixed in a population,where the ortholog in a reference species such as mouse remains functional.

label: non_processed_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene that arose from a means other than retrotransposition. A pseudogene created via genomic duplication of a functional protein-coding parent gene followed by accumulation of deleterious mutations.

label: variant_quality
definition: A dependent entity that inheres in a bearer, a sequence variant.

label: variant_origin
definition: A quality inhering in a variant by virtue of its origin.

label: variant_frequency
definition: A physical quality which inheres to the variant by virtue of the number instances of the variant within a population.

label: unique_variant
definition: A physical quality which inheres to the variant by virtue of the number instances of the variant within a population.

label: rare_variant
definition: When a variant from the genomic sequence is rarely found in the general population. The threshold for 'rare' varies between studies.

label: polymorphic_variant
definition: A variant that affects one of several possible alleles at that location, such as the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) genes.

label: common_variant
definition: When a variant from the genomic sequence is commonly found in the general population.

label: fixed_variant
definition: When a variant has become fixed in the population so that it is now the only variant.

label: variant_phenotype
definition: A quality inhering in a variant by virtue of its phenotype.

label: benign_variant
definition: A variant that does not affect the function of the gene or cause disease.

label: disease_associated_variant
definition: A variant that has been found to be associated with disease.

label: disease_causing_variant
definition: A variant that has been found to cause disease.

label: lethal_variant
definition: A sequence variant where the mutated gene product does not allow for one or more basic functions necessary for survival.

label: quantitative_variant
definition: A variant within a gene that contributes to a quantitative trait such as height or weight.

label: maternal_variant
definition: A variant in the genetic material inherited from the mother.

label: paternal_variant
definition: A variant in the genetic material inherited from the father.

label: somatic_variant
definition: A variant that has arisen after splitting of the embryo, resulting in the variant being found in only some of the tissues or cells of the body.

label: germline_variant
definition: A variant present in the embryo that is carried by every cell in the body.

label: pedigree_specific_variant
definition: A variant that is found only by individuals that belong to the same pedigree.

label: population_specific_variant
definition: A variant found within only speficic populations.

label: de_novo_variant
definition: A variant arising in the offspring that is not found in either of the parents.

label: TF_binding_site_variant
definition: A sequence variant located within a transcription factor binding site.

label: complex_structural_alteration
definition: A structural sequence alteration or rearrangement encompassing one or more genome fragments, with 4 or more breakpoints.

label: structural_alteration
definition: An alteration of the genome that leads to a change in the structure of one or more chromosomes.

label: loss_of_heterozygosity
definition: A functional variant whereby the sequence alteration causes a loss of function of one allele of a gene.

label: splice_donor_5th_base_variant
definition: A sequence variant that causes a change at the 5th base pair after the start of the intron in the orientation of the transcript.

label: U_box
definition: An U-box is a conserved T-rich region upstream of a retroviral polypurine tract that is involved in PPT primer creation during reverse transcription.

label: mating_type_region
definition: A specialized region in the genomes of some yeast and fungi, the genes of which regulate mating type.

label: paired_end_fragment
definition: An assembly region that has been sequenced from both ends resulting in a read_pair (mate_pair).

label: exon_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes exon sequence.

label: non_coding_transcript_exon_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes non-coding exon sequence in a non-coding transcript.

label: clone_end
definition: A read from an end of the clone sequence.

label: point_centromere
definition: A point centromere is a relatively small centromere (about 125 bp DNA) in discrete sequence, found in some yeast including S. cerevisiae.

label: regional_centromere
definition: A regional centromere is a large modular centromere found in fission yeast and higher eukaryotes. It consist of a central core region flanked by inverted inner and outer repeat regions.

label: regional_centromere_central_core
definition: A conserved region within the central region of a modular centromere, where the kinetochore is formed.

label: centromeric_repeat
definition: A repeat region found within the modular centromere.

label: regional_centromere_inner_repeat_region
definition: The inner inverted repeat region of a modular centromere and part of the central core surrounding a non-conserved central region. This region is adjacent to the central core, on each chromosome arm.

label: regional_centromere_outer_repeat_region
definition: The heterochromatic outer repeat region of a modular centromere. These repeats exist in tandem arrays on both chromosome arms.

label: tasiRNA
definition: The sequence of a 21 nucleotide double stranded, polyadenylated non coding RNA, transcribed from the TAS gene.

label: tasiRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a tasiRNA.

label: increased_polyadenylation_variant
definition: A transcript processing variant whereby polyadenylation of the encoded transcript is increased with respect to the reference.

label: decreased_polyadenylation_variant
definition: A transcript processing variant whereby polyadenylation of the encoded transcript is decreased with respect to the reference.

label: DDB_box
definition: A conserved polypeptide motif that mediates protein-protein interaction and defines adaptor proteins for DDB1/cullin 4 ubiquitin ligases.

label: destruction_box
definition: A conserved polypeptide motif that can be recognized by both Fizzy/Cdc20- and FZR/Cdh1-activated anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) and targets a protein for ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the APC/C. The consensus sequence is RXXLXXXXN.

label: ER_retention_signal
definition: A C-terminal tetrapeptide motif that mediates retention of a protein in (or retrieval to) the endoplasmic reticulum. In mammals the sequence is KDEL, and in fungi HDEL or DDEL.

label: KEN_box
definition: A conserved polypeptide motif that can be recognized by FZR/Cdh1-activated anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) and targets a protein for ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the APC/C. The consensus sequence is KENXXXN.

label: mitochondrial_targeting_signal
definition: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the mitochondrion.

label: signal_anchor
definition: A signal sequence that is not cleaved from the polypeptide. Anchors a Type II membrane protein to the membrane.

label: PIP_box
definition: A polypeptide region that mediates binding to PCNA. The consensus sequence is QXX(hh)XX(aa), where (h) denotes residues with moderately hydrophobic side chains and (a) denotes residues with highly hydrophobic aromatic side chains.

label: phosphorylation_site
definition: A post-translationally modified region in which residues of the protein are modified by phosphorylation.

label: transmembrane_helix
definition: A region that traverses the lipid bilayer and adopts a helical secondary structure.

label: vacuolar_sorting_signal
definition: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the vacuole.

label: coding_variant_quality
definition: An attribute of a coding genomic variant.

label: synonymous
definition: A variant that does not lead to any change in the amino acid sequence.

label: non_synonymous
definition: A variant that leads to the change of an amino acid within the protein.

label: inframe
definition: An attribute describing a sequence that contains a mutation involving the deletion or insertion of one or more bases, where this number is divisible by 3.

label: protein_altering_variant
definition: A sequence_variant which is predicted to change the protein encoded in the coding sequence.

label: synonymous_variant
definition: A sequence variant where there is no resulting change to the encoded amino acid.

label: inframe_indel
definition: A coding sequence variant where the change does not alter the frame of the transcript.

label: inframe_insertion
definition: An inframe non synonymous variant that inserts bases into in the coding sequence.

label: inframe_deletion
definition: An inframe non synonymous variant that deletes bases from the coding sequence.

label: conservative_inframe_insertion
definition: An inframe increase in cds length that inserts one or more codons into the coding sequence between existing codons.

label: disruptive_inframe_insertion
definition: An inframe increase in cds length that inserts one or more codons into the coding sequence within an existing codon.

label: conservative_inframe_deletion
definition: An inframe decrease in cds length that deletes one or more entire codons from the coding sequence but does not change any remaining codons.

label: disruptive_inframe_deletion
definition: An inframe decrease in cds length that deletes bases from the coding sequence starting within an existing codon.

label: mRNA_read
definition: A sequencer read of an mRNA substrate.

label: genomic_DNA_read
definition: A sequencer read of a genomic DNA substrate.

label: mRNA_contig
definition: A contig composed of mRNA_reads.

label: AFLP_fragment
definition: A PCR product obtained by applying the AFLP technique, based on a restriction enzyme digestion of genomic DNA and an amplification of the resulting fragments.

label: protein_hmm_match
definition: A match to a protein HMM such as pfam.

label: immunoglobulin_region
definition: A region of immunoglobulin sequence, either constant or variable.

label: V_region
definition: The variable region of an immunoglobulin polypeptide sequence.

label: C_region
definition: The constant region of an immunoglobulin polypeptide sequence.

label: N_region
definition: Extra nucleotides inserted between rearranged immunoglobulin segments.

label: S_region
definition: The switch region of immunoglobulin heavy chains; it is involved in the rearrangement of heavy chain DNA leading to the expression of a different immunoglobulin classes from the same B-cell.

label: mobile_element_insertion
definition: A kind of insertion where the inserted sequence is a mobile element.

label: novel_sequence_insertion
definition: An insertion the sequence of which cannot be mapped to the reference genome.

label: CSL_response_element
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence GTGRGAA, bound by CSL (CBF1/RBP-JK/Suppressor of Hairless/LAG-1) transcription factors.

label: GATA_box
definition: A GATA transcription factor element containing the consensus sequence WGATAR (in which W indicates A/T and R indicates A/G).

label: polymorphic_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene in the reference genome, though known to be intact in the genomes of other individuals of the same species. The annotation process has confirmed that the pseudogenisation event is not a genomic sequencing error.

label: AP_1_binding_site
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence TGACTCA, bound by AP-1 and related transcription factors.

label: CRE
definition:
MERGED DEFINITION:
TARGET DEFINITION: A promoter element with consensus sequence TGACGTCA; bound by the ATF/CREB family of transcription factors.
--------------------
SOURCE DEFINITION: A promoter element that contains a core sequence TGACGT, bound by a protein complex that regulates transcription of genes encoding PKA pathway components.

label: CuRE
definition: A promoter element bound by copper ion-sensing transcription factors such as S. cerevisiae Mac1p or S. pombe Cuf1; the consensus sequence is HTHNNGCTGD (more specifically TTTGCKCR in budding yeast).

label: DRE
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence CGWGGWNGMM, bound by transcription factors related to RecA and found in promoters of genes expressed following several types of DNA damage or inhibition of DNA synthesis.

label: FLEX_element
definition: A promoter element that has consensus sequence GTAAACAAACAAAM and contains a heptameric core GTAAACA, bound by transcription factors with a forkhead DNA-binding domain.

label: forkhead_motif
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence TTTRTTTACA, bound by transcription factors with a forkhead DNA-binding domain.

label: homol_D_box
definition: A core promoter element that has the consensus sequence CAGTCACA (or its inverted form TGTGACTG), and plays the role of a TATA box in promoters that do not contain a canonical TATA sequence.

label: homol_E_box
definition: A core promoter element that has the consensus sequence ACCCTACCCT (or its inverted form AGGGTAGGGT), and is found near the homol D box in some promoters that use a homol D box instead of a canonical TATA sequence.

label: HSE
definition: A promoter element that consists of at least three copies of the pentanucleotide NGAAN, bound by the heat shock transcription factor HSF.

label: iron_repressed_GATA_element
definition: A GATA promoter element with consensus sequence WGATAA, found in promoters of genes repressed in the presence of iron.

label: mating_type_M_box
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence ACAAT, found in promoters of mating type M-specific genes in fission yeast and bound by the transcription factor Mat1-Mc.

label: androgen_response_element
definition: A non-palindromic sequence found in the promoters of genes whose expression is regulated in response to androgen.

label: smFISH_probe
definition: A smFISH is a probe that binds RNA in a single molecule in situ hybridization experiment.

label: MCB
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence ACGCGT, bound by the transcription factor complex MBF (MCB-binding factor) and found in promoters of genes expressed during the G1/S transition of the cell cycle.

label: CCAAT_motif
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCAAT, bound by a protein complex that represses transcription in response to low iron levels.

label: Ace2_UAS
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCAGCC, bound by the fungal transcription factor Ace2.

label: TR_box
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence TTCTTTGTTY, bound an HMG-box transcription factor such as S. pombe Ste11, and found in promoters of genes up-regulated early in meiosis.

label: STREP_motif
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCCCTC, bound by the PKA-responsive zinc finger transcription factor Rst2.

label: rDNA_intergenic_spacer_element
definition: A DNA motif that contains a core consensus sequence AGGTAAGGGTAATGCAC, is found in the intergenic regions of rDNA repeats, and is bound by an RNA polymerase I transcription termination factor (e.g. S. pombe Reb1). The S. pombe telomeric repeat consensus is TTAC(0-1)A(0-1)G(1-8).

label: sterol_regulatory_element
definition: A 10-bp promoter element bound by sterol regulatory element binding proteins (SREBPs), found in promoters of genes involved in sterol metabolism. Many variants of the sequence ATCACCCCAC function as SREs.

label: GT_dinucleotide_repeat
definition: A dinucleotide repeat region composed of GT repeating elements.

label: GTT_trinucleotide_repeat
definition: A trinucleotide repeat region composed of GTT repeating elements.

label: Sap1_recognition_motif
definition: A DNA motif to which the S. pombe Sap1 protein binds. The consensus sequence is 5'-TARGCAGNTNYAACGMG-3'; it is found at the mating type locus, where it is important for mating type switching, and at replication fork barriers in rDNA repeats.

label: CDRE_motif
definition: An RNA polymerase II promoter element found in the promoters of genes regulated by calcineurin. The consensus sequence is GNGGCKCA.

label: BAC_read_contig
definition: A contig of BAC reads.

label: candidate_gene
definition: A gene suspected of being involved in the expression of a trait.

label: positional_candidate_gene
definition: A candidate gene whose association with a trait is based on the gene's location on a chromosome.

label: functional_candidate_gene
definition: A candidate gene whose function has something in common biologically with the trait under investigation.

label: enhancerRNA
definition: A short ncRNA that is transcribed from an enhancer. May have a regulatory function.

label: PCB
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence GNAACR, bound by the transcription factor complex PBF (PCB-binding factor) and found in promoters of genes expressed during the M/G1 transition of the cell cycle.

label: rearrangement_region
definition: A region of a chromosome, where the chromosome has undergone a large structural rearrangement that altered the genome organization. There is no longer synteny to the reference genome.

label: interchromosomal_breakpoint
definition: A rearrangement breakpoint between two different chromosomes.

label: intrachromosomal_breakpoint
definition: A rearrangement breakpoint within the same chromosome.

label: unassigned_supercontig
definition: A supercontig that is not been assigned to any ultracontig during a genome assembly project.

label: partial_genomic_sequence_assembly
definition: A partial DNA sequence assembly of a chromosome or full genome, which contains gaps that are filled with N's.

label: lncRNA
definition: A non-coding RNA over 200nucleotides in length.

label: feature_variant
definition: A sequence variant that falls entirely or partially within a genomic feature.

label: feature_ablation
definition: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the deletion, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.

label: feature_amplification
definition: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the structural change, an amplification of sequence, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.

label: feature_translocation
definition: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the structural change, a translocation, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.

label: feature_fusion
definition: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where a deletion fuses genomic features.

label: transcript_translocation
definition: A feature translocation where the region contains a transcript.

label: regulatory_region_translocation
definition: A feature translocation where the region contains a regulatory region.

label: TFBS_translocation
definition: A feature translocation where the region contains a transcription factor binding site.

label: transcript_fusion
definition: A feature fusion where the deletion brings together transcript regions.

label: regulatory_region_fusion
definition: A feature fusion where the deletion brings together regulatory regions.

label: TFBS_fusion
definition: A fusion where the deletion brings together transcription factor binding sites.

label: transcript_amplification
definition: A feature amplification of a region containing a transcript.

label: transcript_regulatory_region_fusion
definition: A feature fusion where the deletion brings together a regulatory region and a transcript region.

label: regulatory_region_amplification
definition: A feature amplification of a region containing a regulatory region.

label: TFBS_amplification
definition: A feature amplification of a region containing a transcription factor binding site.

label: transcript_ablation
definition: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a transcript feature.

label: regulatory_region_ablation
definition: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a regulatory region.

label: TFBS_ablation
definition: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a transcription factor binding site.

label: transposable_element_CDS
definition: A CDS that is part of a transposable element.

label: transposable_element_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene contained within a transposable element.

label: dg_repeat
definition: A repeat region which is part of the regional centromere outer repeat region.

label: dh_repeat
definition: A repeat region which is part of the regional centromere outer repeat region.

label: AACCCT_box
definition: A conserved 17-bp sequence (5'-ATCA(C/A)AACCCTAACCCT-3') commonly present upstream of the start site of histone transcription units functioning as a transcription factor binding site.

label: splice_region
definition: A region surrounding a cis_splice site, either within 1-3 bases of the exon or 3-8 bases of the intron.

label: antisense_lncRNA
definition: Non-coding RNA transcribed from the opposite DNA strand compared with other transcripts and overlap in part with sense RNA.

label: regional_centromere_outer_repeat_transcript
definition: A transcript that is transcribed from the outer repeat region of a regional centromere.

label: feature_truncation
definition: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

label: feature_elongation
definition: A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

label: internal_feature_elongation
definition: A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature from within the feature rather than from the terminus of the feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

label: frameshift_elongation
definition: A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be extended relative to the reference feature.

label: frameshift_truncation
definition: A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be shortened relative to the reference feature.

label: copy_number_increase
definition: A sequence variant where copies of a feature are increased relative to the reference.

label: copy_number_decrease
definition: A sequence variant where copies of a feature are decreased relative to the reference.

label: bacterial_RNApol_promoter_sigma_ecf_element
definition: A bacterial promoter with sigma ecf factor binding dependency. This is a type of bacterial promoters that requires a sigma ECF factor to bind to identified -10 and -35 sequence regions in order to mediate binding of the RNA polymerase to the promoter region as part of transcription initiation.

label: rDNA_replication_fork_barrier
definition: A DNA motif that is found in eukaryotic rDNA repeats, and is a site of replication fork pausing.

label: transcription_start_cluster
definition: A region defined by a cluster of experimentally determined transcription starting sites.

label: CAGE_tag
definition: A CAGE tag is a sequence tag hat corresponds to 5' ends of mRNA at cap sites, produced by cap analysis gene expression and used to identify transcriptional start sites.

label: CAGE_cluster
definition: A kind of transcription_initiation_cluster defined by the clustering of CAGE tags on a sequence region.

label: 5_methylcytosine
definition: A cytosine methylated at the 5 carbon.

label: 4_methylcytosine
definition: A cytosine methylated at the 4 nitrogen.

label: N6_methyladenine
definition: An adenine methylated at the 6 nitrogen.

label: mitochondrial_contig
definition: A contig of mitochondria derived sequences.

label: mitochondrial_supercontig
definition: A scaffold composed of mitochondrial contigs.

label: TERRA
definition: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts contain G rich telomeric RNA repeats and RNA tracts corresponding to adjacent subtelomeric sequences. They are 100-9000 bases long.

label: ARRET
definition: A non coding RNA transcript, complementary to subtelomeric tract of TERRA transcript but devoid of the repeats.

label: ARIA
definition: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts consist of C rich repeats.

label: anti_ARRET
definition: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts are antisense of ARRET transcripts.

label: telomeric_transcript
definition: A non-coding transcript derived from the transcript of the telomere.

label: distal_duplication
definition: A duplication of the distal region of a chromosome.

label: mitochondrial_DNA_read
definition: A sequencer read of a mitochondrial DNA sample.

label: chloroplast_DNA_read
definition: A sequencer read of a chloroplast DNA sample.

label: consensus_gDNA
definition: Genomic DNA sequence produced from some base calling or alignment algorithm which uses aligned or assembled multiple gDNA sequences as input.

label: restriction_enzyme_five_prime_single_strand_overhang
definition: A terminal region of DNA sequence where the end of the region is not blunt ended and the exposed single strand terminates at the 5' end.

label: restriction_enzyme_three_prime_single_strand_overhang
definition: A terminal region of DNA sequence where the end of the region is not blunt ended and the exposed single strand terminates at the 3' end.

label: monomeric_repeat
definition: A repeat_region containing repeat_units of 1 bp that is repeated multiple times in tandem.

label: H3K20_trimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 20th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 protein is tri-methylated.

label: H3K36_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 36th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2BK12_acetylation_site
