definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 12th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2B protein is acetylated.

label: H2AK5_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 5th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2A histone protein is acetylated.

label: H4K12_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 12th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H4 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2BK120_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 120th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2B histone protein is acetylated.

label: H4K91_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 91st residue (a lysine), from the start of the H4 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2BK20_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 20th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2B histone protein is acetylated.

label: H3K4_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 4th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2AK9_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 9th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2A histone protein is acetylated.

label: H3K56_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 56th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2BK15_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 15th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2B histone protein is acetylated.

label: H3R2_monomethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 2nd residue (an arginine), from the start of the H3 protein is mono-methylated.

label: H3R2_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 2nd residue (an arginine), from the start of the H3 protein is di-methylated.

label: H4R3_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 3nd residue (an arginine), from the start of the H4 protein is di-methylated.

label: H4K4_trimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 4th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H4 protein is tri-methylated.

label: H3K23_dimethylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 23rd residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 protein is di-methylated.

label: promoter_flanking_region
definition: A region immediately adjacent to a promoter which may or may not contain transcription factor binding sites.

label: restriction_enzyme_assembly_scar
definition: A region of DNA sequence formed from the ligation of two sticky ends where the palindrome is broken and no longer comprises the recognition site and thus cannot be re-cut by the restriction enzymes used to create the sticky ends.

label: restriction_enzyme_region
definition: A region related to restriction enzyme function.

label: protein_stability_element
definition: A polypeptide region that proves structure in a protein that affects the stability of the protein.

label: protease_site
definition: A polypeptide_region that codes for a protease cleavage site.

label: RNA_stability_element
definition: RNA secondary structure that affects the stability of an RNA molecule.

label: lariat_intron
definition: A kind of intron whereby the excision is driven by lariat formation.

label: TCT_motif
definition: A cis-regulatory element, conserved sequence YYC+1TTTYY, and spans -2 to +6 relative to +1 TSS. It is present in most ribosomal protein genes in Drosophila and mammals but not in the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae. Resembles the initiator (TCAKTY in Drosophila) but functionally distinct from initiator.

label: 5_hydroxymethylcytosine
definition: A modified DNA cytosine base feature, modified by a hydroxymethyl group at the 5 carbon.

label: 5_formylcytosine
definition: A modified DNA cytosine base feature, modified by a formyl group at the 5 carbon.

label: modified_adenine
definition: A modified adenine DNA base feature.

label: modified_cytosine
definition: A modified cytosine DNA base feature.

label: modified_guanine
definition: A modified guanine DNA base feature.

label: 8_oxoguanine
definition: A modified DNA guanine base,at the 8 carbon, often the product of DNA damage.

label: 5_carboxylcytosine
definition: A modified DNA cytosine base feature, modified by a carboxy group at the 5 carbon.

label: 8_oxoadenine
definition: A modified DNA adenine base,at the 8 carbon, often the product of DNA damage.

label: coding_transcript_variant
definition: A transcript variant of a protein coding gene.

label: coding_transcript_intron_variant
definition: A transcript variant occurring within an intron of a coding transcript.

label: non_coding_transcript_intron_variant
definition: A transcript variant occurring within an intron of a non coding transcript.

label: zinc_finger_binding_site
definition: A binding site to which a polypeptide will bind with a zinc finger motif, which is characterized by requiring one or more Zinc 2+ ions for stabilized folding.

label: histone_4_acetylation_site
definition: A histone 4 modification where the modification is the acetylation of the residue.

label: histone_3_acetylation_site
definition: A histone 3 modification where the modification is the acetylation of the residue.

label: CTCF_binding_site
definition: A transcription factor binding site with consensus sequence CCGCGNGGNGGCAG, bound by CCCTF-binding factor.

label: five_prime_sticky_end_restriction_enzyme_cleavage_site
definition: A restriction enzyme recognition site that, when cleaved, results in 5 prime overhangs.

label: three_prime_sticky_end_restriction_enzyme_cleavage_site
definition: A restriction enzyme recognition site that, when cleaved, results in 3 prime overhangs.

label: ribonuclease_site
definition: A region of a transcript encoding the cleavage site for a ribonuclease enzyme.

label: signature
definition: A region of sequence where developer information is encoded.

label: RNA_stability_element
definition: A motif that affects the stability of RNA.

label: G_box
definition: A regulatory promoter element identified in mutation experiments, with consensus sequence: CACGTG. Present in promoters, intergenic regions, coding regions, and introns. They are involved in gene expression responses to light and interact with G-box binding factor and I-box binding factor 1a.

label: L_box
definition: An orientation dependent regulatory promoter element, with consensus sequence of TTGCACAN4TTGCACA, found in plants.

label: I-box
definition: A plant regulatory promoter motif, composed of a highly conserved hexamer GATAAG (I-box core).

label: 5_prime_UTR_premature_start_codon_variant
definition: A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is introduced, moved or lost.

label: silent_mating_type_cassette_array
definition: A gene cassette array that corresponds to a silenced version of a mating type region.

label: Okazaki_fragment
definition: Any of the DNA segments produced by discontinuous synthesis of the lagging strand during DNA replication.

label: upstream_transcript_variant
definition: A feature variant, where the alteration occurs upstream of the transcript TSS.

label: downstream_transcript_variant
definition: A feature variant, where the alteration occurs downstream of the transcript termination site.

label: 5_prime_UTR_premature_start_codon_gain_variant
definition: A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is gained.

label: 5_prime_UTR_premature_start_codon_loss_variant
definition: A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is lost.

label: five_prime_UTR_premature_start_codon_location_variant
definition: A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is moved.

label: consensus_AFLP_fragment
definition: A consensus AFLP fragment is an AFLP sequence produced from any alignment algorithm which uses assembled multiple AFLP sequences as input.

label: nonsynonymous_variant
definition: A non-synonymous variant is an inframe, protein altering variant, resulting in a codon change.

label: extended_cis_splice_site
definition: Intronic positions associated with cis-splicing. Contains the first and second positions immediately before the exon and the first, second and fifth positions immediately after.

label: intron_base_5
definition: Fifth intronic position after the intron exon boundary, close to the 5' edge of the intron.

label: extended_intronic_splice_region_variant
definition: A sequence variant occurring in the intron, within 10 bases of exon.

label: extended_intronic_splice_region
definition: Region of intronic sequence within 10 bases of an exon.

label: subtelomere
definition: A heterochromatic region of the chromosome, adjacent to the telomere (on the centromeric side) that contains repetitive DNA and sometimes genes and it is transcribed.

label: sgRNA
definition: A small RNA oligo, typically about 20 bases, that guides the cas nuclease to a target DNA sequence in the CRISPR/cas mutagenesis method.

label: mating_type_region_motif
definition: DNA motif that is a component of a mating type region.

label: Y_region
definition: A segment of non-homology between a and alpha mating alleles, found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR), has two forms (Ya and Yalpha).

label: Z1_region
definition: A mating type region motif, one of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).

label: Z2_region
definition: A mating type region motif, the rightmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci (not present in HMR).

label: ARS_consensus_sequence
definition: The ACS is an 11-bp sequence of the form 5'-WTTTAYRTTTW-3' which is at the core of every yeast ARS, and is necessary but not sufficient for recognition and binding by the origin recognition complex (ORC). Functional ARSs require an ACS, as well as other cis elements in the 5' (C domain) and 3' (B domain) flanking sequences of the ACS.

label: DSR_motif
definition: The determinant of selective removal (DSR) motif consists of repeats of U(U/C)AAAC. The motif targets meiotic transcripts for removal during mitosis via the exosome.

label: zinc_repressed_element
definition: A promoter element that has the consensus sequence GNMGATC, and is found in promoters of genes repressed in the presence of zinc.

label: MNV
definition: An MNV is a multiple nucleotide variant (substitution) in which the inserted sequence is the same length as the replaced sequence.

label: rare_amino_acid_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding a rare amino acid is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

label: selenocysteine_loss
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding selenocysteine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

label: pyrrolysine_loss
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding pyrrolysine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

label: intragenic_variant
definition: A variant that occurs within a gene but falls outside of all transcript features. This occurs when alternate transcripts of a gene do not share overlapping sequence.

label: start_lost
definition: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the canonical start codon.

label: 5_prime_UTR_truncation
definition: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 5'UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

label: 5_prime_UTR_elongation
definition: A sequence variant that causes the extension of 5' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.

label: 3_prime_UTR_truncation
definition: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 3' UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

label: 3_prime_UTR_elongation
definition: A sequence variant that causes the extension of 3' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.

label: conserved_intergenic_variant
definition: A sequence variant located in a conserved intergenic region, between genes.

label: conserved_intron_variant
definition: A transcript variant occurring within a conserved region of an intron.

label: start_retained_variant
definition: A sequence variant where at least one base in the start codon is changed, but the start remains.

label: boundary_element
definition: Boundary elements are DNA motifs that prevent heterochromatin from spreading into neighboring euchromatic regions.

label: mating_type_region_replication_fork_barrier
definition: A DNA motif that is found in eukaryotic rDNA repeats, and is a site of replication fork pausing.

label: priRNA
definition: A small RNA molecule, 22-23 nt in size, that is the product of a longer RNA. The production of priRNAs is independent of dicer and involves binding of RNA by argonaute and trimming by triman. In fission yeast, priRNAs trigger the establishment of heterochromatin. PriRNAs are primarily generated from centromeric transcripts (dg and dh repeats), but may also be produced from degradation products of primary transcripts.

label: multiplexing_sequence_identifier
definition: A nucleic tag which is used in a ligation step of library preparation process to allow pooling of samples while maintaining ability to identify individual source material and creation of a multiplexed library.

label: W_region
definition: The leftmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci, but not present in HMR.

label: cis_acting_homologous_chromosome_pairing_region
definition: A genome region where chromosome pairing occurs preferentially during homologous chromosome pairing during early meiotic prophase of Meiosis I.

label: intein_encoding_region
definition: The nucleotide sequence which encodes the intein portion of the precursor gene.

label: uORF
definition: A short open reading frame that is found in the 5' untranslated region of an mRNA and plays a role in translational regulation.

label: sORF
definition: An open reading frame that encodes a peptide of less than 100 amino acids.

label: tnaORF
definition: A translated ORF encoded entirely within the antisense strand of a known protein coding gene.

label: X_region
definition: One of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT and HMR).

label: shRNA
definition: A short hairpin RNA (shRNA) is an RNA transcript that makes a tight hairpin turn that can be used to silence target gene expression via RNA interference.

label: moR
definition: A non-coding transcript encoded by sequences adjacent to the ends of the 5' and 3' miR-encoding sequences that abut the loop in precursor miRNA.

label: loR
definition: A short, non coding transcript of loop-derived sequences encoded in precursor miRNA.

label: miR_encoding_snoRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A snoRNA primary transcript that also encodes pre-miR sequence that is processed to form functionally active miRNA.

label: lncRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a lncRNA.

label: miR_encoding_lncRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A lncRNA primary transcript that also encodes pre-miR sequence that is processed to form functionally active miRNA.

label: miR_encoding_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A tRNA primary transcript that also encodes pre-miR sequence that is processed to form functionally active miRNA.

label: shRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding an shRNA.

label: miR_encoding_shRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A shRNA primary transcript that also encodes pre-miR sequence that is processed to form functionally active miRNA.

label: vaultRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a vaultRNA.

label: miR_encoding_vaultRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A vaultRNA primary transcript that also encodes pre-miR sequence that is processed to form functionally active miRNA.

label: Y_RNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding a Y-RNA.

label: miR_encoding_Y_RNA_primary_transcript
definition: A Y-RNA primary transcript that also encodes pre-miR sequence that is processed to form functionally active miRNA.

label: TCS_element
definition: A TCS element is a (yeast) transcription factor binding site, bound by the TEA DNA binding domain (DBD) of transcription factors. The consensus site is CATTCC or CATTCT.

label: pheromone_response_element
definition: A PRE is a (yeast) TFBS with consensus site [TGAAAC(A/G)].

label: FRE
definition: A FRE is an enhancer element necessary and sufficient to confer filamentation associated expression in S. cerevisiae.

label: transcription_pause_site
definition: Transcription pause sites are regions of a gene where RNA polymerase may pause during transcription. The functional role of pausing may be to facilitate factor recruitment, RNA folding, and synchronization with translation. Consensus transcription pause site have been observed in E. coli.

label: disabled_reading_frame
definition: A reading frame that could encode a full-length protein but which contains obvious mid-sequence disablements (frameshifts or premature stop codons).

label: H3K27_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 27th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H3 histone protein is acetylated.

label: constitutive_promoter
definition: A promoter that allows for continual transcription of gene.

label: inducible_promoter
definition: A promoter whereby activity is induced by the presence or absence of biotic or abiotic factors.

label: dominant_negative_variant
definition: A variant where the mutated gene product adversely affects the other (wild type) gene product.

label: gain_of_function_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby new or enhanced function is conferred on the gene product.

label: loss_of_function_variant
definition: A sequence variant whereby the gene product has diminished or abolished function.

label: null_mutation
definition: A variant whereby the gene product is not functional or the gene product is not produced.

label: intronic_splicing_silencer
definition: An intronic splicing regulatory element that functions to recruit trans acting splicing factors suppress the transcription of the gene or genes they control.

label: exonic_splicing_silencer
definition: An exonic splicing regulatory element that functions to recruit trans acting splicing factors suppress the transcription of the gene or genes they control.

label: recombination_enhancer
definition: A regulatory_region that promotes or induces the process of recombination.

label: interchromosomal_translocation
definition: A translocation where the regions involved are from different chromosomes.

label: intrachromosomal_translocation
definition: A translocation where the regions involved are from the same chromosome.

label: complex_chromosomal_rearrangement
definition: A contiguous cluster of translocations, usually the result of a single catastrophic event such as chromothripsis or chromoanasynthesis.

label: Alu_insertion
definition: An insertion of sequence from the Alu family of mobile elements.

label: LINE1_insertion
definition: An insertion from the Line1 family of mobile elements.

label: SVA_insertion
definition: An insertion of sequence from the SVA family of mobile elements.

label: mobile_element_deletion
definition: A deletion of a mobile element when comparing a reference sequence (has mobile element) to a individual sequence (does not have mobile element).

label: HERV_deletion
definition: A deletion of the HERV mobile element with respect to a reference.

label: SVA_deletion
definition: A deletion of an SVA mobile element.

label: LINE1_deletion
definition: A deletion of a LINE1 mobile element with respect to a reference.

label: Alu_deletion
definition: A deletion of an Alu mobile element with respect to a reference.

label: CDS_supported_by_peptide_spectrum_match
definition: A CDS that is supported by proteomics data.

label: sequence_comparison
definition: A position or feature where two sequences have been compared.

label: no_sequence_alteration
definition: A position or feature within a sequence that is identical to the comparable position or feature of a specified reference sequence.

label: intergenic_1kb_variant
definition: A variant that falls in an intergenic region that is 1 kb or less between 2 genes.

label: incomplete_transcript_variant
definition: A sequence variant that intersects an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: incomplete_transcript_3UTR_variant
definition: A sequence variant that intersects the 3' UTR of an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: incomplete_transcript_5UTR_variant
definition: A sequence variant that intersects the 5' UTR of an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: incomplete_transcript_intronic_variant
definition: A sequence variant that intersects the intron of an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: incomplete_transcript_splice_region_variant
definition: A sequence variant that intersects the splice region of an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: incomplete_transcript_exonic_variant
definition: A sequence variant that intersects the exon of an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: incomplete_transcript_CDS
definition: A sequence variant that intersects the coding regions of an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: incomplete_transcript_coding_splice_variant
definition: A sequence variant that intersects the coding sequence near a splice region of an incompletely annotated transcript.

label: 2KB_downstream_variant
definition: A sequence variant located within 2KB 3' of a gene.

label: exonic_splice_region_variant
definition: A sequence variant in which a change has occurred within the exonic region of the splice site, 1-2 bases from boundary.

label: unidirectional_gene_fusion
definition: A sequence variant whereby two genes, on the same strand have become joined.

label: bidirectional_gene_fusion
definition: A sequence variant whereby two genes, on alternate strands have become joined.

label: pseudogenic_CDS
definition: A non functional descendant of the coding portion of a coding transcript, part of a pseudogene.

label: non_coding_transcript_splice_region_variant
definition: A transcript variant occurring within the splice region (1-3 bases of the exon or 3-8 bases of the intron) of a non coding transcript.

label: 3_prime_UTR_exon_variant
definition: A UTR variant of exonic sequence of the 3' UTR.

label: 3_prime_UTR_intron_variant
definition: A UTR variant of intronic sequence of the 3' UTR.

label: 5_prime_UTR_intron_variant
definition: A UTR variant of intronic sequence of the 5' UTR.

label: 5_prime_UTR_exon_variant
definition: A UTR variant of exonic sequence of the 5' UTR.

label: structural_interaction_variant
definition: A variant that impacts the internal interactions of the resulting polypeptide structure.

label: non_allelic_homologous_recombination_region
definition: A genomic region at a non-allelic position where exchange of genetic material happens as a result of homologous recombination.

label: scaRNA
definition: A ncRNA, specific to the Cajal body, that has been demonstrated to function as a guide RNA in the site-specific synthesis of 2'-O-ribose-methylated nucleotides and pseudouridines in the RNA polymerase II-transcribed U1, U2, U4 and U5 spliceosomal small nuclear RNAs (snRNAs).

label: short_tandem_repeat_variation
definition: A variation that expands or contracts a tandem repeat with regard to a reference.

label: vertebrate_immune_system_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene derived from a vertebrate immune system gene.

label: immunoglobulin_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene derived from an immunoglobulin gene.

label: T_cell_receptor_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogene derived from a T-cell receptor gene.

label: IG_C_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogenic constant region of an immunoglobulin gene which closely resembles a known functional Imunoglobulin constant gene but in which the coding region has stop codons, frameshift mutations or a mutation that effects the initiation codon.

label: IG_J_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogenic joining region which closely resembles a known functional imunoglobulin joining gene but in which the coding region has stop codons, frameshift mutations or a mutation that effects the initiation codon that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the joining region of the variable domain of an immunoglobulin chain.

label: IG_V_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogenic variable region which closely resembles a known functional imunoglobulin variable gene but in which the coding region has stop codons, frameshift mutations or a mutation that effects the initiation codon that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the variable region of an immunoglobulin chain.

label: TR_V_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogenic variable region which closely resembles a known functional T receptor variable gene but in which the coding region has stop codons, frameshift mutations or a mutation that effects the initiation codon that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the variable region of an immunoglobulin chain.

label: TR_J_pseudogene
definition: A pseudogenic joining region which closely resembles a known functional T receptor (TR) joining gene but in which the coding region has stop codons, frameshift mutations or a mutation that effects the initiation codon that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the joining region of the variable domain of an immunoglobulin chain.

label: translated_processed_pseudogene
definition: A processed pseudogene where there is evidence, (mass spec data) suggesting that it is also translated.

label: translated_unprocessed_pseudogene
definition: A non-processed pseudogene where there is evidence, (mass spec data) suggesting that it is also translated.

label: transcribed_unprocessed_pseudogene
definition: A unprocessed pseudogene supported by locus-specific evidence of transcription.

label: transcribed_unitary_pseudogene
definition: A species specific unprocessed pseudogene without a parent gene, as it has an active orthologue in another species.

label: transcribed_processed_pseudogene
definition: A processed_pseudogene overlapped by locus-specific evidence of transcription.

label: polymorphic_pseudogene_with_retained_intron
definition: A polymorphic pseudogene in the reference genome, containing a retained intron, known to be intact in the genomes of other individuals of the same species. The annotation process has confirmed that the pseudogenisation event is not a genomic sequencing error.

label: pseudogene_processed_transcript
definition: A processed_transcript supported by EST and/or mRNA evidence that aligns unambiguously to a pseudogene locus (i.e. alignment to the pseudogene locus clearly better than alignment to parent locus).

label: coding_transcript_with_retained_intron
definition: A protein coding transcript containing a retained intron.

label: lncRNA_with_retained_intron
definition: A lncRNA transcript containing a retained intron.

label: NMD_transcript
definition: A protein coding transcript that contains a CDS but has one or more splice junctions >50bp downstream of stop codon, making it susceptible to nonsense mediated decay.

label: pseudogenic_transcript_with_retained_intron
definition: A transcript supported by EST and/or mRNA evidence that aligns unambiguously to the pseudogene locus; has retained intronic sequence compared to a reference transcript sequence.

label: polymorphic_pseudogene_processed_transcript
definition: A processed transcript that does not contain a CDS that fullfills annotation criteria and not necessarily functionally non-coding.

label: NMD_polymorphic_pseudogene_transcript
definition: A polymorphic pseudogene transcript that contains a CDS but has one or more splice junctions >50bp downstream of stop codon. Premature stop codon is not introduced, directly or indirectly, as a result of the variation i.e. must be present in both protein_coding and pseudogenic alleles.

label: allelic_frequency
definition: A physical quality which inheres to the allele by virtue of the number instances of the allele within a population. This is the relative frequency of the allele at a given locus in a population.

label: three_prime_overlapping_ncrna
definition: Transcript where ditag (digital gene expression profiling)and/or published experimental data strongly supports the existence of short non-coding transcripts transcribed from the 3'UTR.

label: vertebrate_immune_system_gene
definition: The configuration of the IG and TR variable (V), diversity (D) and joining (J) germline genes before DNA rearrangements (with or without constant (C) genes in undefined configuration. (germline, non rearranged regions of the IG DNA loci).

label: immunoglobulin_gene
definition: A germline immunoglobulin gene.

label: IG_C_gene
definition: A constant (C) gene, a gene that codes the constant region of an immunoglobulin chain.

label: IG_D_gene
definition: A gene that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the diversity region of the variable domain of an immunoglobuin (IG) gene.

label: IG_J_gene
definition: A joining gene that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the joining region of the variable domain of an immunoglobulin chain.

label: IG_V_gene
definition: A variable gene that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the variable region of the variable domain of an Immunoglobulin chain.

label: lncRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a long non-coding RNA.

label: mt_rRNA
definition: Mitochondrial rRNA is an RNA component of the small or large subunits of mitochondrial ribosomes.

label: mt_tRNA
definition: Mitochondrial transfer RNA.

label: NSD_transcript
definition: A transcript that contains a CDS but has no stop codon before the polyA site is reached.

label: sense_intronic_ncRNA
definition: A long non-coding transcript found within an intron of a coding or non-coding gene, with no overlap of exonic sequence.

label: sense_overlap_ncRNA
definition: A long non-coding transcript that contains a protein coding gene within its intronic sequence on the same strand, with no overlap of exonic sequence.

label: T_cell_receptor_gene
definition: A T-cell receptor germline gene.

label: TR_C_Gene
definition: A constant (C) gene, a gene that codes the constant region of a T-cell receptor chain.

label: TR_D_Gene
definition: A gene that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the diversity region of the variable domain of aT-cell receptor gene.

label: TR_J_Gene
definition: A joining gene that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the joining region of the variable domain of aT-cell receptor chain.

label: TR_V_Gene
definition: A variable gene that rearranges at the DNA level and codes the variable region of the variable domain of aT-cell receptor chain.

label: predicted_transcript
definition: A transcript feature that has been predicted but is not yet validated.

label: unconfirmed_transcript
definition: This is used for non-spliced EST clusters that have polyA features. This category has been specifically created for the ENCODE project to highlight regions that could indicate the presence of protein coding genes that require experimental validation, either by 5' RACE or RT-PCR to extend the transcripts, or by confirming expression of the putatively-encoded peptide with specific antibodies.

label: early_origin_of_replication
definition: An origin of replication that initiates early in S phase.

label: late_origin_of_replication
definition: An origin of replication that initiates late in S phase.

label: histone_2A_acetylation_site
definition: A histone 2A modification where the modification is the acetylation of the residue.

label: histone_2B_acetylation_site
definition: A histone 2B modification where the modification is the acetylation of the residue.

label: histone_2AZ_acetylation_site
definition: A histone 2AZ modification where the modification is the acetylation of the residue.

label: H2AZK4_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 4th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2AZ histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2AZK7_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 7th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2AZ histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2AZK11_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 11th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2AZ histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2AZK13_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 13th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2AZ histone protein is acetylated.

label: H2AZK15_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 15th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2AZ histone protein is acetylated.

label: AUG_initiated_uORF
definition: A uORF beginning with the canonical start codon AUG.

label: non_AUG_initiated_uORF
definition: A uORF beginning with a codon other than AUG.

label: genic_downstream_transcript_variant
definition: A variant that falls downstream of a transcript, but within the genic region of the gene due to alternately transcribed isoforms.

label: genic_upstream_transcript_variant
definition: A variant that falls upstream of a transcript, but within the genic region of the gene due to alternately transcribed isoforms.

label: mitotic_recombination_region
definition: A genomic region where there is an exchange of genetic material with another genomic region, occurring in somatic cells.

label: meiotic_recombination_region
definition: A genomic region in which there is an exchange of genetic material as a result of the repair of meiosis-specific double strand breaks that occur during meiotic prophase.

label: CArG_box
definition: A promoter element bound by the MADS family of transcription factors with consensus 5'-(C/T)TA(T/A)4TA(G/A)-3'.

label: Mat2P
definition: A gene cassette array containing H+ mating type specific information.

label: Mat3M
definition: A gene cassette array containing H- mating type specific information.

label: SHP_box
definition: A conserved Cdc48/p97 interaction motif with strict consensus sequence F[PI]GKG[TK][RK]LG[GT] and relaxed consensus sequence FXGKGX[RK]LG.

label: sequence_length_variant
definition: A sequence variant that changes the length of one or more sequence features.

label: short_tandem_repeat_change
definition: A sequence variant where the copies of a short tandem repeat (STR) feature are either contracted or expanded.

label: short_tandem_repeat_expansion
definition: A short tandem repeat variant containing more repeat units than the reference sequence.

label: short_tandem_repeat_contraction
definition: A short tandem repeat variant containing fewer repeat units than the reference sequence.

label: H2BK5_acetylation_site
definition: A kind of histone modification site, whereby the 5th residue (a lysine), from the start of the H2B histone protein is acetylated.

label: trinucleotide_repeat_expansion
definition: A short tandem repeat expansion with an increase in a sequence of three nucleotide units repeated in tandem compared to a reference sequence.

label: ref_miRNA
definition: A ref_miRNA (RefSeq-miRNA) sequence is assigned at the creation of a new mature miRNA entry in a database. The ref_miRNA sequence designation remains unchanged even if a different isomiR is later shown to be expressed at a higher level. A ref_miRNA can be produced by one or multiple pre-miRNA.

label: isomiR
definition: IsomiRs are all the bona fide variants of a mature product. IsomiRs should be connected to the ref_miRNA it is most likely to be the variant of. Some isomiRs can be variations of one or multiple ref_miRNA.

label: RNA_thermometer
definition: An RNA_thermometer is a cis element in the 5' end of an mRNA that can change its secondary structure in response to temperature and coordinate temperature-dependent gene expression.

label: splice_polypyrimidine_tract_variant
definition: A sequence variant that falls in the polypyrimidine tract at 3' end of intron between 17 and 3 bases from the end (acceptor -3 to acceptor -17).

label: splice_donor_region_variant
definition: A sequence variant that falls in the region between the 3rd and 6th base after splice junction (5' end of intron).

label: telomeric_D_loop
definition: A telomeric D-loop is a three-stranded DNA displacement loop that forms at the site where the telomeric 3' single-stranded DNA overhang (formed of the repeat sequence TTAGGG in mammals) is tucked back inside the double-stranded component of telomeric DNA molecule, thus forming a t-loop or telomeric-loop and protecting the chromosome terminus.

label: sequence_alteration_artifact
definition: A sequence_alteration where the source of the alteration is due to an artifact in the base-calling or assembly process.

label: indel_artifact
definition: An indel that is the result of base-calling or assembly error.

label: deletion_artifact
definition: A deletion that is the result of base-calling or assembly error.

label: insertion_artifact
definition: An insertion that is the result of base-calling or assembly error.

label: substitution_artifact
definition: A substitution that is the result of base-calling or assembly error.

label: duplication_artifact
definition: A duplication that is the result of base-calling or assembly error.

label: SNV_artifact
definition: An SNV that is the result of base-calling or assembly error.

label: MNV_artifact
definition: An MNV that is the result of base-calling or assembly error.

label: enzymatic_RNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes an enzymatic RNA.

label: ribozyme_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a ribozyme.

label: antisense_lncRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes an antisense long, non-coding RNA.

label: sense_overlap_ncRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a sense overlap long non-coding RNA.

label: sense_intronic_ncRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes a sense intronic long non-coding RNA.

label: bidirectional_promoter_lncRNA
definition: A non-coding locus that originates from within the promoter region of a protein-coding gene, with transcription proceeding in the opposite direction on the other strand.

label: mutational_hotspot
definition: A region of genomic sequence known to undergo mutational events with greater frequency than expected by chance.

label: HERV_insertion
definition: An insertion of sequence from the HERV family of mobile elements with respect to a reference.

label: functional_gene_region
definition: A gene_member_region that encodes sequence that directly contributes to the molecular function of its gene or gene product.

label: allelic_pseudogene
definition: A (unitary) pseudogene that is stable in the population but importantly it has a functional alternative allele also in the population. i.e., one strain may have the gene, another strain may have the pseudogene. MHC haplotypes have allelic pseudogenes.

label: enhancer_blocking_element
definition: A transcriptional cis regulatory region that when located between an enhancer and a gene's promoter prevents the enhancer from modulating the expression of the gene. Sometimes referred to as an insulator but may not include the barrier function of an insulator.

label: imprinting_control_region
definition: A regulatory region that controls epigenetic imprinting and affects the expression of target genes in an allele- or parent-of-origin-specific manner. Associated regulatory elements may include differentially methylated regions and non-coding RNAs.

label: flanking_repeat
definition: A repeat lying outside the sequence for which it has functional significance (eg. transposon insertion target sites).

label: processed_pseudogenic_rRNA
definition: The pseudogene has arisen by reverse transcription of a mRNA into cDNA, followed by reintegration into the genome. Therefore, it has lost any intron/exon structure, and it might have a pseudo-polyA-tail.

label: unprocessed_pseudogenic_rRNA
definition: The pseudogene has arisen from a copy of the parent gene by duplication followed by accumulation of random mutation. The changes, compared to their functional homolog, include insertions, deletions, premature stop codons, frameshifts and a higher proportion of non-synonymous versus synonymous substitutions.

label: unitary_pseudogenic_rRNA
definition: The pseudogene has no parent. It is the original gene, which is functional in some species but disrupted in some way (indels, mutation, recombination) in another species or strain.

label: allelic_pseudogenic_rRNA
definition: A (unitary) pseudogene that is stable in the population but importantly it has a functional alternative allele also in the population. i.e., one strain may have the gene, another strain may have the pseudogene. MHC haplotypes have allelic pseudogenes.

label: processed_pseudogenic_tRNA
definition: The pseudogene has arisen by reverse transcription of a mRNA into cDNA, followed by reintegration into the genome. Therefore, it has lost any intron/exon structure, and it might have a pseudo-polyA-tail.

label: unprocessed_pseudogenic_tRNA
definition: The pseudogene has arisen from a copy of the parent gene by duplication followed by accumulation of random mutation. The changes, compared to their functional homolog, include insertions, deletions, premature stop codons, frameshifts and a higher proportion of non-synonymous versus synonymous substitutions.

label: unitary_pseudogenic_tRNA
definition: The pseudogene has no parent. It is the original gene, which is functional in some species but disrupted in some way (indels, mutation, recombination) in another species or strain.

label: allelic_pseudogenic_tRNA
definition: A (unitary) pseudogene that is stable in the population but importantly it has a functional alternative allele also in the population. i.e., one strain may have the gene, another strain may have the pseudogene. MHC haplotypes have allelic pseudogenes.

label: terminal_repeat
definition: A repeat at the ends of and within the sequence for which it has functional significance other than long terminal repeat.

label: repeat_instability_region
definition: A repeat region that is prone to expansions and/or contractions.

label: replication_start_site
definition: A nucleotide site from which replication initiates.

label: nucleotide_cleavage_site
definition: A point in nucleic acid where a cleavage event occurs.

label: response_element
definition: A regulatory element that acts in response to a stimulus, usually via transcription factor binding.

label: sequence_source
definition: Identifies the biological source of the specified span of the sequence

label: UNAAAC_motif
definition: A hexameric RNA motif consisting of nucleotides UNAAAC (where N can be any nucleotide) that targets the RNA for degradation.

label: long_terminal_repeat_transcript
definition: An RNA that is transcribed from a long terminal repeat.

label: genomic_DNA_contig
definition: A contig composed of genomic DNA derived sequences.

label: presence_absence_variation
definition: A variation qualifying the presence of a sequence in a genome which is entirely missing in another genome.

label: circular_plasmid
definition: A self replicating circular nucleic acid molecule that is distinct from a chromosome in the organism.

label: linear_plasmid
definition: A self replicating linear nucleic acid molecule that is distinct from a chromosome in the organism. They are capped by terminal proteins covalently bound to the 5' ends of the DNA.

label: transcription_termination_signal
definition: Termination signal preferentially observed downstream of polyadenylation signal

label: redundant_inserted_stop_gained
definition: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon is changed, resulting in a stop codon inserted next to an existing stop codon. This leads to a polypeptide of the same length.

label: Zas1_recognition_motif
definition: A DNA motif to which the S. pombe Zas1 protein binds. The consensus sequence is 5'-(Y)CCCCAY-3'.

label: Pho7_binding_site
definition: A promoter element with consensus sequence [5'-TCG(G/C)(A/T)xxTTxAA], bound by the transcription factor Pho7.

label: unspecified_indel
definition: A sequence alteration which includes an insertion or a deletion. This describes a sequence length change when the direction of the change is unspecified or when such changes are pooled into one category.

label: functionally_abnormal
definition: A sequence variant in which the function of a gene product is altered with respect to a reference.

label: functionally_normal
definition: A sequence variant in which the function of a gene product is retained with respect to a reference.

label: function_uncertain_variant
definition: A sequence variant in which the function of a gene product is unknown with respect to a reference.

label: eukaryotic_promoter
definition: A regulatory_region including the Transcription Start Site (TSS) of a gene and serving as a platform for Pre-Initiation Complex (PIC) assembly, enabling transcription of a gene under certain conditions.

label: prokaryotic_promoter
definition: A regulatory_region essential for the specific initiation of transcription at a defined location in a DNA molecule, although this location might not be one single base. It is recognized by a specific RNA polymerase(RNAP)-holoenzyme, and this recognition is not necessarily autonomous.

label: inert_DNA_spacer
definition: Sequences that decrease interactions between biological regions, such as between a promoter, its 5' context and/or the translational unit(s) it regulates. Spacers can affect regulation of translation, transcription, and other biological processes.

label: 2A_self_cleaving_peptide_region
definition: A region that codes for a 2A self-cleaving polypeptide region, which is a region that can result in a break in the peptide sequence at its terminal G-P junction.

label: LOZ1_response_element
definition: A conserved sequence (5'-CGNMGATCNTY-3') transcription repressor binding site required for gene repression in the presence of high zinc.

label: group_IIC_intron
definition: A group II intron that recognizes IBS1/EBS1 for the 5-prime exon and IBS3/EBS3 for the 3-prime exon and may also recognize a stem-loop in the RNA.

label: CDS_extension
definition: A sequence variant extending the CDS, that causes elongation of the resulting polypeptide sequence.

label: CDS_five_prime_extension
definition: A sequence variant extending the CDS at the 5' end, that causes elongation of the resulting polypeptide sequence at the N terminus.

label: CDS_three_prime_extension
definition: A sequence variant extending the CDS at the 3' end, that causes elongation of the resulting polypeptide sequence at the C terminus.

label: CAAX_box
definition: A C-terminus protein motif (CAAX) serving as a post-translational prenylation site modified by the attachment of either a farnesyl or a geranyl-geranyl group to a cysteine residue. Farnesyltransferase recognizes CaaX boxes where X = M, S, Q, A, or C, whereas Geranylgeranyltransferase I recognizes CaaX boxes with X = L or E.

label: self_cleaving_ribozyme
definition: An RNA that catalyzes its own cleavage.

label: selection_marker
definition: A genetic feature that encodes a trait used for artificial selection of a subpopulation.

label: homologous_chromosome_recognition_and_pairing_locus
definition: A chromosomal locus where complementary lncRNA and associated proteins accumulate at the corresponding lncRNA gene loci to tether homologous chromosome during chromosome pairing at meiosis I.

label: pumilio_response_element
definition: A cis-acting element involved in RNA stability found in the 3' UTR of some RNA (consensus UGUAAAUA).

label: SUMO_interaction_motif
definition: A polypeptide region that mediates binding to SUMO. The motif contains a hydrophobic core sequence consisting of three or four Ile, Leu, or Val residues plus one acidic or polar residue at position 2 or 3.

label: rRNA_18S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 18S_rRNA, which functions as the small subunit of the ribosome in eukaryotes.

label: rRNA_16S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 16S_rRNA, which functions as the small subunit of the ribosome in prokaryotes.

label: rRNA_5S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 5S_rRNA, which is a portion of the large subunit of the ribosome in both eukaryotes and prokaryotes.

label: rRNA_28S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 28S_rRNA, which functions as a component of the large subunit of the ribosome in eukaryotes.

label: rRNA_5_8S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 5_8S_rRNA (5.8S rRNA), which functions as a component of the large subunit of the ribosome in eukaryotes.

label: rRNA_21S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 21S_rRNA, which functions as a component of the large subunit of the ribosome in mitochondria.

label: rRNA_25S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 25S_rRNA, which functions as a component of the large subunit of the ribosome in some eukaryotes.

label: rRNA_23S_gene
definition: A gene which codes for 23S_rRNA, which functions as a component of the large subunit of the ribosome in prokaryotes.

label: partially_duplicated_transcript
definition: A transcript which is partially duplicated due to duplication of DNA, leading to a new transcript that is only partial and likely nonfunctional.

label: five_prime_duplicated_transcript
definition: A partially_duplicated_transcript where the 5' end of the transcript is duplicated.

label: three_prime_duplicated_transcript
definition: A partially_duplicated_transcript where the 3' end of the transcript is duplicated.

label: sncRNA
definition: A non-coding RNA less than 200 nucleotides in length.

label: spurious_protein
definition: A region of DNA that is predicted to be translated and transcribed into a protein by a protein detection algorithm that does not get transcribed in nature.

label: mature_protein_region_of_CDS
definition: A CDS region corresponding to a mature protein region of a polypeptide.

label: propeptide_region_of_CDS
definition: A CDS region corresponding to a propeptide of a polypeptide.

label: signal_peptide_region_of_CDS
definition: A CDS region corresponding to a signal peptide of a polypeptide.

label: transit_peptide_region_of_CDS
definition: CDS region corresponding to a transit peptide region of a polypeptide.

label: stem_loop_region
definition: A portion of a stem loop secondary structure in RNA.

label: loop
definition: The loop portion of a stem loop, which is not folded back upon itself.

label: stem
definition: The portion of a stem loop where the RNA is folded back upon itself.

label: non_complimentary_stem
definition: A region of a stem in a stem loop structure where the sequences are non-complimentary.

label: knob
definition: Cytologically observable heterochromatic regions of chromosomes away from centromeres that contain predominatly large tandem repeats and retrotransposons.

label: teb1_recognition_motif
definition: A binding motif with the consensus sequence TTAGGG to which Teb1 binds.

label: polyA_site_cluster
definition: A region defined by a cluster of experimentally determined polyadenylation sites, typically less than 25 bp in length and associated with a single polyadenylation signal.

label: LARD
definition: Large Retrotransposon Derivative elements are long-terminal repeats that contain reverse transcriptase priming sites and are conserved in sequence but contain no open reading frames encoding typical retrotransposon proteins . The LARDs identified in barley and other Triticeae have LTRs ~5.5 kb and an interal domain of ~3.5 kb. LARDs lack coding domains and thus do not encode proteins.

label: TRIM
definition: TRIM elements have terminal direct repeat sequences of 100-250 bp in length that flank an internal domain of 100–300 bp. TRIMs lack coding domains and thus do not encode proteins.

label: Watson_strand
definition: An absolute reference to the strand. When a chromosome has p and q arms, the Watson strand is the strand whose 5'-end is on the short arm of the chromosome. Of note, the term 'plus strand' is typically based on a reference sequence where it's preferred for the plus strand to be the Watson strand, but might not be and 'plus strand' is therefore not an exact synonym.

label: Crick_strand
definition: An absolute reference to the strand. When a chromosome has p and q arms, the Crick strand is the strand whose 5'-end is on the long arm of the chromosome. Of note, the term 'minus strand' is typically based on a reference sequence where it's preferred for the minus strand to be the Crick strand, but might not be and 'minus strand' is therefore not an exact synonym.

label: Copia_LTR_retrotransposon
definition: LTR retrotransposons in the Copia superfamily contain elements coding for specific proteins in this order: GAG, AP, INT, RT, RH. GAG is a structural protein for virus-like particles. AP is aspartic proteinase. INT is a DDE integrase. RT is a reverse transcriptase. RH is RNAse H.

label: Gypsy_LTR_retrotransposon
definition: LTR retrotransposons in the Gypsy superfamily contain elements coding for specific proteins in this order: GAG, AP, RT, RH, INT. GAG is a structural protein for virus-like particles. AP is aspartic proteinase. INT is a DDE integrase. RT is a reverse transcriptase. RH is RNAse H.

label: Bel_Pao_LTR_retrotransposon
definition: LTR retrotransposons in the Bel-Pao superfamily are similar to LTRs in the Gypsy and Retrovirus superfamilies. Mainly described in metazoan genomes, this superfamily contain elements coding for specific proteins in this order: GAG, AP, RT, RH and INT. GAG is a structural protein for virus-like particles. AP is aspartic proteinase. INT is a DDE integrase. RT is a reverse transcriptase. RH is RNAse H.

label: Retrovirus_LTR_retrotransposon
definition: LTR retrotransposons in the retrovirus superfamily are similar to LTR retrotransposons in the Gypsy and Bel-Pao superfamilies. Mainly described in vertebrate animals, this superfamily contain elements coding for specific proteins in this order: GAG, AP, RT, RH, INT, and ENV. GAG is a structural protein for virus-like particles. AP is aspartic proteinase. INT is a DDE integrase. RT is a reverse transcriptase. RH is RNAse H. ENV is envelop protein.

label: Endogenous_Retrovirus_LTR_retrotransposon
definition: Endogenous retrovirus (ERV) retrotransposons are abundant in the genomes of jawed vertebrates. Human ERVs (HERVs) are classified based on their homologies to animal retroviruses. Class I families are similar in sequence to mammalian Gammaretroviruses (type C) and Epsilonretroviruses (Type E). Class II families show homology to mammalian Betaretroviruses (Type B) and Deltaretroviruses (Type D). F-Class III families are similar to foamy viruses.

label: R2_LINE_retrotransposon
definition: R2 retrotransposons are LINE elements (SO:0000194) that insert site-specifically into the host organism's 28S ribosomal RNA (rRNA) genes.

label: RTE_LINE_retrotransposon
definition: RTE retrotransposons are LINE elements (SO:0000194) that contain a domain with homology to the apurinic-apyrimidic (AP) endonucleases in addition to the previously identified reverse transcriptase domain.

label: Jockey_LINE_retrotransposon
definition: Jockey retrotransposons are LINE elements (SO:0000194) found only in arthropods. The full-length element is ~ 5 kb and contains two open reading frames (SO:0000236), ORF1 (568 aa) and ORF2 (916 aa), the second of which encodes an apurinic endonuclease (APE) and a reverse transcriptase (RT).

label: L1_LINE_retrotransposon
definition: Long interspersed element-1 (LINE-1) elements are found in the human genome, which contains ORF1 (open reading frame1, including CC, coiled coil; RRM, RNA recognition motif; CTD, carboxyl-terminal domain) and ORF2 (including EN, endonuclease; RT, reverse transcriptase; C, cysteine-rich domain). The L1-encoded proteins (ORF1p and ORF2p) can mobilize nonautonomous retrotransposons, other noncoding RNAs, and messenger RNAs.

label: I_LINE_retrotransposon
definition: Elements of the LINE I superfamily are similar to the Jockey and L1 superfamily. They contains two ORFs, the.second of which includes  Apurinic endonuclease (APE) and  reverse transcriptase (RT). The I superfamily encodes an RH (RNase H) domain downstream of the RT domain.

label: tRNA_SINE_retrotransposon
definition: Short interspersed elements that originated from tRNAs.

label: 7SL_SINE_retrotransposon
definition: Short interspersed elements that originated from 7SL RNAs.

label: 5S_SINE_retrotransposon
definition: Short interspersed elements that originated from 5S rRNAs.

label: Crypton_YR_transposon
definition: Crypton is a superfamily of DNA transposons that use tyrosine recombinase (YR) to cut and rejoin the recombining DNA molecules.

label: Tc1_Mariner_TIR_transposon
definition: Elements of the Tc1-Mariner terminal inverted repeat transposon superfamily (also called mariner transposons) are named after the Transponon of C. elegans number 1 transposasse. Their activity creates a 2-bp (TA) target-site duplication (TSD). Stowaway is the non-autonomous element in this superfamily usually shorter than 600 bp.

label: hAT_TIR_transposon
definition: The hAT terminal inverted repeat transposon superfamily elements were first found in maize (the Ac/Ds elements). Members of the hAT superfamily have TSDs of 8 bp, relatively short TIRs of 5–27 bp and overall lengths of less than 4 kb.

label: Mutator_TIR_transposon
definition: Members of the Mutator family of terminal inverted repeat (TIR) transposon are usually long but are also highly divergent, either sharing only terminal G…C nucleotides, or with the G…C nucleotides absent. The length of the TSD (7-11 bp, usually 9 bp) remains probably the most useful criterion for identification.

label: Merlin_TIR_transposon
definition: Terminal inverted repeat transposon superfamily Merlin elements create 8-9 bp target-site duplications (TSD).

label: Transib_TIR_transposon
definition: Terminal inverted repeat (TIR) transposons of the superfamily Transib contain the DDE motif, which is related to the RAG1 protein involved in V(D)J recombination.

label: piggyBac_TIR_transposon
definition: Primarily found in animals, the terminal inverted repeat (TIR) transposon superfamily piggyBac elements favour insertion adjacent to TTAA.

label: PIF_Harbinger_TIR_transposon
definition: Terminal inverted repeat transposons in the PIF/Harbinger/tourist superfamily create 3-bp target site duplication that are mainly 'TAA' or 'TTA'. The autonomous PIF-Harbinger elements are relatively small in size, usually a few kb in length. Non-autonomous elements in this superfamily usually shorter than 600 bp are referrred to as Tourist elements. The terminal sequences for PIF/Harbinger/Tourist elements are 'GGG/CCC…GGC/GCC' or 'GA/GGCA…TGCC/TC'.

label: CACTA_TIR_transposon
definition: This terminal inverted repeat of the CACTA family generate 3-bp target site duplication (TSD) upon insertion. CACTA elements do not have a significant preference for genic region insertions. This terminal inverted repeat (TIR) transposon superfamily is named CACTA because their terminal sequences are 'CACTA/G…C/TAGTG'.

label: YR_retrotransposon
definition: Tyrosine Kinase (YR) retrotransposons are a subclass of non-LTR retrotransposons. These YR-encoding elements consist of central gag, pol and tyrosine recombinase (YR) open reading frames (ORFs) flanked with terminal repeat. The pol ORF includes a reverse transcriptase (RT), a RNase H (RH) and, in case of DIRS, a domain similar to bacterial and phage DNA N-6-adenine-methyltransferase (MT). Compared to the retroviral pol (LTR retrotransposons, non-LTR retrotransposons and Penelope elements), both aspartic protease and DDE integrase are absent from YR retrotransposons. YR retrotransposons have inverted terminal repeats (ITRs).

label: DIRS_YR_retrotransposon
definition: Dictyostelium intermediate repeat sequence (DIRS) retrotransposons are members of the YR_retrotransposon (SO:0002286) superfamily with the following protein domains: RT, RH, YR, and MT. RT is a reverse transcriptase. RH is RNAse H. YR is tyrosine recombinase. MT is DNA N-6-adenine-methyltransferase.

label: Ngaro_YR_retrotransposon
definition: Ngaro retrotransposons are members of the YR_retrotransposon (SO:0002286) superfamily with the following protein domains: RT, RH, YR. RT is a reverse transcriptase. RH is RNAse H. YR is Tyrosine recombinase. Inverted terminal repeats (ITRs) in Ngaro are arranged in A-pol-B-A-B order where A and B represent ITRs.

label: Viper_YR_retrotransposon
definition: VIPER retrotransposons are members of the YR_retrotransposon (SO:0002286 superfamily with protein domains: RT, RH, YR. RT is a reverse transcriptase. RH is RNAse H. YR is Tyrosine recombinase. Inverted terminal repeats (ITRs) in VIPER are arranged in A-pol-B-A-B order where A and B represent ITRs. VIPER is only found in kinetoplastida genomes.

label: Penelope_retrotransposon
definition: Penelope is a subclass of non_LTR_retrotransposons (SO:0000189). Penelope retrotransposons contains structural features of TR, RT, EN, TR, terminal repeats which can be in tandem or inverse orientation in different Penelope copies. RT is reverse transcriptase. EN is endonuclease.

label: circular_ncRNA
definition: A non-coding RNA that is generated by backsplicing of exons or introns, resulting in a covalently closed loop without a 5’ cap or 3’ polyA tail.

label: circular_mRNA
definition: An mRNA that is generated by backsplicing of exons or introns, resulting in a covalently closed loop without a 5’ cap or 3’ polyA tail.

label: mitochondrial_control_region
definition: The non-coding region of the mitochondrial genome that controls RNA and DNA synthesis.

label: mitochondrial_D_loop
definition: Mitochondrial displacement loop; a region within mitochondrial DNA in which a short stretch of RNA is paired with one strand of DNA, displacing the original partner DNA strand in this region.

label: transcription_factor_regulatory_site
definition: A TF_binding_site that is involved in regulation of expression.

label: TFRS_module
definition: The possible discontinuous stretch of DNA that is the combination of one or several TFRSs whose bound TFs work jointly in the regulation of a promoter.

label: TFRS_collection
definition: The possible discontinous stretch of DNA that encompass all the TFRSs that regulate a promoter.

label: simple_operon
definition: An operon whose transcription is coordinated on a single transcription unit.

label: complex_operon
definition: An operon whose transcription is coordinated on several mutually overlapping transcription units transcribed in the same direction and sharing at least one gene.

label: unit_of_gene_expression
definition: Transcription units or transcribed coding sequences.

label: transcription_unit
definition: DNA regions delimited by different nonspurious TSS-TTS pairs.

label: simple_regulon
definition: A regulon defined by considering one regulatory gene product.

label: complex_regulon
definition: A regulon defined by considering the units of expression regulated by a specified set of regulatory gene products.

label: topologically_associated_domain
definition: An instance of a self-interacting DNA region flanked by left and right TAD boundaries.

label: topologically_associated_domain_boundary
definition: A DNA region enriched in DNA loop anchors and across which DNA loops occur less often than expected by chance.

label: chromatin_regulatory_region
definition: A region of a chromosome where regulatory events occur, including epigenetic modifications. These epigenetic modifications can include nucleosome modifications and post-replicational DNA modifications.

label: DNA_loop
definition: A region of DNA between two loop anchor positions that are held in close physical proximity.

label: DNA_loop_anchor
definition: The ends of a DNA loop where the two strands of DNA are held in close physical proximity. During interphase the anchors of DNA loops are convergently oriented CTCF binding sites.

label: core_promoter_element
definition: An element that always exists within the promoter region of a gene. When multiple transcripts exist for a gene, the separate transcripts may have separate core_promoter_elements.

label: cryptic_promoter
definition: The promoter of a cryptic gene.

label: viral_promoter
definition: A regulatory_region including the Transcription Start Site (TSS) of a gene found in genes of viruses.

label: core_prokaryotic_promoter_element
definition: An element that always exists within the promoter region of a prokaryotic gene.

label: core_viral_promoter_element
definition: An element that always exists within the promoter region of a viral gene.

label: altered_gene_product_level
definition: A sequence variant that alters the level of transcription of a gene.

label: increased_gene_product_level
definition: A sequence variant that increases the level of transcription of a gene.

label: decreased_gene_product_level
definition: A sequence variant that decreases the level of transcription of a gene.

label: absent_gene_product
definition: A sequence variant that entirely stops the transcription of a gene.

label: altered_gene_product_structure
definition: A sequence variant that alters the structure of a gene product.

label: NMD_triggering_variant
definition: A sequence variant that leads to a change in the location of a termination codon in a transcript that leads to nonsense-mediated decay (NMD). The change in location of a termination codon can be caused by several different types of sequence variants, including stop_gained (SO:0001587), frameshift_variant (SO:0001589), splice_donor_variant (SO:0001575), and splice_acceptor_variant (SO:0001574) types of variants.

label: NMD_escaping_variant
definition: A sequence variant that leads to a change in the location of a termination codon in a transcript but allows the transcript to escape nonsense-mediated decay (NMD). The change in location of a termination codon can be caused by several different types of sequence variants, including stop_gained (SO:0001587), frameshift_variant (SO:0001589), splice_donor_variant (SO:0001575), and splice_acceptor_variant (SO:0001574) types of variants.

label: stop_gained_NMD_triggering
definition: A stop_gained (SO:0001587) variant that is degraded by nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: stop_gained_NMD_escaping
definition: A stop_gained (SO:0001587) variant that allows the transcript to escape nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: frameshift_variant_NMD_triggering
definition: A frameshift_variant (SO:0001589) that is degraded by nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: frameshift_variant_NMD_escaping
definition: A frameshift_variant (SO:0001589) that allows the transcript to escape nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: splice_donor_variant_NMD_triggering
definition: A splice_donor_variant (SO:0001575) that is degraded by nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: splice_donor_variant_NMD_escaping
definition: A splice_donor_variant (SO:0001575) that allows the transcript to escape nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: splice_acceptor_variant_NMD_triggering
definition: A splice_acceptor_variant (SO:0001574) that is degraded by nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: splice_acceptor_variant_NMD_escaping
definition: A splice_acceptor_variant (SO:0001574) that allows the transcript to escape nonsense-mediated decay (NMD).

label: minus_1_translational_frameshift
definition: The region of mRNA 1 base long that is included as part of two separate codons during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

label: minus_2_translational_frameshift
definition: The region of mRNA 2 bases long that is included as part of two separate codons during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

label: accessible_DNA_region
definition: A region of DNA that is depleted of nucleosomes and accessible to DNA-binding proteins including transcription factors and nucleases.

label: epigenomically_modified_region
definition: A biological region implicated in inherited changes caused by mechanisms other than changes in the underlying DNA sequence.

label: amber_stop_codon
definition: A stop codon with the DNA sequence TAG.

label: ochre_stop_codon
definition: A stop codon with the DNA sequence TAA.

label: opal_stop_codon
definition: A stop codon with the DNA sequence TGA.

label: rRNA_2S_gene
definition: A gene that encodes for 2S ribosomal RNA, which functions as a component of the large subunit of the ribosome in Drosophila and at least some other Diptera.

label: cytosolic_2S_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic 2S rRNA is a 30 nucleotide RNA component of the large subunit of cytosolic ribosomes in Drosophila and at least some other Diptera. It is homologous to the 3' part of other 5.8S rRNA molecules. The 3' end of the 5.8S molecule is able to base-pair with the 5' end of the 2S rRNA to generate a helical region equivalent in position to the 'GC-rich hairpin' found in all previously sequenced 5.8S molecules.

label: U7_snRNA
definition: A 57 to 71 nucleotide RNA that is a component of the U7 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein complex (U7 snRNP). The U7 snRNP is required for histone pre-mRNA processing.

label: scaRNA_gene
definition: A gene that encodes for a scaRNA (small Cajal body-specific RNA).

label: RNA_7SK
definition: An abundant small nuclear RNA that, together with associated cellular proteins, regulates the activity of the positive transcription elongation factor b (P-TEFb). It is often described in literature as similar to a snRNA, except of longer length.

label: RNA_7SK_gene
definition: A gene encoding a 7SK RNA (SO:0002340).

label: sncRNA_gene
definition: A ncRNA_gene (SO:0001263) that is less than 200 nucleotides in length.

label: cytosolic_rRNA
definition: Cytosolic rRNA is an RNA component of the small or large subunits of cytosolic ribosomes.

label: mt_SSU_rRNA
definition: Mitochondrial SSU rRNA is an RNA component of the small subunit of mitochondrial ribosomes.

label: mt_LSU_rRNA
definition: Mitochondrial LSU rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of mitochondrial ribosomes.

label: plastid_rRNA
definition: Plastid rRNA is an RNA component of the small or large subunits of plastid (such as chloroplast) ribosomes.

label: plastid_SSU_rRNA
definition: Plastid SSU rRNA is an RNA component of the small subunit of plastid (such as chloroplast) ribosomes.

label: plastid_LSU_rRNA
definition: Plastid LSU rRNA is an RNA component of the large subunit of plastid (such as chloroplast) ribosomes.

label: regulatory_region
definition: A region of sequence that is involved in the control of a biological process.

label: U14_snoRNA_primary_transcript
definition: The primary transcript of an evolutionarily conserved eukaryotic low molecular weight RNA capable of intermolecular hybridization with both homologous and heterologous 18S rRNA.

label: methylation_guide_snoRNA
definition: A snoRNA that specifies the site of 2'-O-ribose methylation in an RNA molecule by base pairing with a short sequence around the target residue.

label: rRNA_cleavage_RNA
definition: An ncRNA that is part of a ribonucleoprotein that cleaves the primary pre-rRNA transcript in the process of producing mature rRNA molecules.

label: exon_of_single_exon_gene
definition: An exon that is the only exon in a gene.

label: cassette_array_member
definition: A gene that is a member of a gene cassette, which is a mobile genetic element.

label: gene_cassette_member
definition: A gene that is a member of a gene cassette, which is a mobile genetic element.

label: gene_subarray_member
definition: A gene that is a member of a group of genes that are either regulated or transcribed together within a larger group of genes that are regulated or transcribed together.

label: primer_binding_site
definition: Non-covalent primer binding site for initiation of replication, transcription, or reverse transcription.

label: gene_array
definition: An array includes two or more genes, or two or more gene subarrays, contiguously arranged where the individual genes, or subarrays, are either identical in sequence, or essentially so.

label: gene_subarray
definition: A subarray is, by defintition, a member of a gene array (SO:0005851); the members of a subarray may differ substantially in sequence, but are closely related in function.

label: gene_cassette
definition: A gene that can be substituted for a related gene at a different site in the genome.

label: gene_cassette_array
definition: An array of non-functional genes whose members, when captured by recombination form functional genes.

label: gene_group
definition: A collection of related genes.

label: selenocysteine_tRNA_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript encoding seryl tRNA (SO:000269).

label: selenocysteinyl_tRNA
definition: A tRNA sequence that has a selenocysteine anticodon, and a 3' selenocysteine binding region.

label: syntenic_region
definition: A region in which two or more pairs of homologous markers occur on the same chromosome in two or more species.

label: biochemical_region_of_peptide
definition: A region of a peptide that is involved in a biochemical function.

label: molecular_contact_region
definition: A region that is involved a contact with another molecule.

label: intrinsically_unstructured_polypeptide_region
definition: A region of polypeptide chain with high conformational flexibility.

label: catmat_left_handed_three
definition: A motif of 3 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+1: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. An extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance would be useful, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. More precisely these two oxygens are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+1.

label: catmat_left_handed_four
definition: A motif of 4 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i+1: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+2: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+2: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. The extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance is similar, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. In this case these two Oxygen atoms are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+2.

label: catmat_right_handed_three
definition: A motif of 3 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+1: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. An extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance would be useful, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. More precisely these two oxygens are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+1.

label: catmat_right_handed_four
definition: A motif of 4 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i+1: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+2: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+2: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. The extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance is similar, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. In this case these two Oxygen atoms are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+2.

label: alpha_beta_motif
definition: A motif of five consecutive residues and two H-bonds in which: H-bond between CO of residue(i) and NH of residue(i+4), H-bond between CO of residue(i) and NH of residue(i+3),Phi angles of residues(i+1), (i+2) and (i+3) are negative.

label: lipoprotein_signal_peptide
definition: A peptide that acts as a signal for both membrane translocation and lipid attachment in prokaryotes.

label: no_output
definition: An experimental region wherean analysis has been run and not produced any annotation.

label: cleaved_peptide_region
definition: The cleaved_peptide_region is the region of a peptide sequence that is cleaved during maturation.

label: peptide_coil
definition: Irregular, unstructured regions of a protein's backbone, as distinct from the regular region (namely alpha helix and beta strand - characterised by specific patterns of main-chain hydrogen bonds).

label: hydrophobic_region_of_peptide
definition: Hydrophobic regions are regions with a low affinity for water.

label: n_terminal_region
definition: The amino-terminal positively-charged region of a signal peptide (approx 1-5 aa).

label: c_terminal_region
definition: The more polar, carboxy-terminal region of the signal peptide (approx 3-7 aa).

label: central_hydrophobic_region_of_signal_peptide
definition: The central, hydrophobic region of the signal peptide (approx 7-15 aa).

label: polypeptide_conserved_motif
definition: A conserved motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) region of biological interest that is conserved in different proteins. They may or may not have functional or structural significance within the proteins in which they are found.

label: polypeptide_binding_motif
definition: A polypeptide binding motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) polypeptide region of biological interest that contains one or more amino acids experimentally shown to bind to a ligand.

label: polypeptide_catalytic_motif
definition: A polypeptide catalytic motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) polypeptide region that contains one or more active site residues.

label: polypeptide_DNA_contact
definition: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with DNA.

label: polypeptide_conserved_region
definition: A subsection of sequence with biological interest that is conserved in different proteins. They may or may not have functional or structural significance within the proteins in which they are found.

label: substitution
definition: A sequence alteration where the length of the change in the variant is the same as that of the reference.

label: complex_substitution
definition: When no simple or well defined DNA mutation event describes the observed DNA change, the keyword "complex" should be used. Usually there are multiple equally plausible explanations for the change.

label: point_mutation
definition: A single nucleotide change which has occurred at the same position of a corresponding nucleotide in a reference sequence.

label: transition
definition: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into an other pyrimidine nucleotide, or change of a purine nucleotide, A or G, into an other purine nucleotide.

label: pyrimidine_transition
definition: A substitution of a pyrimidine, C or T, for another pyrimidine.

label: C_to_T_transition
definition: A transition of a cytidine to a thymine.

label: C_to_T_transition_at_pCpG_site
definition: The transition of cytidine to thymine occurring at a pCpG site as a consequence of the spontaneous deamination of 5'-methylcytidine.

label: T_to_C_transition
definition: A transition of a thymine to a cytidine.

label: purine_transition
definition: A substitution of a purine, A or G, for another purine.

label: A_to_G_transition
definition: A transition of an adenine to a guanine.

label: G_to_A_transition
definition: A transition of a guanine to an adenine.

label: transversion
definition: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into a purine nucleotide, A or G, or vice versa.
