label: pyrimidine_to_purine_transversion
definition: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into a purine nucleotide, A or G.

label: C_to_A_transversion
definition: A transversion from cytidine to adenine.

label: C_to_G_transversion
definition: A transversion of a cytidine to a guanine.

label: T_to_A_transversion
definition: A transversion from T to A.

label: T_to_G_transversion
definition: A transversion from T to G.

label: purine_to_pyrimidine_transversion
definition: Change of a purine nucleotide, A or G , into a pyrimidine nucleotide C or T.

label: A_to_C_transversion
definition: A transversion from adenine to cytidine.

label: A_to_T_transversion
definition: A transversion from adenine to thymine.

label: G_to_C_transversion
definition: A transversion from guanine to cytidine.

label: G_to_T_transversion
definition: A transversion from guanine to thymine.

label: intrachromosomal_mutation
definition: A chromosomal structure variation within a single chromosome.

label: chromosomal_deletion
definition: An incomplete chromosome.

label: chromosomal_inversion
definition: An interchromosomal mutation where a region of the chromosome is inverted with respect to wild type.

label: interchromosomal_mutation
definition: A chromosomal structure variation whereby more than one chromosome is involved.

label: delins
definition: A sequence alteration which included an insertion and a deletion, affecting 2 or more bases.

label: duplication
definition: An insertion which derives from, or is identical in sequence to, nucleotides present at a known location in the genome.

label: inversion
definition: A continuous nucleotide sequence is inverted in the same position.

label: chromosomal_duplication
definition: An extra chromosome.

label: intrachromosomal_duplication
definition: A duplication that occurred within a chromosome.

label: direct_tandem_duplication
definition: A tandem duplication where the individual regions are in the same orientation.

label: inverted_tandem_duplication
definition: A tandem duplication where the individual regions are not in the same orientation.

label: intrachromosomal_transposition
definition: A chromosome structure variation whereby a transposition occurred within a chromosome.

label: compound_chromosome
definition: A chromosome structure variant where a monocentric element is caused by the fusion of two chromosome arms.

label: Robertsonian_fusion
definition: A non reciprocal translocation whereby the participating chromosomes break at their centromeres and the long arms fuse to form a single chromosome with a single centromere.

label: chromosomal_translocation
definition: A chromosomal mutation. Rearrangements that alter the pairing of telomeres are classified as translocations.

label: ring_chromosome
definition: A ring chromosome is a chromosome whose arms have fused together to form a ring, often with the loss of the ends of the chromosome.

label: pericentric_inversion
definition: A chromosomal inversion that includes the centromere.

label: paracentric_inversion
definition: A chromosomal inversion that does not include the centromere.

label: reciprocal_chromosomal_translocation
definition: A chromosomal translocation with two breaks; two chromosome segments have simply been exchanged.

label: sequence_variation_affecting_transcript
definition: Any change in mature, spliced and processed, RNA that results from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

label: sequence_variant_causing_no_change_in_transcript
definition: No effect on the state of the RNA.

label: sequence_variation_affecting_coding_sequence
definition: Any of the amino acid coding triplets of a gene are affected by the DNA mutation.

label: sequence_variant_causing_initiator_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The DNA mutation changes, usually destroys, the first coding triplet of a gene. Usually prevents translation although another initiator codon may be used.

label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_coding_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The DNA mutation affects the amino acid coding sequence of a gene; this region includes both the initiator and terminator codons.

label: sequence_variant_causing_synonymous_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The changed codon has the same translation product as the original codon.

label: sequence_variant_causing_non_synonymous_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: A DNA point mutation that causes a substitution of an amino acid by an other.

label: sequence_variant_causing_missense_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The nucleotide change in the codon leads to a new codon coding for a new amino acid.

label: sequence_variant_causing_conservative_missense_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The amino acid change following from the codon change does not change the gross properties (size, charge, hydrophobicity) of the amino acid at that position.

label: sequence_variant_causing_nonconservative_missense_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The amino acid change following from the codon change changes the gross properties (size, charge, hydrophobicity) of the amino acid in that position.

label: sequence_variant_causing_nonsense_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The nucleotide change in the codon triplet creates a terminator codon.

label: sequence_variant_causing_terminator_codon_change_in_transcript
definition: The nucleotide change in the codon triplet changes the stop codon, causing an elongated transcript sequence.

label: sequence_variation_affecting_reading_frame
definition: An umbrella term for terms describing an effect of a sequence variation on the frame of translation.

label: frameshift_sequence_variation
definition: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, because the number of nucleotides inserted or deleted is not a multiple of three.

label: sequence_variant_causing_plus_1_frameshift_mutation
definition: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the insertion of a nucleotide.

label: sequence_variant_causing_minus_1_frameshift
definition: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the deletion of a nucleotide.

label: sequence_variant_causing_plus_2_frameshift
definition: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the insertion of two nucleotides.

label: sequence_variant_causing_minus_2_frameshift
definition: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the deletion of two nucleotides.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_transcript_processing
definition: Sequence variant affects the way in which the primary transcriptional product is processed to form the mature transcript.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_splicing
definition: A sequence_variant_effect where the way in which the primary transcriptional product is processed to form the mature transcript, specifically by the removal (splicing) of intron sequences is changed.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_splice_donor
definition: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the splice donor sequence.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_splice_acceptor
definition: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the splice acceptor sequence.

label: sequence_variant_causing_cryptic_splice_activation
definition: A sequence variant causing a new (functional) splice site.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_editing
definition: Sequence variant affects the editing of the transcript.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_transcription
definition: Mutation affects the process of transcription, its initiation, progression or termination.

label: sequence_variant_decreasing_rate_of_transcription
definition: A sequence variation that decreases the rate a which transcription of the sequence occurs.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_rate_of_transcription
definition: A mutation that alters the rate a which transcription of the sequence occurs.

label: sequence variant_affecting_transcript_stability
definition: Sequence variant affects the stability of the transcript.

label: sequence_variant_increasing_transcript_stability
definition: Sequence variant increases the stability (half-life) of the transcript.

label: sequence_variant_decreasing_transcript_stability
definition: Sequence variant decreases the stability (half-life) of the transcript.

label: sequence_variation_affecting_level_of_transcript
definition: A sequence variation that causes a change in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

label: sequence_variation_decreasing_level_of_transcript
definition: A sequence variation that causes a decrease in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

label: sequence_variation_increasing_level_of_transcript
definition: A sequence_variation that causes an increase in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_translational_product
definition: A sequence variant causing a change in primary translation product of a transcript.

label: sequence_variant_causing_no_change_of_translational_product
definition: The sequence variant at RNA level does not lead to any change in polypeptide.

label: sequence_variant_causing_complex_change_of_translational_product
definition: Any sequence variant effect that is known at nucleotide level but cannot be explained by using other key terms.

label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_substitution
definition: The replacement of a single amino acid by another.

label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_insertion
definition: The insertion of one or more amino acids from the polypeptide, without affecting the surrounding sequence.

label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_deletion
definition: The deletion of one or more amino acids from the polypeptide, without affecting the surrounding sequence.

label: sequence_variant_causing_polypeptide_truncation
definition: The translational product is truncated at its C-terminus, usually a result of a nonsense codon change in transcript (SO:1000062).

label: sequence_variant_causing_polypeptide_elongation
definition: The extension of the translational product at either (or both) the N-terminus and/or the C-terminus.

label: frame_restoring_sequence_variant
definition: A mutation that reverts the sequence of a previous frameshift mutation back to the initial frame.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_3D_structure_of_polypeptide
definition: A mutation that changes the amino acid sequence of the peptide in such a way that it changes the 3D structure of the molecule.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_transcript_secondary_structure
definition: A sequence variant that affects the secondary structure (folding) of the RNA transcript molecule.

label: sequence_variant_effect
definition: The effect of a change in nucleotide sequence.

label: autosynaptic_chromosome
definition: An autosynaptic chromosome is the aneuploid product of recombination between a pericentric inversion and a cytologically wild-type chromosome.

label: homo_compound_chromosome
definition: A compound chromosome whereby two copies of the same chromosomal arm attached to a common centromere. The chromosome is diploid for the arm involved.

label: hetero_compound_chromosome
definition: A compound chromosome whereby two arms from different chromosomes are connected through the centromere of one of them.

label: chromosome_fission
definition: A chromosome that occurred by the division of a larger chromosome.

label: dextrosynaptic_chromosome
definition: An autosynaptic chromosome carrying the two right (D = dextro) telomeres.

label: laevosynaptic_chromosome
definition: LS is an autosynaptic chromosome carrying the two left (L = levo) telomeres.

label: free_duplication
definition: A chromosome structure variation whereby the duplicated sequences are carried as a free centric element.

label: free_ring_duplication
definition: A ring chromosome which is a copy of another chromosome.

label: deficient_translocation
definition: A chromosomal deletion whereby a translocation occurs in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

label: inversion_cum_translocation
definition: A chromosomal translocation whereby the first two breaks are in the same chromosome, and the region between them is rejoined in inverted order to the other side of the first break, such that both sides of break one are present on the same chromosome. The remaining free ends are joined as a translocation with those resulting from the third break.

label: bipartite_duplication
definition: An interchromosomal mutation whereby the (large) region between the first two breaks listed is lost, and the two flanking segments (one of them centric) are joined as a translocation to the free ends resulting from the third break.

label: cyclic_translocation
definition: A chromosomal translocation whereby three breaks occurred in three different chromosomes. The centric segment resulting from the first break listed is joined to the acentric segment resulting from the second, rather than the third.

label: bipartite_inversion
definition: A chromosomal inversion caused by three breaks in the same chromosome; both central segments are inverted in place (i.e., they are not transposed).

label: uninverted_insertional_duplication
definition: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

label: inverted_insertional_duplication
definition: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segments.

label: insertional_duplication
definition: A chromosome duplication involving the insertion of a duplicated region (as opposed to a free duplication).

label: interchromosomal_transposition
definition: A chromosome structure variation whereby a transposition occurred between chromosomes.

label: inverted_interchromosomal_transposition
definition: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segment.

label: uninverted_interchromosomal_transposition
definition: An interchromosomal transition where the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

label: inverted_intrachromosomal_transposition
definition: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segments.

label: uninverted_intrachromosomal_transposition
definition: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

label: unoriented_insertional_duplication
definition: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.

label: unoriented_interchromosomal_transposition
definition: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.

label: unoriented_intrachromosomal_transposition
definition: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.

label: uncharacterized_chromosomal_mutation
definition: A chromosome structure variant that has not been characterized.

label: deficient_inversion
definition: A chromosomal deletion whereby three breaks occur in the same chromosome; one central region is lost, and the other is inverted.

label: tandem_duplication
definition: A duplication consisting of 2 identical adjacent regions.

label: partially_characterized_chromosomal_mutation
definition: A chromosome structure variant that has not been characterized fully.

label: sequence_variant_affecting_gene_structure
definition: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the gene structure.

label: sequence_variant_causing_gene_fusion
definition: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the gene structure by causing a fusion to another gene.

label: chromosome_number_variation
definition: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number.

label: chromosome_structure_variation
definition: An alteration of the genome that leads to a change in the structure or number of one or more chromosomes.

label: sequence_variant_causes_exon_loss
definition: A sequence variant affecting splicing and causes an exon loss.

label: sequence_variant_causes_intron_gain
definition: A sequence variant effect, causing an intron to be gained by the processed transcript; usually a result of a donor acceptor mutation (SO:1000072).

label: alternatively_spliced_transcript
definition: A transcript that is alternatively spliced.

label: encodes_1_polypeptide
definition: A gene that is alternately spliced, but encodes only one polypeptide.

label: encodes_greater_than_1_polypeptide
definition: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide.

label: encodes_different_polypeptides_different_stop
definition: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different stop codons.

label: encodes_overlapping_peptides_different_start
definition: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different start codons.

label: encodes_disjoint_polypeptides
definition: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that do not have overlapping peptide sequences.

label: encodes_overlapping_polypeptides_different_start_and_stop
definition: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different start and stop codons.

label: encodes_overlapping_peptides
definition: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences.

label: cryptogene
definition: A maxicircle gene so extensively edited that it cannot be matched to its edited mRNA sequence.

label: dicistronic_primary_transcript
definition: A primary transcript that has the quality dicistronic.

label: member_of_regulon
definition: A gene that is a member of a group of genes that are either regulated or transcribed together.

label: CDS_independently_known
definition: A CDS with the evidence status of being independently known.

label: orphan_CDS
definition: A CDS whose predicted amino acid sequence is unsupported by any experimental evidence or by any match with any other known sequence.

label: CDS_supported_by_domain_match_data
definition: A CDS that is supported by domain similarity.

label: CDS_supported_by_sequence_similarity_data
definition: A CDS that is supported by sequence similarity data.

label: CDS_predicted
definition: A CDS that is predicted.

label: CDS_supported_by_EST_or_cDNA_data
definition: A CDS that is supported by similarity to EST or cDNA data.

label: internal_Shine_Dalgarno_sequence
definition: A Shine-Dalgarno sequence that stimulates recoding through interactions with the anti-Shine-Dalgarno in the RNA of small ribosomal subunits of translating ribosomes. The signal is only operative in Bacteria.

label: recoded_mRNA
definition: The sequence of a mature mRNA transcript, modified before translation or during translation, usually by special cis-acting signals.

label: minus_1_translationally_frameshifted
definition: An attribute describing a translational frameshift of -1.

label: plus_1_translationally_frameshifted
definition: An attribute describing a translational frameshift of +1.

label: mRNA_recoded_by_translational_bypass
definition: A recoded_mRNA where translation was suspended at a particular codon and resumed at a particular non-overlapping downstream codon.

label: mRNA_recoded_by_codon_redefinition
definition: A recoded_mRNA that was modified by an alteration of codon meaning.

label: recoding_stimulatory_region
definition: A site in an mRNA sequence that stimulates the recoding of a region in the same mRNA.

label: four_bp_start_codon
definition: A non-canonical start codon with 4 base pairs.

label: archaeal_intron
definition: An intron characteristic of Archaeal tRNA and rRNA genes, where intron transcript generates a bulge-helix-bulge motif that is recognised by a splicing endoribonuclease.

label: tRNA_intron
definition: An intron found in tRNA that is spliced via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation rather than transesterification.

label: CTG_start_codon
definition: A non-canonical start codon of sequence CTG.

label: SECIS_element
definition: The incorporation of selenocysteine into a protein sequence is directed by an in-frame UGA codon (usually a stop codon) within the coding region of the mRNA. Selenoprotein mRNAs contain a conserved secondary structure in the 3' UTR that is required for the distinction of UGA stop from UGA selenocysteine. The selenocysteine insertion sequence (SECIS) is around 60 nt in length and adopts a hairpin structure which is sufficiently well-defined and conserved to act as a computational screen for selenoprotein genes.

label: retron
definition: Sequence coding for a short, single-stranded, DNA sequence via a retrotransposed RNA intermediate; characteristic of some microbial genomes.

label: three_prime_recoding_site
definition: The recoding stimulatory signal located downstream of the recoding site.

label: three_prime_stem_loop_structure
definition: A recoding stimulatory region, the stem-loop secondary structural element is downstream of the redefined region.

label: five_prime_recoding_site
definition: The recoding stimulatory signal located upstream of the recoding site.

label: flanking_three_prime_quadruplet_recoding_signal
definition: Four base pair sequence immediately downstream of the redefined region. The redefined region is a frameshift site. The quadruplet is 2 overlapping codons.

label: UAG_stop_codon_signal
definition: A stop codon signal for a UAG stop codon redefinition.

label: UAA_stop_codon_signal
definition: A stop codon signal for a UAA stop codon redefinition.

label: regulon
definition: A set of units of gene expression directly regulated by a common set of one or more common regulatory gene products.

label: UGA_stop_codon_signal
definition: A stop codon signal for a UGA stop codon redefinition.

label: three_prime_repeat_recoding_signal
definition: A recoding stimulatory signal, downstream sequence important for recoding that contains repetitive elements.

label: distant_three_prime_recoding_signal
definition: A recoding signal that is found many hundreds of nucleotides 3' of a redefined stop codon.

label: stop_codon_signal
definition: A recoding stimulatory signal that is a stop codon and has effect on efficiency of recoding.

label: databank_entry
definition: The sequence referred to by an entry in a databank such as GenBank or SwissProt.

label: gene_segment
definition: A gene component region which acts as a recombinational unit of a gene whose functional form is generated through somatic recombination.
